Name: Download Button by JTA
Description: Click to download your selected columns as CSV — no setup, just data.
Long Summary: Click to download your selected columns as CSV — no setup, just data.
Description Full:
Overview:

The "Download Button by JTA" is a powerful custom visual for Power BI that enables users to export their selected data directly to CSV — quickly, easily, and without technical setup. Built with performance and flexibility in mind, it’s ideal for sharing insights beyond Power BI.

Key Features:

  • Large-Scale Export: Export from 300,000 rows and up to 15 columns of data to CSV with a single click.
  • User-Controlled Output: Only the columns added by the user are included — what you see is what you export.
  • Customizable UI: Adapt the button’s style and layout to seamlessly match your report’s design.

Benefits:

  • Bypass Power BI Limits: Overcome the platform’s built-in export restrictions for large tables.
  • Enable Deeper Analysis: Empower end-users to continue their exploration outside Power BI using familiar CSV tools like Excel or Python.
  • Frictionless Sharing: Make it easy for viewers to access curated data slices without needing edit access or DAX expertise.

Constraints:

The custom visual leverages the browser’s cache memory. It works by fetching data in chunks of 30k rows, storing each chunk in the browser's cache until the entire dataset is compiled for download. This incremental approach requires the use of browser memory to ensure seamless processing. Unfortunately, this means that the visual does not operate as intended in Power BI Desktop due to technical constraints and security restrictions within that environment and you must use the Power BI Service.

For the very same reason, there's a possibility that it may encounter limitations or restrictions in certain browsers. Each browser has its own set of security measures and permissions that can affect how our visual operates.

Get in Touch:

If you have any questions, requests, feedback, or simply want to share your thoughts, feel free to contact us at custom.visuals@thedatascientists.com. We’d love to hear from you.

Tutorial:

  • 1. Create a measure with the number of lines you want to download.
  • 2. Add it to the "Number of Lines" field.
  • 3. Add all the columns you wish to download to the "Columns" field.
  • 4. Click on the Download button.
  • 5. Await while the request is processed.
  • 6. Copy the provided link from the opened window.
  • 7. Open a new URL window and paste the copied link into the address bar.
  • 8. Press "Enter" to start the download process.
  • 9. You will observe an Excel file being downloaded containing the requested data.

If you liked what you saw, you can try it for yourself and find more information here.

Name: TwoWriteBack
Description: 2WriteBack Visual for Power BI: Seamless Data Entry and Writeback
Long Summary: 2WriteBack Visual for Power BI: Seamless Data Entry and Writeback
Description Full:
Unlock the full potential of your Power BI reports with the 2WriteBack Visual, a powerful tool that enables seamless data entry and writeback directly within Power BI. 
This innovative visual allows you to write back data to any database using a REST API interface, providing a streamlined solution for data management and reporting.

Key Features:
- Direct Data Entry: Empower users to enter and update data directly within Power BI, eliminating the need to switch between applications.
- Flexible Integration: Write back data to any database, ensuring compatibility with your existing infrastructure.
- REST API Interface: Utilize a robust REST API for secure and efficient data transfer.

Licensing Information:
To enable the writeback functionality, a license is required. Our flexible licensing model includes:

Per User License: Priced at CHF 20 per month, this license is ideal for small teams and individual users.
Tenant-Wide License: For organizations with 25 or more users, we offer a comprehensive tenant-wide license. This option removes any restrictions on the number of users or reports, ensuring maximum flexibility and scalability for your business. Please contact our sales team.

Experience the convenience of direct data entry within Power BI and optimize your workflow with the 2WriteBack Visual. Get your license today and start transforming the way you manage data.

Name: Edit Grid
Description: Excel like table that allow users to view and change the data, and save it to a SQL Server table.
Long Summary: Excel like table that allow users to view and change the data, and save it to a SQL Server table.
Description Full:
The Edit Grid consists of two components:
Front-end: A Power BI custom visual that displays data in an Excel-like format. The administrator can define a valid list of values to be displayed in the grid.
Back-end: The Power BI custom visual sends modified data to a backend application, which then saves the data to a SQL Server database.

Edit Grid requires a license for full implementation. Please contact sales@softclouds.com for pricing. A quote will be provided which covers the license for the Edit Grid visual, Edit Grid API Server, training, and support.  Training will be provided by SoftCloud's Professional Services team. Professional Services will assist with the installation and configuration of the API Server as well as best practices for both the visual and API server.

The sc.pbix file contains Edit Grid 1.0.1.8 and the out of the box Power BI Table visual. Double clicking on any row in Edit Grid will filter the other table. Double clicking on the same row in Edit Grid again will remove the filter.

Name: KPI Tree
Description: Visualize and Explore Key Metrics Hierarchically with KPI Tree.
Long Summary: Visualize and Explore Key Metrics Hierarchically with KPI Tree.
Description Full:
KPI Tree is a powerful visual that lets you display multiple KPI cards in an expandable and collapsible hierarchy—perfect for showing how key metrics are distributed and aggregated across organizational structures, product lines, regions, or any multi-level category.

Instead of a flat layout or matrix, KPI Tree organizes your KPIs into a dynamic tree view, making it easy to drill down through hierarchical levels for detail or collapse branches to maintain a clean overview. Each node in the tree represents a KPI card, which can display actual and target values (or any two comparable measures), along with a visual indicator that highlights the variance—ranging from directional symbols to customizable icons.

For additional insight, each card can include mini charts that visualize trends for actual and target values or their variance over time.

KPI Tree is fully interactive: selecting any node can filter or highlight other visuals in your report. The visual adapts dynamically to your data model and supports extensive formatting options for KPI cards and indicators—ensuring clarity and impact even in large, complex structures.

Whether you want to track performance across business units or explore KPIs by category and subcategory, KPI Tree gives you a structured, intuitive way to present key metrics in context.

Sample use cases:

  • Organizational chart (Org chart)
  • Decomposition tree
  • Expandable and collapsable KPI cards

Name: DoctorViz - Timeline Events
Description: Overlay key events on trends to explain data shifts and anomalies for deeper insights
Long Summary: Overlay key events on trends to explain data shifts and anomalies for deeper insights
Description Full:
Timeline Events is a Power BI visual designed to bring clarity and context to your data by overlaying key events directly on the trendline. It helps you uncover the why behind performance changes, spikes, drops, and anomalies—making it easier to explain trends with clear cause-and-effect relationships.

Whether you're analyzing sales, operations, marketing, or financial performance, Timeline Events lets you map impactful moments—like campaign launches, regulation changes, system outages, product releases, or market shifts—onto time-series data to visualize their direct influence.

You're in full control of the look and feel: customize event markers, labels, tooltips, and layout to match your narrative. Use rich formatting options to highlight critical milestones or categorize events by type or importance.

Perfect for executive dashboards or any report where storytelling matters, Timeline Events transforms data exploration into insight by turning trends into stories you can see and explain.

Name: Indented Tree Chart by Umbu Solutions
Description: Interactive Power BI visual for exploring hierarchical data with columns and expandable nodes.
Long Summary: Interactive Power BI visual for exploring hierarchical data with columns and expandable nodes.
Description Full:
Visualize Hierarchies with Clarity and Control in Power BI

Designed for enterprise users working with complex hierarchies — such as project structures — our Indented Tree Chart visual for Power BI offers a clean, interactive way to explore nested data structures with unmatched flexibility.

Key Benefits & Features

  • Clear Hierarchical View: Display any tree-structured dataset—like work breakdown structures, project phases, or asset hierarchies—in an intuitive, indented layout.
  • Expand & Collapse Nodes: Navigate large trees with ease by collapsing or expanding individual branches, focusing only on the areas that matter most.
  • Additional Context at a Glance: Display custom columns alongside the tree structure to provide contextual data such as cost, duration, owner, or priority—without switching visuals.
  • Seamless Power BI Integration: Supports selection and highlighting to work fluidly with other visuals in your report, enabling detailed, cross-filtered analysis.
  • Fully Customizable: Adapt the visual to your reporting style using the formatting pane — adjust display options with ease.
  • Designed for Performance: Built to handle large structures with minimal performance impact, ideal for enterprise-scale reporting environments.
  • Bookmark & Context Menu Support: Works seamlessly with Power BI bookmarks and context menus for efficient navigation and storytelling.

Getting Started

  1. Try It For Free & Download the Sample Report: Explore the Indented Tree visual in Power BI Desktop at no cost—download the sample file and see it in action.
  2. Connect Your Data: Hook up your structure dataset to the visual for instant, personalized insights.
  3. Customize Formatting: Use the Power BI formatting pane to tweak colors, fonts, etc. to fit your report style.
  4. Assign Licenses: While Desktop use is free, a license is required to share the visual via Power BI Service—distribute licenses to your report builders and viewers.
  5. Publish & Share: Publish your report to Power BI Service and collaborate with stakeholders across your organization.
  6. Seek Assistance: Have questions or need advanced customizations? Reach out for support anytime.

Name: SPC Visual
Description: SPC - Statistical process control, Cp(k)/Pp(k) acc. ISO 22514, supporting online/realtime operation.
Long Summary: SPC - Statistical process control, Cp(k)/Pp(k) acc. ISO 22514, supporting online/realtime operation.
Description Full:
SPC- Statistical Process Control as a foundational tool of Six Sigma methodology, is a technique utilized in manufacturing and process industries to monitor, control, and improve processes by employing statistical methods. The primary objective of SPC is to ensure that processes operate efficiently and consistently, producing high-quality output while minimizing variation.

SPC apply statistical probability theory to monitor process fluctuations and to keep them under control.
One of the main metrics in SPC is the Process Performance Index (Ppk) or its short term equivalent Process Capability Index (Cpk). Both are powerful statistical measure to assess the performance and capability of a process. They quantifies the process’s ability to meet specifications and provides insights into how well a process can consistently produce results within specified limits.

Ppk/Cpk helps quality professionals and process engineers assess process performance. It ensures products or services meet customer expectations and maintain a competitive edge. The SPC Visual calculates the Pp(k)/Cp(k) values according to ISO 22514 norm considering different probability distributions such as normal, weilbull, exponential, beta, logistic, gamma, cauchy, ..etc.

History / Versions:

  • 1.0 First version.
    Integrates: Individual chart, Capability chart, Probability chart, Moving range chart, Distribution estimation (according to ISO 22514 norm).
  • 1.0.1 Integration of SPC rules
    Integrates eight SPC rules according to Nelson rule set, allowing to detect "out-of-control" patterns within the individuals chart.
  • 1.1 Integration of online/real-time spc capability.
    This feature allows to differentiate between various value categories (product categories) mixed in one measure, enabling process operators to utilize the visual in real-time environment.
  • 1.2 Integration of action log.
    This feature enables the visualization of actions within Individuals chart. In addition, distribution model approximation can consider the last action event helping to take into account the effects of actions on the distribution model.
  • 1.3 Integration of progression analysis.
    This feature allows to separate data in segments and to analyze how main key performance indicators such as Cpk/Cp develop between the segments. The parameters of the distribution model are adjusted automatically for each segment according to data set belonging to the segment, whereby the distribution model type is retained. Please notice, the segments can be build also based on action events.
  • 1.4 Integration of Ppk and Pp values.
    From this version, Ppk and Pp values are integrated in the visual. As the distinction between Ppk and Cpk or between Pp and Cp is based solely on the period under consideration, the differentiation within the visual is made as follows:
    • Ppk/Pk values are calculated based on data set called {Model data}.
      This data is used to estimate the distribution model and can be specified within "SPC Settings/Distribution approximation" settings.
    • Cpk/Cp values are calculated based on data set called {View data}.
      This data is the visible data in the Individuals chart. The period of {View data} sample set can be specified within "General settings/Show n last points" settings.
    Please consider, for the calculation of Cpk/Cp values the distribution model parameters are adjusted according to {View data} data set. That means the type of distribution model (e.g. weibull) is equall for Ppk and Cpk, but the parameters of the distriution model might differentiate according to the corresponding data set (View vs. Model). By default the Cpk/Cp values are equal with Ppk/Pp values, because {View data} option is disabled in default setup. Please adapt it to enable the differentiation.

Comments or questions:

Please don't hesitate to contact us at www.nextgen-industries.com

More insights:

Please check our YouTube channel (www.youtube.com/@NextGenIndustries) and our WebSite (www.nextgen-industries.com) for more details.

Name: Project Org Chart by Umbu Solutions
Description: Dynamic, scalable org chart visual for Power BI that auto-syncs and fits complex teams on one page.
Long Summary: Dynamic, scalable org chart visual for Power BI that auto-syncs and fits complex teams on one page.
Description Full:
Project Org Chart Visual for Power BI

Bring clarity to your project team structure with a fully dynamic, data‑driven org chart—always up‑to‑date and completely customizable.

For project managers and PMOs in medium to large enterprises, our Project Org Chart Visual for Power BI eliminates manual updates by syncing directly to your data model, so your reports always reflect the current hierarchy and roles without extra effort.

Key Benefits & Features

  • Dynamic Sync & Real‑Time Updates: Changes to team structures, roles, or responsibilities in your data are instantly reflected—no more stale, static diagrams.
  • Unlimited Hierarchy Levels: Model multi‑tiered organizations with ease. Assign both primary and supporting roles at any level to capture complex governance and project reporting lines.
  • One‑Page Scaling for Export: Automatically scales your entire org chart to fit on a single Power BI report page—ideal for exporting to PowerPoint or PDF. Other visuals often overflow; ours keeps everything visible at a glance.
  • Customizable Styling & Theming: Match your corporate branding by tweaking backgrounds, colors, and category labels via the Power BI formatting pane to ensure seamless integration.
  • Advanced Role & Stakeholder Mapping: Define and visualize multiple roles—Project Leads, Finance, Legal, HSE, and more—using color‑coded categories to highlight departments, responsibilities, or custom classifications.
  • Scales with Your Organization: Whether it’s a single project team or a program, the visual handles small to mega‑scale structures without performance degradation.
  • Interactive Exploration: Leverage Power BI’s native selection, highlighting, bookmarks, and cross‑filtering to drill into individual roles or view your entire project ecosystem at a glance.

Getting Started

  1. Try It for Free & Download the Sample Report: Explore the Org Chart visual in Power BI Desktop at no cost—download the sample .pbix and see it in action.
  2. Connect Your Data: Hook up your team‑structure dataset to the visual for instant, personalized hierarchy views.
  3. Customize Formatting: Use the Power BI formatting pane to tweak colors, shapes, and labels to fit your report style.
  4. Assign Licenses: Desktop use is free, but a license is required to share the visual via Power BI Service—distribute licenses to your report builders and viewers.
  5. Publish & Share: Publish your report to Power BI Service and collaborate with stakeholders across your organization.
  6. Seek Assistance: Have questions or need advanced customizations? Reach out for support anytime.
Keywords: Organization,Hierarchy,Structure,Project Org Chart by Umbu Solutions

Name: Paginated HTML table
Description: Fully customizable table visual with HTML support, images, custom sorting and advanced styling
Long Summary: Fully customizable table visual with HTML support, images, custom sorting and advanced styling
Description Full:
Custom HTML Table Visual for Power BI is a powerful and flexible visual that enables you to display your data in a highly customizable tabular format. Whether you're looking to style your data presentation with HTML and CSS, include images, or offer advanced sorting and interactivity, this visual provides the control and features needed for a polished user experience.

🔧 Key Features:
  1. HTML Markup Support: Customize the content of each cell using standard HTML and CSS, giving you full control over text formatting and structure.
  2. Image Rendering: Display images directly inside the table when image URLs are provided, including optional fallback images.
  3. Custom CSS Styling: Apply your own CSS rules to style rows, cells, or entire tables with precise control.
  4. Pagination: Support for pagination with fully customizable page sizes, supporting up to 300,000 rows.
  5. Empty State Handling: Define custom messages or HTML for when there is no data available.
  6. Custom Sorting: Users can define custom sorting for columns by columns or measures.
  7. Identity Columns for Drilldown: Seamlessly enable drillthrough navigation by passing identity columns — even if they are not displayed in the table.
This visual is open-source, free to use - always!
Keywords: Paginated table,HTML & CSS support,Paginated HTML table

Name: Revenue Filter by JTA
Description: Smarter Revenue Filtering – Designed for Precision and Ease
Long Summary: Smarter Revenue Filtering – Designed for Precision and Ease
Description Full:
Revenue Filter by JTA – A Data Scientist’s Visualization Tool

Smarter Revenue Filtering – Designed for Precision and Ease

Overview

Revenue Filter is a custom Power BI visual designed to provide a more intuitive and flexible way to filter reports based on revenue columns. Instead of the traditional slider slicer, users can apply Excel-style filtering logic directly within Power BI.

Choose from a dropdown with filtering conditions such as Greater Than, Less Than, Equals, Between, and more. Then, simply input a value to filter your data accordingly. The filter is clearly displayed, allowing for easier understanding and interaction.

Whether you're a data analyst, business user, or finance professional, Revenue Filter enhances your ability to analyze and interact with revenue data in a simple, clear, and powerful way.

Who Is It For?

  • Data Analysts who need precise control over numeric filters.
  • Business Users familiar with Excel who want the same filtering ease in Power BI.
  • Report Creators aiming to improve user experience with cleaner filtering visuals.

Customer Need Addressed

The native Power BI slider slicer can be imprecise and visually unclear, especially for numeric fields like revenue. Revenue Filter solves this by offering an Excel-style filtering experience, making it clear which filters are applied and enabling more control over the report output.

Key Features

  • Excel-like Filtering Options: Choose from conditions such as Greater Than, Less Than, Equals, Between, etc.
  • User-Friendly Interface: Quickly understand and adjust filtering with dropdowns and input fields.
  • Customizable Design: Match the visual’s colors, layout, and text to your report branding.
  • Editable Display Text: Customize instructional or placeholder text for your users.
  • Default Settings: Set default filter types and values to guide users effectively.

If you have any questions, reach out to us at custom.visuals@thedatascientists.com.

Name: accoMASTERDATA - Writeback, MDM, Masterdata, Table
Description: A masterdata edit visual tool with writeback in Power BI
Long Summary: A masterdata edit visual tool with writeback in Power BI
Description Full:
Visual with writeback directly in Power BI for Masterdata management

Edit and save data directly in Power BI

If you experience issues with the buy and transaction though AppSource please contact us for alternative ways to purchase licenses.

accoMASTERDATA easily embeds a powerful data edit tool directly into Power BI. Also, it allows write-back to various data sources directly from within the tool. Quick and easy project management, Master data, Comments and analysis.

WHY accoMASTERDATA?
If you want to optimize and professionalize any master data process that requires manual input from your employees, then accoMASTERDATA can help you. accoMASTERDATA is a simple and very flexible solution based on Power BI functionality. It can support any process that requires values, text or date/time input from employees around the organization. As an integral part of Power BI, you have many options to customize your master data solution according to your needs - both technically and visually. At the same time, you avoid users need to switch system when they need to budget and plan and in the next moment check their daily reporting.

WHAT IS accoMASTERDATA?
accoMASTERDATA addresses the necessary data edit process but bypasses the issues that attach to the major Masterdata tools. With accoMASTERDATA you get a cheap and extremely fast implemented reporting solution that uses the agility and data security of Power BI. Via accoMASTERDATA, users can provide input to the underlying data model e.g. in a Product master data creation and maintenance process. The built-in Power BI security model ensures that entry users will only see the subset of data that pertains to them. The effect of the entries will immediately be visualized on the graphic objects, which provides a better overview.

REQUIREMENTS
(1) Requires Microsoft Power BI (https://powerbi.microsoft.com)
(2) To be able to save data, you need to access to a SQL table for writeback functionality
(3) A license for accoMASTERDATA

HOW TO
accoMASTERDATA is a Power BI custom visualization that can be downloaded directly from Power BI though Microsoft App. The solution gives you a simple way to off loaded your master data in Power BI (Writeback). The only additional thing you need is a place for storing your writeback data and a License key. Data needs to be stored in a SQL table in an Azure Database.

SUPPORTED FEATURES
• Insert/delete/update row
• Adjust data -> numbers, Boolean, text or date/time
• Row level comments
• Locking cells/columns based on conditions
• Dynamic or static dropdown based on DAX logic
• Edit/read only mode
• Custom column calculations (absolute and relative)
• Power BI native-like design
• Row Level Security
• Audit logs
• Extended data input validations using regular expressions

POPULAR USE CASES
• Master Data maintenance
• Handling of payables receivables
• Status confirmation
• Row level comments
• Ad-hoc dimensions and extended metadata to existing dimensions.

MAIN BENEFITS OF accoMASTERDATA
• Use any existing Power BI model
• Supports all DAX calculations
• Benefit from your existing Power BI knowledge and resource
• No servers and no need for additional applications or interfaces
• No need to train people in new systems
• Benefit from current and future enhancements of Power BI
• Simple and easy maintenance
• Low cost
• Will work where powerbi.com works

For more information and pricing, please visit https://www.accotool.com


Currently this visual in not compatible with the Safari browser on MacOS.

Description: Visual with writeback directly in Power BI for planning, master data (MDM), budgeting, forecasting
Long Summary: Visual with writeback directly in Power BI for planning, master data (MDM), budgeting, forecasting
Description Full:
Planning & forecasting directly in Power BI

If you experience issues with the buy and transaction though AppSource please contact us for alternative ways to purchase licenses.

A planning and forecasting visual tool with writeback in Power BI.

accoPLANNING easily embeds a powerful planning tool directly into Power BI. Also, it allows write-back to various data sources directly from within the tool. Quick and easy project management, financial planning, budgeting, forecasting and analysis.

WHY ACCOPLANNING?
If you want to optimize and professionalize any planning process that requires manual input from your employees, then accoPLANNING can help you. accoPLANNING is a simple and very flexible solution based on Power BI functionality. It can support any process that requires values, text or date/time input from employees around the organization. As an integral part of Power BI, you have many options to customize your budget and planning solution according to your needs - both technically and visually. At the same time, you avoid users need to switch system when they need to budget and plan and in the next moment check their daily reporting.

WHAT IS ACCOPLANNING?
accoPLANNING addresses the necessary planning process but bypasses the issues that attach to the major financial EPM tools. With accoPLANNING you get a cheap and extremely fast implemented reporting solution that uses the agility and data security of Power BI. Via accoPLANNING, users can provide input to the underlying data model e.g. in a sales budgeting process. The built-in Power BI security model ensures that entry users will only see the subset of data that pertains to them. The effect of the entries will immediately be visualized on the graphic objects, which provides a better overview.

REQUIREMENTS
(1) Requires Microsoft Power BI (https://powerbi.microsoft.com)
(2) To be able to save data, you need to access to a SQL table for writeback functionality
(3) A license for accoPLANNING

HOW TO
accoPLANNING is a Power BI custom visualization that can be downloaded directly from Power BI though Microsoft App. The solution gives you a simple way to off loaded your planning data in Power BI (Writeback). The only additional thing you need is a place for storing your writeback data and a License key. Data need to be stored in a SQL table in an Azure Database (starting at 5$/month).

MAIN BENEFITS OF ACCOPLANNING
• Use any existing Power BI model
• Supports all DAX calculations
• Benefit from your existing Power BI knowledge and resource
• No servers and no need for additional applications or interfaces
• No need to train people in new systems
• Benefit from current and future enhancements of Power BI
• Simple and easy maintenance
• Low cost
• Will work where powerbi.com works

For more information and pricing, please visit https://www.accotool.com

Name: Marginal Abatement Cost Curve
Description: A two-dimensional bar chart to compare the cost and impact of different measures
Long Summary: A two-dimensional bar chart to compare the cost and impact of different measures
Description Full:
Visualise the impact and compare the cost of different policy options. For example, you can illustrate the cost-effectiveness of measures to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by plotting the marginal cost per tonne of CO₂-equivalent avoided against the volume of abatement each measure can deliver.

Marginal abatement cost curves can be used for:
	•	Policy prioritisation: identifying which options should be implemented first (typically those with the lowest or negative costs).
	•	Scenario modelling: estimating total abatement potential at various carbon price levels.
	•	Budget allocation: guiding public or private investments towards the most cost-efficient decarbonisation pathways.
	•	Environmental planning: informing Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), long-term climate policy strategies, or sectoral decarbonisation roadmaps.

Name: Arc Diagram
Description: Arc Diagram by VisioChart: Simplifying complex links into graceful arcs
Long Summary: Arc Diagram by VisioChart: Simplifying complex links into graceful arcs
Description Full:
Arc Diagram

An Arc Diagram is a powerful and elegant data visualization used to display relationships or connections between entities. It is especially effective when the goal is to identify patterns, clusters, or repeated links within a sequence of nodes. Each node is positioned along a single axis, and relationships between them are illustrated as arcs that connect pairs of nodes.

Key Features

  • Minimal and clean layout ideal for spotting patterns.
  • Arcs represent connections, allowing for quick visual correlation.
  • Helps to identify clusters, symmetry, and recurring patterns.
  • Ideal for both directed and undirected relationships.

Data Requirements

The Arc Diagram requires the following data fields:

  • Dimension 1 (Source Node): The origin of a connection or entity.
  • Dimension 2 (Target Node): The destination or linked entity.
  • Measure: A numeric value representing the strength, frequency, or weight of the relationship between source and target.

How It Works

Nodes (categories or items from the dimensions) are placed along a linear axis, typically in the order they appear or sorted by a relevant criterion. For every pair of connected nodes, an arc is drawn from the source to the target. The arc's size or thickness may correspond to the numeric measure, conveying the intensity of the connection.

Use Cases

  • Network Analysis: Displaying social media connections, email communication paths, or interrelated websites.
  • Biological Systems: Mapping protein or gene interactions.
  • Financial Flows: Visualizing transfers between accounts or business entities.
  • Customer Journey: Understanding transitions between states, pages, or phases in a workflow.
  • Telecommunications: Exploring calling patterns or data exchanges between regions.

Advantages

  • Compact representation: Efficiently shows a large number of connections.
  • Pattern discovery: Makes it easy to spot symmetrical links and repeating structures.
  • Customizable layout: Node order can be adjusted to emphasize specific patterns.
  • Scalable: Works well with medium-sized datasets and is readable at a glance.

Best Practices

  • Sort or group nodes meaningfully to reduce visual clutter and enhance pattern recognition.
  • Use arc size or color gradients to indicate strength or importance of relationships.
  • Limit the number of arcs displayed at once to avoid overplotting.
  • Consider interactive tooltips to show additional details on hover.

Limitations

  • Not suitable for very large or dense networks with too many links.
  • Does not depict directional flow unless additional cues are added.
  • Interpretation can be challenging without good node arrangement.

When to Use

Choose an Arc Diagram when you need a visually appealing and focused way to display the relationships between pairs of entities, especially when the relationships are not spatial but logical or categorical. It's ideal for emphasizing frequency, symmetry, or centrality in networks where clarity is critical and where layout aesthetics enhance understanding.

Conclusion

The Arc Diagram is a visually elegant chart that makes relationship data more accessible and insightful. By requiring only two categorical dimensions and one measure, it simplifies complex connection structures into a graceful layout, helping users find meaningful patterns, trends, and clusters at a glance.
Keywords: Arc Diagram,Power BI Arc Diagram,Arc Chart,Arc Diagram

Name: Tabulator
Description: The Tabulator Custom Visual is a powerful tool to enhance your reports
Long Summary: The Tabulator Custom Visual is a powerful tool to enhance your reports
Description Full:
The Tabulator Custom Visual offers a comprehensive set of tools for creating interactive and customizable tables within your Power BI reports. This versatile visual tool allows you to import and bind data from your Power BI dataset, ensuring that your tables remain up-to-date as your data changes. 
You have the flexibility to define columns with various data types, titles, and formatting options, and the ability to group data based on specific criteria, providing users with a structured view of the information. Data sorting and filtering options enhance data exploration, and data pagination improves navigation and performance with large datasets. You can apply custom formatting to cell content, implement conditional formatting to highlight important data, and allow users to resize columns for better readability. Row selection and row click events provide further user interaction, and you can even create custom cell editors for in-place data editing. The Tabulator Custom Visual supports localization to cater to diverse audiences and enables data export to various formats. It also offers data validation, interactivity features like row deletion and reordering, and the ability to utilize custom JavaScript functions and callbacks for advanced interactions. With these features, you can create dynamic and interactive tables tailored to your specific data visualization needs in Power BI.

Description: A spiral plot chart visualizes data in a continuous spiral to show trends with respect to time.
Long Summary: A spiral plot chart visualizes data in a continuous spiral to show trends with respect to time.
Description Full:
Spiral Plot by Office Solution

The Spiral Plot by Office Solution transforms traditional data representation into an engaging and insightful visual experience. The Spiral Plot provides a comprehensive view of your data, revealing cyclical patterns, trends, and deviations over time. Whether you need an overview of your dataset or a detailed analysis of specific data points, our Spiral Plot equips you with the insights you need for effective decision-making.

Key Benefits

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: The spiral design enhances the readability of data points, making it easy to identify trends, peaks, and troughs over time.
  • Compact Layout: The spiral arrangement maximizes space utilization, allowing for the display of large datasets within a limited area.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Efficiently manages extensive datasets, ensuring smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Color-Coded Data Points: Easily distinguish data points with customizable color-coding based on specific criteria.

Premium Features:

  • Customizable Dimensions: Adjustable chart dimensions fit various screen sizes and layouts, providing flexibility and adaptability.
  • Interactive Elements: Hovering over data points reveals detailed tooltips with precise values and additional insights, enhancing user interaction.
  • Point of Cross-Selection: Interactive cross-selection capability allows users to click on data points to highlight related information, facilitating detailed exploration and analysis.
  • Logo Removal: Premium version supports the removal of branding for seamless integration into corporate environments.
  • Top N Selection: Based on the "x axis data," display top N data points by selecting or typing through the dropdown menu, allowing for focused analysis on critical data points.

Real and Practical Use Cases

Project Management:

  • Task Progress: Monitor the progress of various tasks over time, ensuring that all activities are on track and within the expected timelines.

Sales and Marketing:

  • Campaign Performance: Analyze the performance of marketing campaigns over time, identifying periods of high engagement or sales spikes.

Finance and Economics:

Premium Features:

Name: Financial Risk & Liquidity Flow Matrix
Description: Forecasting and stock risk calculation predicts inventory needs and assesses supply risks.
Long Summary: Forecasting and stock risk calculation predicts inventory needs and assesses supply risks.
Description Full:
Financial Risk & Opportunity Matrix – Custom Power BI Visual

Objective

This custom Power BI visual is designed to assess financial health across departments or investments by plotting risk versus opportunity in a 2x2 matrix. It supports scenario analysis, strategic decision-making, and prioritization of actions based on financial impact and potential gains. The visual includes filtering, license validation, and CSV export features to empower business users with rich insights.

Key Elements of the Visual Logic

User Inputs

The visual accepts multiple inputs from the Power BI interface through dropdowns, filters, and license input fields:

  • Risk and Opportunity Selection (riskMetric, opportunityMetric): Users select metrics for the X (Risk) and Y (Opportunity) axes.
  • Dropdown Filters: These filters allow users to limit data to specific categories:
    • Business Units
    • Departments
    • Investment Types
    • Time Periods
  • License Input Field: Enables premium features like data export and advanced interactivity when a valid license is entered.

Quadrant Classification

The visual places each data point in a quadrant based on its risk and opportunity values:

  • Quadrant I (Top Right): High Risk and High Opportunity – Strategic but risky.
  • Quadrant II (Top Left): Low Risk and High Opportunity – Ideal investments.
  • Quadrant III (Bottom Left): Low Risk and Low Opportunity – Stable, low-impact.
  • Quadrant IV (Bottom Right): High Risk and Low Opportunity – Avoid or reevaluate.

Visual Rendering Logic

The chart uses D3 or SVG to dynamically render data points:

  • Shapes and Colors: Points are colored and shaped based on category or business unit.
  • Tooltip on Hover: Shows relevant data like:
    • Business Name
    • Risk Score
    • Opportunity Score
  • Responsive Layout: Automatically adapts to canvas size in Power BI reports.

Filtering and Interaction

  • Interactive Filtering: Dropdowns and slicers allow users to isolate key segments of the data.
  • License-Gated Features: Export and filtering are disabled until a valid license is validated.

License Validation

  • Decryption Logic: A pre-shared encrypted key is decrypted and matched to activate premium features.
  • Feature Control: If the license is invalid, dropdowns and buttons are hidden from the UI.

Output: Matrix View

The matrix chart is interactive and updates as the user changes input. It shows:

  • Positioning of each item on the Risk vs. Opportunity matrix
  • Shape and color coding for business category or investment type
  • Dynamic tooltip with key financial metrics

Detailed Breakdown of Returned Data

  • Risk Score: Numerical value placed on the X-axis to represent exposure or volatility.
  • Opportunity Score: Value on the Y-axis indicating growth or return potential.
  • Quadrant Allocation: The visual categorizes each point into one of four quadrants based on its score combination.
  • Category: The department, unit, or investment type used for grouping.
  • Color: Visual distinction applied based on the category.
  • Tooltip Data: Includes all key metrics shown on hover.
  • Filtered Data: Reflects dropdown selections and only shows relevant points.
  • Export Data: Allows CSV download of currently filtered and plotted data if the license is valid.

Key Concepts in Financial Visualization

  • Risk-Opportunity Matrix: A visual method to categorize business cases or departments by comparing downside and upside.
  • Strategic Decision Support: Helps finance teams focus on investments that are safe and lucrative, while avoiding high-risk low-yield areas.
  • Data Interactivity: Power BI integration enables user-driven insights through interactivity and filtering.
Keywords: Financial Risk & Opportunity Matrix,Financial Risk & Opportunity Matrix for power bi , power bi Financial Risk & Opportunity Matrix,Financial Risk & Liquidity Flow Matrix

Name: constellation
Description: Visualize complex networks of interconnected data using a force-directed graph
Long Summary: Visualize complex networks of interconnected data using a force-directed graph
Description Full:
Spot critical relationships and hidden dependencies in seconds using Constellation to simplify interconnected data into an easy to use and accessible Network Diagram.

Constellation for Power BI is a powerful visual designed to help you instantly uncover critical relationships and hidden dependencies in complex data. By transforming interconnected information into an interactive network diagram, Constellation enables users to visualize connections and patterns that would otherwise remain buried in traditional tabular views.

Built with accessibility and simplicity in mind, Constellation requires only three columns to function: Source, Target, and Distance. Additional columns can be used to customize links in the data and Formatting Parameters can be used to customize individual nodes.

Whether you’re mapping workflows, customer journeys, system dependencies, or any other web of relationships, Constellation helps you see the full picture with clarity. The visual aggregates source and target nodes into a single graph, allowing for intuitive exploration while maintaining analytical depth.

Designed specifically for Power BI, Constellation integrates seamlessly into your reports and dashboards, empowering decision-makers with interactive insights that reveal more than just numbers — they show connections.

Name: Multiparent-Tree Table - BI-Automation
Description: Visualize complex hierarchies with the Multiparent-Tree Table for unmatched data clarity
Long Summary: Visualize complex hierarchies with the Multiparent-Tree Table for unmatched data clarity
Description Full:
The Multiparent-Tree Table is ideal for displaying bills of materials or parts lists. It's designed for parent-child hierarchies and supports multiple parents and children for each element. As the only visual in Power BI capable of handling such relationships, it provides a clear and organized view of your data.

The visual resembles a standard Power BI table visualisation and allows users to scroll through the table and interact with the data by expanding and collapsing rows.

In addition, users can easily select items and customise the color and formatting to suit their needs.

The free version offers full support for any hierarchy level, but allows only one additional attribute. In the full version, there are no restrictions, enabling you to add multiple attributes such as part designations, price details, dates, and more.


Please download the example report using the "Download Sample" button for detailed setup instructions and a comprehensive explanation.



The Multiparent-Tree Table visual is a perfect fit for the manufacturing and retail industries. It can be utilized by operations managers, data analysts, product managers, and many others.

Name: Significant Variance
Description: Significant Variant analyzes KPI differences with statistical significance
Long Summary: Significant Variant analyzes KPI differences with statistical significance
Description Full:
Significant Variant

Quickly assess the statistical significance of differences on any KPI between two points.

Overview

Significant Variant allows you to evaluate the significance of differences between two variants of an A/B test, two periods of time, or virtually any scenario you'd like to compare.

The extension provides a variety of statistical tests to ensure accurate analysis, with the most appropriate test automatically selected based on your data and the type of comparison.

Key Features

  • Significance Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analyses to determine the statistical significance of changes in your data.
  • Automated Statistical Test Detection: Ensure the right test is applied to your data automatically.

Why Choose Significant Variant?

  • Easy Comparison: Define segments in the Comparison pill and choose the KPI to analyze in the Metric pill. Adjust significance levels and test parameters effortlessly.
  • Understand Statistical Significance: Learn when differences in your data are reliable and backed by robust statistical methods.
  • Robust Statistical Tests:
    • A/B Test Models: Welch t-test, Bayesian test, Bootstrap test.
    • Time Series Models: Volatility analysis, Causal impact analysis.
  • Flexibility and Automation: Automatically selects the most appropriate test for your data while allowing manual adjustments when needed.

Practical Example

Imagine you want to compare the performance of two marketing campaigns. Your KPI shows a difference, but is it statistically significant? With Significant Variant, you can instantly determine if the difference is meaningful using proven statistical models.

Get Started Today

Transform your data analysis with Significant Variant and make decisions based on statistically significant insights.

Discover more now

Name: demand_planning_by_office _solution
Description: Demand planning forecasts future demand to optimize inventory, minimizing stockouts and overstocking
Long Summary: Demand planning forecasts future demand to optimize inventory, minimizing stockouts and overstocking
Description Full:
Demand Planning: Forecasting and Stock Risk Calculation

Objective

This script is a part of a demand planning tool, designed to forecast sales based on historical data, sales adjustments, and various user inputs. It calculates sales projections and assesses potential stock risks by forecasting sales for different periods (e.g., quarterly, monthly, etc.), factoring in growth rates and inventory levels.

Key Elements of the Forecasting Logic

User Inputs

The function takes several parameters from the user interface (UI), such as dropdown menus, sliders, and input fields:

  • Period Selection (dropdownContainer4): User selects the period for forecasting (e.g., Quarterly, Monthly, Weekly, Daily).
  • Forecast Count (forecastCountInput): User specifies how many forecasting periods they want to project.
  • Growth Adjustment (sliderContainer): User adjusts a percentage to increase or decrease sales projections based on current performance.
  • Sales Data: Different dropdowns allow users to select:
    • Category Sales
    • Previous Sales
    • Current Sales
    • Inventory Levels

Sales Calculation

The core of the function is the calculation of future sales based on the following logic:

  • Adjusted Sales: Current sales are adjusted by a user-defined percentage (adjustmentPercentage).
  • Growth Rate: The growth rate is calculated based on the difference between previous and current sales. If there is no previous sales data, the growth rate is set to zero.
  • Period-Specific Sales: Based on the selected period (Quarterly, Monthly, etc.), the function divides the total sales for the next year into the appropriate number of periods:
    • Quarterly: Sales divided by 4
    • Monthly: Sales divided by 12
    • Weekly: Sales divided by 52
    • Daily: Sales divided by 365

Forecast Calculation

  • Forecast for Each Period: The function then forecasts sales for each selected period (e.g., Q1, Q2, etc.), applying the growth rate for each step. The forecast is generated by multiplying the previous period's forecast by the growth rate.

Stock Risk Calculation

  • Risk Assessment: Stock risk is calculated by comparing forecasted sales to the available inventory. For each forecasted period, it determines how much of the inventory will be used. If forecasted sales exceed available inventory, it calculates the percentage risk.
  • Inventory Update: The inventory is reduced by the forecasted sales for each period, providing an updated inventory level for future forecasting periods.

Output: Forecast Table

The function then generates a table using the renderTable function. This table displays:

  • Forecasted sales for each period
  • Stock risk (as a percentage of inventory)
  • Adjusted sales, growth rate, and the difference between current and previous sales

Detailed Breakdown of Returned Data

  • Category Sales: The specific sales data for the selected category.
  • Previous Sales: Sales data from the previous period.
  • Current Sales: Current sales data for the selected period.
  • Inventory Level: Remaining inventory after accounting for the forecasted sales.
  • Updated Sales: Sales projections after adjustment.
  • Growth Rate: The percentage change in sales based on previous and current sales.
  • Forecast Values: Projected sales for each forecast period (quarter, month, week, day).
  • Stock Risk: The calculated risk of stock shortages based on the forecasted sales and current inventory levels.
  • Forecast Percentage: The growth rate as a percentage for each forecast period.
  • Difference: The difference between current and previous sales, helping to identify how the forecasted sales deviate from past performance.

Key Concepts in Demand Planning

  • Sales Forecasting: The process of predicting futur
Keywords: Demand planning,Demand forcasting, Demand foracasting For powerbi,demand_planning_by_office _solution

Name: Felss DWH Writeback Table
Description: Advanced data editing and saving into a backend database using a simple table visual
Long Summary: Advanced data editing and saving into a backend database using a simple table visual
Description Full:
No more one-way data !

Change the game and unlock the value of your Power BI reports. Here is an offer to add your solution a professional level advanced feature !

Felss DWH Writeback Table empowers users with the capability of editing and saving the data back to a database within the Power BI plattform using an intuitive datatable.

This visual is especially useful for budgeting process where it is desired to make forecasts using an existing reports. Other use cases could be for recording comments or notes about invoices or payments. Even project management or masterdata management could be streamlined using this flexible datatable visual. It seamlessly embeds into the Power BI environment and existing reports without the need to switch to an another system for data maintenance. This ensures that the users work always with actual data improving efficiency and data quality.

Build a a self-service platform

Manual changes are saved at backend using a REST API. This visual can be used to display existing data from the existing Power BI model with selected columns to be editable, so that the user either can update the existing data or add a new record to the existing dataset. Following the save command all changes (including the new lines) are sent using the standard fetch api to the selected web service. The field names that the web api expects can be customized and must not necessarily be the display name on the report.

This visual supports :

  • the BI Developers to collect information from the users without the need for a custom developed application.
  • the users to provide information without leaving the accustomed report page.

Important features :

  • Insert/delete row
  • Edit data in form of numbers, text, textarea with multiple rows, date or checkbox
  • Automatic saving to prevent data loss
  • Automatic refresh after saving ensuring an unified experience
  • Lock columns
  • Show/hide columns
  • Native Power BI design. Use any existing Power BI model

Name: Cluster For PowerBI
Description: This Cluster Chart is a  Power BI visual that provides a flexible and interactive way to visualize.
Long Summary: This Cluster Chart is a  Power BI visual that provides a flexible and interactive way to visualize.
Description Full:
Cluster Chart - Custom Power BI Visual

This Cluster Chart is a custom Power BI visual that provides a flexible and interactive way to visualize clustered data. It allows users to compare multiple measures across different categories while offering features such as dropdown filters, data labels, and customizable table views.

Key Features: Interactive Dropdowns
  • Users can select different categories (X-axis) and measures (Y-axis) using dropdown filters.
  • The measure dropdown provides an option to view all measures or filter by specific roles.
Dynamic Clustered Bar Chart
  • Displays data using a bar chart, where each category is represented on the X-axis, and the selected measures define the bars.
  • Uses D3.js and Chart.js for rendering, ensuring smooth interactivity.
  • Data labels are shown on bars to display percentage values clearly.
Tabular Data Representation
  • A table below the chart shows the same data in tabular format.
  • It includes color-coded labels to match the chart for better readability.
Customizable Appearance
  • The chart and table can be dynamically updated based on the selected options.
  • Users can toggle the visibility of the X-axis and Y-axis through formatting settings.
License Validation
  • The visual includes an authentication system to check for valid license keys.
  • If the license is valid and active, full functionality is enabled; otherwise, certain features are restricted.
Use Case:

The Cluster Chart is ideal for business intelligence reports, where users need to compare multiple metrics across different categories in a clear, structured, and interactive manner. It can be used for sales analysis, financial comparisons, and market segmentation.

Charturo Interactive Line Chart is a line chart that allows the end users to switch between log and linear axes directly on the chart surface.
Charturo also supports inverted Y axis direction. 
The report developers can also enable/disable the end-user capabilities during design time.

Current version supports up to 30,000 data points on the canvas without sampling.

Name: ParaHTMLViewer
Description: This is a single Card HTML Viewer which can display Power BI Data, accept input and submit
Long Summary: This is a single Card HTML Viewer which can display Power BI Data, accept input and submit
Description Full: This visual will display HTML loaded from a dataset, Data can be bound to the HTML using the Id attribute to most HTML tags including images. HTML should not include any javascript as this will not be processed, CSS style sheets from a CDN will be processed and the sample contains a form using PureCSS. As a single card, the visual requires a category to provide context, measures which have the same name as Id's will be bound to the card. SVG is supported and an Id in a text tag will bind data. This visual can be used to create unique tooltips pages. Forms can be submitted to a target URL, Power Automate is the recommended target.

Name: ParaTaskCard
Description: The ParaTaskCard Visual is designed to submit action items for task management.
Long Summary: The ParaTaskCard Visual is designed to submit action items for task management.
Description Full: The ParaTaskCard Visual for Power BI is designed to help you automate and orchestrate your work processes in order to enable Active Business Intelligence. It can be readily included in your existing business process to simplify and accelerate your workflow. The Card uses established Adaptive Cards technology that enables you to tailor task submission to your requirements.

With this plugin, users can see a 3D model that can be used to filter and analyze data from IoT sensors, as well as other data sources. The 3D model allows users to visualize the location and status of devices and sensors, and to identify potential issues or areas for optimization.

  • Customization and Styling: Customize the appearance and behavior of your embedded videos to align with your report's design, ensuring a seamless and cohesive user experience.
  • Real-time Updates: Enjoy automatic video refresh, ensuring that your content remains up to date as your data evolves.
  • Security: Rest easy knowing that your embedded videos are protected by Power BI's robust security measures, ensuring controlled access to sensitive content.

Value Proposition:

  • Data Interpretation: Provide valuable context to your data, helping your audience better understand the insights and recommendations you're presenting.
  • Improve Decision-Making: Empower your teams to make informed decisions by combining the power of data and visual explanations.
  • Enhanced Stakeholder Communication: Impress clients, investors, and executives with interactive reports that effectively communicate key information.
  • Multifaceted Applications: Suitable for a wide range of industries, from marketing and sales presentations to educational and training materials.

Business Audience:

  • Marketing and Sales Teams: Create dynamic sales reports, marketing campaign analyses, and product demos that captivate clients and prospects.
  • Educators and Trainers: Deliver engaging e-learning experiences, training modules, and course materials with integrated video content.
  • Data Analysts and Consultants: Enhance the impact of your data presentations and consulting reports with explanatory videos.
  • Executives and Decision Makers: Receive insights more intuitively and make data-driven decisions faster with added context.
  • Content Creators: Leverage video-embedded reports for compelling content in customer presentations, webinars, and executive meetings.

Target Industries:

  • Marketing and Advertising: Create captivating marketing dashboards and campaign performance reports.
  • Education and E-Learning: Deliver enriched educational content and analytics reports for online courses.
  • Consulting and Analytics Services: Elevate your consulting services by providing clients with visually enriched reports.
  • Sales and Retail: Boost sales presentations with dynamic product demonstrations and sales performance data.

The Video Player is your gateway to a more engaging, informative, and visually compelling reporting experience. Make data come alive, capture your audience's attention, and maximize the impact of your insights. Elevate your Power BI reports today with VideoEmbed Visuals and witness the transformation of your data narratives.

Name: UnAvoids
Description: Unavoids is a powerful custom visual designed to analyze and visually represent complex datasets
Long Summary: Unavoids is a powerful custom visual designed to analyze and visually represent complex datasets
Description Full: UNAVOIDS presents a novel approach for identifying and visualizing anomalies in security data by integrating advanced detection algorithms with exploratory visualization techniques. Central to its innovation is the use of a two-dimensional Neighborhood Cumulative Distribution Function (NCDF) space, a unique transformation that effectively captures and distinguishes observations based on their neighborhood characteristics, rather than merely projecting data onto a plane. This method, inspired by the cumulative distribution function of a random variable, allows for the classification of data points as either normal or anomalous based on their local surroundings. In this space, each data point is depicted as an individual curve, making it straightforward to distinguish anomalies from regular patterns. Crucially, the NCDF space retains the full integrity of the original data, making it a highly precise tool for anomaly detection. As an entirely unsupervised model that assigns a normalized score to each observation to measure its level of anomaly, UNAVOIDS has shown exceptional accuracy in detecting anomalies in both simulated and real-world datasets, surpassing other existing methods.

Name: Milestone Trend Analysis (MTA)
Description: Visual progress of past and future project milestones or tasks
Long Summary: Visual progress of past and future project milestones or tasks
Description Full:
Milestone Trend Analysis is a sophisticated data-driven tool designed to provide a comprehensive view of historical and future project milestones. It offers a visual representation of project progress, enabling stakeholders to assess performance trends and anticipate potential deviations from the planned timeline. Through graphical presentations and data analytics, this tool empowers decision-makers with valuable insights into the trajectory of a project, allowing them to make informed choices and adjustments as needed. The Milestone Trend Analysis primarily caters to project managers, business executives, and team leaders responsible for overseeing complex projects.

Key features of this visual:
✅ no access to external services or resources
✅ zooming in and out via the mouse wheel or via a pinch gesture
✅ panning across the chart via the mouse or with a finger
✅ unique predefined color for each task or milestone
✅ hovering over data points for detailed information
✅ optional chart legend

Further features are on the horizon, stay tuned!

Name: Event Table Viewer
Description: Comparison of event sequence, categorical, and numerical data in an interactive tabular layout.
Long Summary: Comparison of event sequence, categorical, and numerical data in an interactive tabular layout.
Description Full:
The Event Table Viewer is a visualization for analyzing event data along with categorical and numerical data columns in a tabular layout. Multiple event types can be displayed per row on a shared time scale. Events can be aligned by one event type and sorted. A boxplot shows the event distribution of similar data for comparison. The table can be grouped, sorted and filtered by multiple columns. Visualization types for cells, group summaries and column summaries can be customized for each column. 

A detailed documentation can be found here: https://jku-vds-lab.at/pro2future-event-table-viewer/

The visualization is based on an extended version of LineUp.js (https://lineup.js.org/).

Name: Water Cup
Description: Niche visual for infographics comparing items across up to 4 dimensions.
Long Summary: Niche visual for infographics comparing items across up to 4 dimensions.
Description Full:
The Water Cup visual is a niche infographic element to visualize up to 4 dimensions per items for easier comparison.
It's best used for use-cases where the 4 dimensions are interconnected:
- The cup's height and width should indicate the limits of a certain data, e.g. revenues of a company from different sources
- The water level within a cup should be a factor of the limits, e.g. profits as a percentage of the revenues
- The color of the water (optional) can indicate qualities of this data, e.g. the company's financial health, etc.
When applied to the right dataset, this type of visualization can be much more intuitive then bar or column charts, or even a scatter chart.

Name: Razor PBI Visual
Description: Visualize insights gained from the Razor™ industrial AI/ML engine.
Long Summary: Visualize insights gained from the Razor™ industrial AI/ML engine.
Description Full:
Easily connect your Razor™ insights to your existing Microsoft Power BI dashboard.

*Subscription to the Razor™ Engine is required.
 (https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/web-apps/praemo.razor?tab=Overview)

About Razor™

Razor™ is a prescriptive analytics engine designed for industry that leverages AI and Machine Learning to detect and deter issues that degrade performance. Attaching to a company's IoT and operational data systems, Razor™ mines for anomalies and trends that signal any deviation from baseline performance. Alerting the operator to the potential issue and recommending specific actions to preempt future consequences when action is needed.

Of Industry, For Industry

Razor™ was developed by industry professionals who best understand the challenges associated with their specific sector. Our people have experienced the problems we are solving with our Razor™ technology, firsthand, and leverage this industry knowledge to observe, interpret and process data in new ways. Our revolutionary technology adds insights that add value and help drive sustainable improvements within your operations.

Our Unique Approach

Starting quickly with an historical data set, Razor™ will develop AI/ML models without creating disruption in your operations or stealing bandwidth from your time-constrained teams. After the models have been developed, they are integrated into existing data collection systems for real-time anomaly detection and learning reinforcement.

Name: PictureThis
Description: A picture is worth a thousand words, why not use more images in your report?
Long Summary: A picture is worth a thousand words, why not use more images in your report?
Description Full:
A picture is worth a thousand words, why not use more images in your report? Have you ever tried to use product or colleague images instead of names as a filter in your Power BI reports? PictureThis offers url actions, background images and shapes to use pictures in your report. It requires a lot of work to get your images all prepped up to be used in your report the standard way and still it remains a static or low res exercise that thickens up the size of your report.

The “PictureThis” Power BI visual helps you create dynamic image tables that can be used as a filter in your report, all within your familiar Power BI environment: Governed and Secured!

Use Image url’s from your dataset that automatically create a responsive image table. The images will act as a filter on another target sheet in your report. Images are not stored in your report, they will dynamically be lined up in an image table based on your data and can be used as a filter! In the edit dialog box it is now very easy to style your Picture, decide where you want to display your data, with drag and drop and easily add columns or add a prefix or suffix to your data!

 

Do you have several data you want to present at your picture? Use flipped cards to put data on the back of the card or the tooltip to display those data!

 

Get started!

Learn more about the PictureThis visual here.

Learn how to quickly set it up with our Product Guide.

 

Disclaimer

The free version of this visual is limited to 3 pictures extension to your report. To experience the fully functional extension, get your free trial in the store: https://appsource.microsoft.com/nl/product/power-bi-visuals/infotopicsbv1652776028763.picturethis?tab=Overview

Name: Composed Line Area Bar Chart by Devlup Funnels
Description: The Composed Line Area Bar Chart is a visually engaging data visualization that combines the feature
Long Summary: The Composed Line Area Bar Chart is a visually engaging data visualization that combines the feature
Description Full:
The Composed Line Area Bar Chart is a powerful and flexible data visualization technique that combines the features of a line graph, area chart, and bar chart to present complex datasets in a comprehensive and visually appealing manner. This innovative charting approach allows users to effectively analyze trends, compare data points, and understand the distribution of information within a single graph.

At its core, the Composed Line Area Bar Chart displays multiple datasets simultaneously, providing a holistic view of the data. It enables users to gain insights into various aspects such as time series analysis, cumulative data, and categorical comparisons. By merging the key elements of line, area, and bar charts, this visualization technique offers a unique and versatile way to explore complex datasets.

The line graph component of the Composed Line Area Bar Chart allows users to track trends and changes over time. By plotting data points and connecting them with lines, it provides a clear depiction of how values evolve and fluctuate. This feature is particularly useful for analyzing temporal patterns, identifying seasonality, or observing long-term trends. The line graph element adds a dynamic and interactive aspect to the chart, enabling users to hover over data points for detailed information or zoom in to specific time intervals for closer examination.

The area chart element of the Composed Line Area Bar Chart complements the line graph by showcasing the distribution and cumulative values of the data. By filling the area under the line graph with color, it visually represents the cumulative total or proportion of the data at each point. This visual representation is particularly effective for highlighting the overall pattern and proportionality of the data. It helps users identify areas of concentration, observe changes in distribution over time, or compare cumulative values across different datasets.

The bar chart component of the Composed Line Area Bar Chart enhances the visualization by providing a categorical comparison of the data. It utilizes vertical bars of varying lengths to represent different categories or data groups. By aligning these bars with the corresponding data points on the line graph or area chart, users can easily compare values across categories. This feature is particularly beneficial when analyzing discrete data, comparing different entities, or identifying outliers within a dataset.

The Composed Line Area Bar Chart offers a range of advantages over traditional charting techniques. Firstly, it provides a comprehensive view of the data by combining multiple visualization elements within a single graph. This eliminates the need for users to switch between different charts or representations, saving time and enhancing the overall understanding of the data. Secondly, the visual aesthetics of the Composed Line Area Bar Chart make it highly engaging and appealing, increasing user interaction and facilitating effective communication of insights. Finally, its versatility allows it to be applied to various industries and domains, from finance and economics to healthcare and marketing.

In summary, the Composed Line Area Bar Chart is an innovative and versatile data visualization technique that combines the strengths of line graphs, area charts, and bar charts. By displaying multiple datasets simultaneously, it enables users to analyze trends, compare data points, and understand the distribution of information within a single, visually engaging graph. This powerful visualization tool enhances data exploration and communication, making it invaluable for decision-making, analysis, and reporting purposes across a wide range of industries.
Keywords: Area,Bar,Devlup,Composed Line Area Bar Chart by Devlup Funnels
Simple Filename: Composed Line Area Bar Chart by Devlup Funnels

Name: Radial chart by Devlup Funnels
Description: Radial bar charts provide a visually engaging depiction of categorical data through their circular l
Long Summary: Radial bar charts provide a visually engaging depiction of categorical data through their circular l
Description Full:
The Radial Bar Chart by Devlup Funnels is a variation of the traditional bar chart that displays data in a circular or radial layout. The chart consists of a central point or axis from which bars radiate outward in a circular manner, similar to the spokes of a wheel.

Each bar in the Radial Bar Chart represents a category or data point, and its length or height corresponds to the value or magnitude of that data point. The bars are positioned evenly around the central axis, creating a visually appealing and compact representation of the data. 

The Radial Bar Chart is particularly useful when comparing multiple categories or data points simultaneously. It allows users for easy identification of the highest or lowest values and enables users to quickly discern patterns or trends within the dataset.

Radial Bar Chart offers customization options for colors, labels, tooltips, drill-through and other visual aspects

Name: Triangle Bar chart by Devlup Funnels
Description: This visual representation of data that uses triangular bars to display information
Long Summary: This visual representation of data that uses triangular bars to display information
Description Full:
Triangle bar chart by Devlup Funnels is a unique variation of a bar chart where the bars are shaped like triangles. Each triangle represents a data point with the base width representing the category value and the height representing the data value. The chart allows you to visually compare data across different categories.

Custom Color Based on Category: 
In this chart, each category or data point can be assigned a custom color to represent it uniquely. This can be helpful in distinguishing data points and highlighting specific categories for better visualization and analysis. 

Ability to Sorting: 
The chart offers the ability to sort the data either in ascending or descending order based on the data values or category values. Sorting helps to organize the data and identify trends or patterns more easily. 

Ability to Drill Through:
Drilling through the chart allows you to interactively explore the data in more detail. By clicking on a specific bar or category, the chart can be configured to display additional information or navigate to a more detailed view of the selected data. 

Custom Font Settings for Axis Ticks: 
The chart provides options to customize the font settings for the axis ticks. You can adjust the font size, style, and color of the axis labels and ticks to suit your design preferences and enhance readability. 

Overall, a triangle bar chart with custom colors, sorting, drill-through capability, and custom font settings for axis ticks is a powerful data visualization tool that allows you to effectively convey insights from your data in a visually appealing and interactive manner. It is suitable for various applications, such as displaying survey results, sales data by categories, and any other datasets where category-based comparisons are important.
Keywords: Bar,Custom,Devlup,Triangle Bar chart by Devlup Funnels
Simple Filename: Triangle Bar chart by Devlup Funnels
