Name: Multiple Stacked Charts
Description: Visual for comparing multiple data columns that share one X-axis.
Long Summary: Visual for comparing multiple data columns that share one X-axis.
Description Full:
Multiple Stacked Charts is a visual tool that can be used to compare numerical data over a common date or numerical X-axis. It avoids the issue of occlusion and visual clutter, that appears in other types of visualizations by displaying each parameter in a separate plot. This makes it easier to compare multiple parameters that have different characteristics or ranges.

It can be useful in industries such as manufacturing and finance where multiple parameters need to be compared. It allows you to easily see patterns and differences between these parameters for making informed decisions. 

There is an option to augment data points with colors based on categorical data. This feature makes it easier to distinguish between measurement sources or error types, for example. Additionally, plots that use this augmentation can be filtered by additional categorical or numerical columns, allowing for more precise analysis and comparisons of your data.

Multiple Stacked Charts also provides features such as a vertical ruler, heatmap analysis, rectangle plot overlays, zooming and panning. Additionally, it is possible to customize axis labels, ticks, and plot ranges. You can also set a colored background based on a categorical data column.
Keywords: scatter plot,multi-plot comparison,line plot,Multiple Stacked Charts

Name: ilionx ZorgControl KPI Gauge
Description: Een KPI Gauge die het resultaat, het doel en de afwijking tussen die twee aangeeft.
Long Summary: Een KPI Gauge die het resultaat, het doel en de afwijking tussen die twee aangeeft.
Description Full:
Deze Key Performance Indicator (KPI) heeft als hoofddoel om een performance waarde te vergelijken met een vooraf gedefinieerd doel, norm of begrote waarde. De werkelijke waarde en de beoogde waarde worden respectievelijk in het groot en in het klein weergegeven in de KPI. De gauge heeft als doel om het verschil tussen de werkelijke waarde en de beoogde waarde weer te geven. In het geval van een begroting wordt op de gauge het procentuele verschil tussen de werkelijk waarde en de beoogde waarde weergegeven. In het geval van een doel of norm worden de waarden op een absolute schaal weergegeven.

Iedere gebruiker die inzicht wil krijgen in de voortgang van een tijdlijn zal baat hebben bij deze KPI. De KPI is geschikt voor zowel financiële als zorg overzichten.

Door het definiëren van een tabel kan de visual automatisch selecteren of de gegevens een begroting, doel of norm betreffen. Daarmee kan ook een absolute of relatieve schaal gekozen worden. Tevens is het mogelijk om in te stellen of hoge waarden goed of slecht zijn en wat het minimum en maximum van de gauge is. Zo kan iedere gebruiker de KPI naar wens configureren.

Name: Play slicer by SWHK
Description: Auto-play filter, suitable for large screen display, can cycle through and filter report data.
Long Summary: Auto-play filter, suitable for large screen display, can cycle through and filter report data.
Description Full: The autoplay filter is designed for large screen displays and automatically cycles through data items within the slicer to create an automatic playback effect for report charts. This component supports three types of data: text, numerical, and date. Special configuration properties are provided for each type. For numerical data, you can set the minimum and maximum values, as well as the incremental range for each filter cycle. If the incremental range is set to '0', it will filter the values in the data slots sequentially rather than by intervals. Date data can be sliced by year, month, or day. Text data filters based on the values in the data slots. Additionally, you can set the filter playback order (ascending or descending), interval time, and display text style.

Name: Milestone Trend Analysis (MTA) by Umbu Solutions
Description: Track your project progress with clarity and confidence using our Milestone Trend Analysis (MTA)
Long Summary: Track your project progress with clarity and confidence using our Milestone Trend Analysis (MTA)
Description Full:
Track project milestone shifts over time to detect delays and early completions in Power BI

For project managers in medium to large projects, our Milestone Trend Analysis (MTA) visual for Power BI delivers a clear, customizable way to track milestone date changes over time and spot schedule risks before they impact delivery.

Key Benefits & Features

  • Proactive Risk Detection: Visualize early completions and delays across all project milestones so you can address issues before they escalate.
  • Intuitive Trend Chart: See shifts in milestone dates on a time‑series chart that highlights on‑time, early, or late completions at a glance.
  • Full Customization: Fully customize the chart through the Power BI formatting panel—adjust colors, labels, and gridlines to match your reporting style. The visual also supports Power BI’s theme colors, ensuring matching your corporate reports.
  • Seamless Interaction: Interact with your data just like any other Power BI chart. Selection and highlighting features make it easy to focus on key milestones and periods.
  • Tooltips and Data Fields: Hover over a milestone to see detailed tooltips with contextual information. Add additional data fields for more insights without losing focus.
  • Seamless Zoom: Need to focus on specific milestones or time periods? The zoom functionality allows you to drill into the details, making your analysis more effective.
  • Overlap Handling: Automatically differentiates overlapping milestones with distinct shapes and colors for clear identification.
  • Full Bookmark and Context Menu Support: Like other standard Power BI visuals, our MTA visual supports Bookmarks and the Context Menu, allowing you to save and navigate between views and toggle data points effortlessly.

Getting Started

  1. Try It for Free & Download the Sample Report: Explore the MTA visual in Power BI Desktop at no cost—download the sample file and see it in action.
  2. Connect Your Data: Hook up your milestone dataset to the visual for instant, personalized insights.
  3. Customize Formatting: Use the Power BI formatting pane to tweak colors, shapes, and labels to fit your report style.
  4. Assign Licenses: While Desktop use is free, a license is required to share the visual via Power BI Service—distribute licenses to your report builders and viewers.
  5. Publish & Share: Publish your report to Power BI Service and collaborate with stakeholders across your organization.

Name: JobNet Visual
Description: Visualize your parallel processes in a Gantt chart fashion to identify performance bottlenecks.
Long Summary: Visualize your parallel processes in a Gantt chart fashion to identify performance bottlenecks.
Description Full:
JobNet Visual does currently only support english language. However, localization is in progress.

What is JobNet Visual?

JobNet Visual for Power BI is a graphical visualization of parallel processes to identify overloading, performance bottlenecks and candidates for optimization. It can be used in Data Warehousing or any other batch processing scenario to

  • visualize highly parallelized processing scenarios,
  • highlight the critical path to identify candidates for optimization,
  • retrieve instant runtime KPIs and compare them over multiple executions to check optimization progress.

The visual retrieves runtime details for jobs or processes and organizes them into lanes to display parallel executions. The total number of lanes thus visualizes the degree of parallelism required by the executed jobnet scenario.

Additionally, a job runtime can be attributed with up to four sub-runtimes which are drawn in different graphical patterns. Examples for sub-runtimes within a job could be init-start delays, lock wait times or any other time periods within one single job that you want to highlight to report users. Furthermore, it can display up to ten additional custom fields like job status fields in a tooltip to help report users to better understand what is going on in their batches.

JobNet Visual is the ideal foundation for performance optimization, since it easily lets you identify periods of overloading and critical paths within complex job nets of up to 30.000 data points.

Who Benefits from JobNet Visual

If you have ever been trying to manually visualize Data Warehouse loads using Gantt charts to find out, why the load took so long during the night or the last weekend, then this visual is for you. JobNet Visual has specifically been designed for ETL loads in Data Warehousing but can basically be used in any scenario where a large number of processes is being execute in a highly parallelized manner. Most common application scenarios for this visual are (but not limited to) understanding and optimization of:

  • Patch processing of ETL jobs for Data Warehousing,
  • Automation jobs in databases (like SQL Server Agents),
  • Cloud automation processes in AWS or Azure,
  • Operating system jobs like Cron or Windows Task scheduler,

That said, JobNet Visual can be used to visualize any processing context if the required data is being captured. For example, a hospital could track patients passing through their stations by scanning RFID wrist bands each time a patient arrives at the station and when it leaves the station after a certain job has been executed (e.g. MRT scan). The scanned timestamps can be used in a list together with a patient id and station id and visualized using JobNet Visual to display the efficiency of patient processing from the point of view of a station or single patient.

How to Use JobNet Visual

The visual requires a minimum of only four data fields to generate the job net in a Gantt-like fashion:

  • ID: a unique identifier per job instance
  • TYPE: a label representing the job type
  • START: the date and time when the job started
  • END: the date and time when the job ended

The visual currently assumes a granularity of minutes to build the chart. However, other granularities like seconds, hours and days are currently in implementation. In the licensed version the maximum of 30.000 data points currently allowed by Power BI are supported.

Additionally, the following optional fields are available:

  • STATUS: indicating the job status using predefined values:
    • "C": Completed
    • "W": Warning
    • "E": Error
    Jobs with warnings or errors will be highlighted in the visual using a yellow or red line
  • SUB-RUNTIME: up to four sub-runtimes in minutes to graphically divide a job into segments
  • INFO FIELDS: up to ten additional information items to display in a tooltip when hovering over a job
  • JOB COLOR: users can use their own colors for job types using hex color specifications
  • DAY LABEL: the visual displays a timeline on to of the chart containing dates and hours. Sometimes users want to display additional information regarding an execution day, such as a weekend or holiday marker or any business-related milestone information. Data in this filed will be displayed next to the date label in the timeline

Please find more information on https://bi.popfinger.com/documentation/
Keywords: jobnet parallel processes critical path performance optimization,etl ssis job bi runtime duration,gantt,JobNet Visual

Create a custom visual to show the relationship between a marker layer and a polygon layer with the TMap Visual. Name: Custom Filter by Dunboxed
Description: Filter Power BI reports instantly using a list selection or by entering keywords or copy/paste
Long Summary: Filter Power BI reports instantly using a list selection or by entering keywords or copy/paste
Description Full:
Custom Filter by Dunboxed: A Smarter Way to Slice Data in Power BI


The Custom Filter visual is a powerful, flexible filtering component built for Power BI reports. It provides users with two intuitive ways to filter data:
  • Checklist of values (checkbox-based)
  • Manual input field for keywords or comma-separated lists
These two modes List and Input are fully synchronized to ensure a seamless filtering experience:
  • Selecting multiple values using checkboxes updates the input field automatically.
  • Typing or pasting into the input updates the checkboxes instantly.
This makes it easy to apply filters without the limitations of the default Power BI slicer. Whether you're selecting one item or pasting a long list, the Custom Filter handles it smoothly saving time and effort, especially with large datasets.

This visual makes it easy to apply filters without the limitations of the default Power BI slicer. Whether you're selecting one item or pasting in a long list of values, the custom filter handles it smoothly, saving time and effort—especially for large datasets. In addition to selecting values, the visual offers an Include/Exclude toggle. This feature allows users to decide whether the filtered values should match (include mode) or be excluded (exclude mode) from the result set. This level of control adds flexibility for deeper analytical scenarios and supports more complex filtering logic right within the report interface.

The visual is fully responsive, adapting elegantly to different screen sizes and page layouts. Whether you're working in a narrow side panel or a full-page canvas, the filter adjusts its layout and font sizes to maintain clarity and usability.

Styling and Customization Options

The visual offers extensive styling options via the formatting pane. Users can personalize the look and feel to match their report’s design, including:
  • Set background color and transparency
  • Adjust font size and font family
  • Customize checkbox size, color, and border radius
  • Configure button styles (font, colors, border radius)
  • Control padding, spacing, and layout alignment
With these options, the Custom Filter fits into corporate dashboards as well as creative, design-heavy reports.

Ideal For:

  • Power BI report creators and analysts
  • Business users filtering large datasets
  • Users needing quick selection without long slicer lists
  • Users pasting multiple values from Excel, emails, etc.
  • Scenarios that require Include/Exclude logic
  • Reports that demand visual customization and branding consistency

Solves Key Limitations of the Default Slicer

Default slicers in Power BI lack:
  • Direct input capabilities
  • Bulk comma-separated value support
  • Two-way sync between list and text input
  • Flexible styling options
The Custom Filter visual solves these challenges by offering a fast, elegant, and fully customizable interface. It helps users:
  • Filter faster
  • Reduce cognitive load
  • Explore data with greater precision

Name: Hanging Rootogram Chart for Power BI
Description: A hanging rootogram chart is a specialized type of bar chart used in statistical analysis
Long Summary: A hanging rootogram chart is a specialized type of bar chart used in statistical analysis
Description Full:
Hanging Rootogram by Office Solution

The Hanging Rootogram chart by Office Solution is a specialized type of bar chart used in statistical analysis to compare observed data with expected data from a theoretical distribution, such as the normal distribution. In this chart, bars are "hung" from the axis representing the expected values, and their lengths indicate the difference between the square roots of the observed and expected frequencies. This visualization technique stabilizes variance and makes it easier to detect and interpret deviations between the observed data and the expected theoretical model, providing a clear visual assessment of the goodness-of-fit.

Key Benefits

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: Easily distinguish between observed and expected frequencies with hanging bars, providing an immediate visual representation of deviations.
  • Compact Layout: A hanging design ensures a more compact and space-efficient display compared to traditional histograms.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Capable of managing large datasets with ease, ensuring smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • License: No license support.

Premium Features:

  • Customizable Thresholds: Set specific thresholds to highlight significant deviations between observed and expected data.
  • Customizable Dimensions: The chart dimensions can be adjusted to fit various screen sizes and layouts, ensuring flexibility and adaptability.
  • Interactive Elements: Hover over bars to get detailed tooltips that provide precise values and additional insights.
  • Scalable Bar Height: Adjust the height of the bars with respect to the normal distribution curve of expected values or absolute values of the expected values.
  • Bar Color-Coded: Use color coding to instantly identify the bars.
  • Both Curves: The Both curve chart displays two lines, one for observed data and another for expected data, allowing for direct comparison.
  • Area Between Curves: The shaded area between the observed and expected lines highlights discrepancies, making it easier to identify significant deviations.

Business Use Cases:

  • Quality Control Teams: Use the Hanging Rootogram to compare defect rates against expected distributions, aiding in quality control and process improvement. Monitor compliance data to ensure adherence to regulatory standards by identifying significant deviations from expected values.
  • Data Scientists & Statisticians: Validate statistical models by comparing observed data with theoretical distributions, ensuring model accuracy and reliability. Identify and analyze anomalies or outliers in datasets, enhancing the quality and integrity of data analysis.
  • Marketing and Customer Analytics: Analyze customer behavior, such as purchase frequency or product preferences. By visualizing deviations from expected customer actions, marketers can tailor their strategies to better meet customer needs and preferences.
  • Healthcare and Medical Research: Utilize hanging rootograms to analyze the distribution of health outcomes or medical test results. By visually representing deviations from expected outcomes, healthcare professionals and researchers can identify patterns, trends, and potential areas for further investigation or intervention.
  • Supply Chain Management: Analyze the distribution of inventory levels, production lead times, or delivery delays in supply chain operations. By visually representing deviations from expected performance metrics, supply chain managers can identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and opportunities for optimization.

Note:

Name: Cohort Analysis By Office Solution
Description: Cohort Analysis in Power BI is a visual tool to analyze the behavior of groups (cohorts) over time.
Long Summary: Cohort Analysis in Power BI is a visual tool to analyze the behavior of groups (cohorts) over time.
Description Full:
Cohort Analysis for Effective Project Management by Office Solution

A cohort chart is a data visualization tool that analyzes the behavior of groups (or cohorts) of individuals or items over time. These groups share a common characteristic or event within a defined period.

Key Components:

  • Cohort Analysis Chart: Comprises the Table Header and Cohort Table.
  • Colors: The table uses five shades of green for values above 50, five shades of red for values below 50, and white for values equal to 50.
  • Retention Rate: Indicates the percentage of users, customers, or employees who remain engaged with a product, service, or company over a given period.
  • Customer Retention Rate: Formula: Retention Rate = (Number of Users Retained ⨉ 100) / Total Number of Users Initially.
  • Churn Rate: Reflects the percentage of customers, users, or employees who stop using a product, service, or company during a specific period.
  • Calculate Churn Rate: Formula: Churn Rate = 100 - Retention Rate.
  • Alert: Represents a warning sign indicating negative user behavior.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: The visualization is clear, and data is easily identifiable.
  • Size: The chart is resizable and adapts dynamically to the screen size.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Capable of managing large datasets with smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Data Required: Dimensions data, measures data, and period data.
  • Tooltip: Displays dimensions, measures, average retention, and average churn rate.
  • Heading: Represents the dimension field and period field.
  • Colors: Different colors highlight the highest and lowest retention rates in the dimensions field and the maximum and minimum user counts in the measures field.

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: The premium version supports logo removal.
  • Dropdowns: Users can select which data to view for retention and churn rates.
  • Alert: Users can set a fixed retention percentage to indicate when their data is at risk.
  • Alert Toggle: Users can toggle alerts, displaying a bell icon in retention percentage cells when activated.
  • Export Button: Allows users to download the table in CSV format.
  • + Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Product Development: Track how cohorts respond to new product features and updates to assess engagement changes.
  • Customer Segmentation: Identify high-value cohorts for targeted marketing, support, and product development efforts.
  • Revenue Growth: In SaaS businesses, the cohort chart can show whether new signups convert into long-term paying customers.
  • Product Engagement: Monitor drop-offs or ongoing engagement of users who started using a feature simultaneously.

Conclusion:

The cohort chart visually represents user retention and behavior over time, allowing stakeholders to analyze how different user segments engage with the product across various periods. By comparing retention rates among different cohorts, the chart reveals insights into user behavior, device performance, and the impact of marketing campaigns or product changes. This analysis helps identify trends, highlight areas for improvement, and inform strategies to enhance user engagement and satisfaction, ultimately driving long-term growth and success.

Name: Polar Scatter Plot By Office Solution
Description: A polar scatter plot displays data points in a circular layout using angles and radii.
Long Summary: A polar scatter plot displays data points in a circular layout using angles and radii.
Description Full:
Polar Scatter Plot Chart by Office Solution

The polar scatter plot is a type of chart that displays data points in a circular layout, using angles and radii to represent two-dimensional data. This plot is particularly useful for visualizing data that has a natural cyclical pattern or for representing directional data.

Components:

  • Angles (Theta): Each data point is placed at a certain angle around the circle, typically measured in degrees.
  • Radii (Rho): The distance of each data point from the center of the circle (the origin) represents the magnitude or value of the variable. The farther from the center, the higher the value.
  • Data Points: These are the individual observations plotted on the polar scatter plot. Each point's position is determined by its angle and radius.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: The visual can be clearly visible and the data are easily identifiable.
  • Size: The chart is resizable and dynamic in nature according to the size.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Capable of managing large datasets with ease, ensuring smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Colors: The colors of the dots in the chart can be customizable from the visual settings under the visualization pane.

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: The premium version supports the removal of the logo.
  • Dropdown: Dropdown feature that helps the user select particular data by simply choosing the option from the dropdown. Ensure more than one data point is added.
  • Toggle Chart: The toggle chart (Dropdown) allows switching between the polar area plot chart, polar scatter plot chart, and the polar line plot chart.
  • Top n Selection: Based on the “radius,” the top radii can be shown by selecting/typing through the dropdown.
  • +Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Meteorology: To represent wind directions and speeds. The direction can be plotted as the angle and the speed as the radial distance.
  • Astronomy: To plot positions of stars, planets, or other celestial objects in a circular sky map.
  • Engineering: To visualize data in fields such as robotics, where directional data is important.
  • Navigation: For plotting course directions and distances in marine or aerial navigation.
  • Signal Processing: For plotting the phase and magnitude of signals.

In Short:

A polar scatter plot is a graphical representation where data points are plotted on a circular grid using polar coordinates. Each point is defined by an angle (θ) and a distance (r) from the center. This type of plot is useful for visualizing data that have a natural circular structure, such as wind directions and speeds, celestial coordinates, or cyclic phenomena. The angle represents the direction, and the radial distance represents the magnitude of the data point.

Name: Fish Bone Chart for Power BI
Description: A Fishbone chart identifies causes of a problem, categorized into branches, for root cause analysis.
Long Summary: A Fishbone chart identifies causes of a problem, categorized into branches, for root cause analysis.
Description Full:
Fishbone Chart by Office Solution

The fishbone chart, also known as an Ishikawa or cause-and-effect diagram, is a visual tool used to systematically identify and present the potential causes of a specific problem or effect. It is called a Fishbone Chart because its structure resembles the skeleton of a fish.

Structure of a Fishbone

  1. Head (Effect/Problem): The head of the fish represents the problem or effect that needs to be analyzed. This is typically placed on the left/right side of the diagram.
  2. Spine: A horizontal line (spine) runs from the head to the right side of the chart, representing the main flow from causes to effect.
  3. Bones: Angled lines (major bones) branch off from the spine, each representing a major category of potential causes.
  4. Sub-Bones: Smaller branches (sub-bones) extend from each major bone, representing detailed sub-causes or specific factors within each major category.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: The visual can be clearly visible and used for the identification of causes/main-causes.
  • Size: The chart is resizable and dynamic in nature according to the size as well as the fish-size, bone size (stroke width).
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Capable of managing large datasets with ease, ensuring smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Customizable Dimensions: The chart dimensions can be adjusted to fit various screen sizes and layouts, ensuring flexibility and adaptability.
  • Colors: The colors of the chart can be customized from the visual settings under the visualization pane.
  • Text Size: The text size of texts can be dynamically and easily handled by the user.

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: The premium version supports the removal of the logo.
  • Dropdown: Dropdown feature that helps the user to select the particular data, by simply choosing the option from the dropdown. Make sure more than one data is added.
  • +Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Manufacturing:
    • Quality Control: Identifying the root causes of defects or quality issues in the production process.
    • Process Improvement: Analyzing delays or inefficiencies in the manufacturing workflow.
    • Equipment Failure: Diagnosing the reasons behind machinery breakdowns or maintenance problems.
  • Healthcare:
    • Patient Safety: Investigating the causes of medical errors or adverse events.
    • Process Optimization: Improving patient flow, reducing waiting times, and enhancing the efficiency of hospital operations.
    • Infection Control: Identifying the factors contributing to hospital-acquired infections.

Name: Lorenz Curve By Office Solution
Description: Lorenz Curve is a graphical representation of income inequality or wealth inequality.
Long Summary: Lorenz Curve is a graphical representation of income inequality or wealth inequality.
Description Full:
Lorenz Curve for Effective Project Management by Office Solution

A Lorenz curve is a graphical representation of the distribution of income or wealth within a population. It plots the cumulative percentage of total income received against the cumulative percentage of recipients, starting with the poorest individual or household. The further the Lorenz curve is from the line of equality (a 45-degree line), the greater the inequality in the distribution.

The Lorenz curve is a graphical representation used to show the distribution of income or wealth within a population. It helps visualize economic inequality, making it easier to understand how income or wealth is distributed among the members of a society.

Key Concepts:

  • Equality Line: This is a 45-degree line that represents perfect equality. If every person in a population had the same income, the Lorenz curve would lie along this line.
  • Lorenz Curve: This curve shows the actual distribution of income. It typically bows below the equality line, indicating that income is not distributed equally.

Cumulative Shares:

  • Cumulative Population Share: The percentage of the population, starting from the poorest.
  • Cumulative Income Share: The percentage of total income received by that cumulative percentage of the population.

How to Read the Lorenz Curve:

  • Start at the Origin: The curve starts at the origin (0,0), where 0% of the population has 0% of the income.
  • Trace the Curve: Move along the curve to see the cumulative distribution. For example, if 50% of the population owns 20% of the income, the curve will pass through the point (50, 20).
  • Compare with the Equality Line: The farther the Lorenz curve is from the equality line, the greater the inequality. If the Lorenz curve were to match the equality line, it would indicate perfect equality.

Interpretation:

  • Closer to Equality Line: Less inequality.
  • Farther from Equality Line: More inequality.

  • +Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Policy Making: Governments and organizations use the Lorenz curve to understand economic inequality and to design policies aimed at redistributing income more equitably.
  • Economic Studies: Economists use it to analyze the effects of economic policies and to compare income distributions across different regions or time periods.

Conclusion:

The Lorenz curve is a powerful tool for visualizing and understanding income inequality. By plotting the cumulative share of income against the cumulative share of the population, it provides a clear picture of how evenly or unevenly income is distributed in a society.

Name: Dynamic Price Elasticity By Office Solution
Description: Price elasticity measures how sensitive the demand for a product is to changes in its price.
Long Summary: Price elasticity measures how sensitive the demand for a product is to changes in its price.
Description Full:
A dynamic Price Elasticity visual in Power BI is a powerful way to analyze how changes in price impact the demand for products across different regions or categories.

Price elasticity of demand (PED) is an economic measure that indicates how much the quantity demanded of a good or service changes in response to a change in its price. It helps to understand consumer behavior regarding price changes and is a crucial concept in economics and marketing.

Key Components:

  • Price Elasticity Heat Map: Comprises the product, region, and elasticity data table.
  • Colors: The colors of the table range from five shades of green for values above fifty, to five shades of red for values below fifty, with fifty being white.
  • Price Elasticity: Price elasticity of demand (PED) measures how much the quantity demanded of a good responds to a change in its price.
  • Elasticity Value: Calculated using old price, new price, old quantity, and new quantity values.

Price Elasticity of Demand (PED) Formula: % Change in Quantity Demanded / % Change in Price

Basic Features:

  • Data Required: Product, Region, Old Price, New Price, Old Quantity, New Quantity.
  • Tool Tip: Shows product, region, current price, current demand quantity, elasticity value, and projected revenue change.
  • Color Legend: Displays color usage for elasticity values.
  • Total Revenue Impact: Calculated as (TR2−TR1), where TR1 = P1 × Q1 and TR2 = P2 × Q2.
  • Average Elasticity Value: Average Elasticity = ∑ Elasticity Values / N (where N is the number of elasticity values).

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: Premium version supports logo removal.
  • Price Slider: Adjust the price elasticity value display within the elasticity table, updating other values accordingly.
  • New Projected Revenue: Represents expected revenue based on price changes and quantity adjustments due to elasticity.
  • Change in Demand: Shows how quantity demanded responds to a price change.
  • Increase/Decrease in Revenue: Reflects how price changes affect overall sales revenue based on elasticity category.
  • Change in Profit Margin: Indicates the percentage change in profit margin over a specific period.

Use Cases:

  • Market Analysis: Visualize demand sensitivity across products and regions, helping businesses identify products most affected by price changes.
  • Pricing Strategy: Assess price elasticity for various products to optimize pricing strategies, maximizing revenue and profitability.
  • Product Development: Inform product development decisions by understanding how pricing changes could influence consumer behavior.

Conclusion:

A price elasticity heat map is a powerful analytical tool that visually represents the sensitivity of consumer demand to price changes across various products and markets. By highlighting elastic and inelastic demand, it empowers businesses to make informed pricing strategies, optimize revenue, and enhance marketing efforts tailored to specific consumer behaviors. This dynamic visualization facilitates quick adaptations to market shifts, allowing financial companies to seize opportunities and allocate resources efficiently, ultimately driving improved performance and competitive advantage.

Name: Voronoi Diagram By Office Solution
Description: A Voronoi diagram divides a plane into regions based on the distance to a specific set of points.
Long Summary: A Voronoi diagram divides a plane into regions based on the distance to a specific set of points.
Description Full:
Voronoi Diagram by Office Solution

A Voronoi diagram is a way of dividing a plane into regions based on distance to a specific set of points. Each region contains all the points that are closer to one particular seed point than to any other seed point. These seed points are also known as sites or generators.

Here's a breakdown of its components:

  • Voronoi Cells: Each seed point has a corresponding region, called a Voronoi cell, which consists of all points closer to that seed than any other.
  • Edges and Vertices: The edges of the Voronoi cells are equidistant to the nearest two seed points. The vertices are equidistant to three or more seed points.
  • Convex Polygons: In a plane, Voronoi cells are convex polygons.
  • Seeds: Start with a set of points (called seeds or sites).
  • Regions: Divide the plane such that each region contains all points closer to its seed than to any other seed.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: The visual is clearly visible, and the data are easily identifiable.
  • Size: The chart is resizable and dynamic in nature according to the size.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Capable of managing large datasets with ease, ensuring smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Colors: The colors of the dots and the separators in the chart can be changed from the visual settings under the visualization pane.

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: The premium version supports the removal of the logo.
  • Dropdown: Dropdown feature that helps the user select specific data by choosing options from the dropdown.
  • Specific Voronoi: Dropdown can be used to view the specific Voronoi diagram according to the legend.
  • Top N Selection: Based on the “y” top legend can be shown by selecting/typing through the dropdown.
  • + Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Geography and Ecology:
    • Territorial Mapping: Used to map regions based on proximity to different locations, such as schools, hospitals, or cellular towers.
    • Habitat Ranges: Modeling the territory of animals in ecology.
  • Meteorology and Climatology:
    • Weather Forecasting: Determining regions affected by different weather stations.
  • Computer Graphics and Spatial Analysis:
    • Texture Generation: Creating textures and procedural patterns.
  • Optimization Problems:
    • Facility Location: Finding optimal placement for facilities to minimize distance to clients.
    • Network Design: Designing efficient communication or transportation networks.
  • Astronomy:
    • Galaxy Distribution: Studying the distribution and structure of galaxies in the universe.
  • Medicine:
    • Cell Biology: Analyzing the spatial organization of cells.

In short:

A Voronoi diagram is a method of dividing a plane into regions based on the distance to a specific set of points called seed points. Each region (Voronoi cell) contains all the points that are closer to its corresponding seed point than to any other. The boundaries between these regions are called edges, and where edges meet are vertices. Voronoi diagrams are used in fields such as geography, meteorology, computer graphics, optimization, astronomy, and medicine for tasks like territorial mapping, habitat range modeling, weather forecasting, texture generation, and facility location planning.

Name: Circular Dendrogram Chart for Power BI
Description: Circular Dendrogram Chart for Power BI by office solutions
Long Summary: Circular Dendrogram Chart for Power BI by office solutions
Description Full:
Circular Dendrogram Chart by Office Solution

A Circular Dendrogram Chart is a graphical representation used to display hierarchical structures, particularly in the context of clustering analysis or hierarchical clustering. Unlike traditional dendrogram charts, which are linear, circular dendrogram charts arrange the clusters in a circular layout. This arrangement offers advantages such as better visualization of relationships, especially when dealing with large datasets or complex hierarchical structures.

Key Features:

  • Clusters Representation: Clusters are represented by circles or arcs arranged radially around a central point.
  • Hierarchical Relationships: The hierarchical relationships between clusters are depicted through the arrangement of branches and sub-branches radiating from the center.
  • Branch Length: Similar to linear dendrograms, the length of the branches or the distance between clusters reflects the level of similarity or dissimilarity between them.
  • Annotations: Circular dendrogram charts are often accompanied by labels or annotations to provide additional information about the clusters or data points.

Advantages:

  • Compact Visualization: Circular dendrogram charts condense hierarchical structures into a compact circular layout, making them suitable for visualizing large datasets without sacrificing clarity. The circular arrangement allows for efficient use of space, especially when dealing with numerous clusters or hierarchical levels.
  • 360-Degree View: Unlike linear dendrograms, which are constrained by the horizontal or vertical axis, circular dendrogram charts provide a 360-degree view of the hierarchical relationships. This enables users to explore and analyze the data from multiple perspectives, facilitating a deeper understanding of complex structures.
  • Radial Hierarchy: In a circular dendrogram chart, clusters are arranged radially around a central point, with hierarchical levels represented by concentric circles or arcs. This radial hierarchy allows for intuitive navigation through the levels of the hierarchy, with outer circles representing higher-level clusters and inner circles representing lower-level clusters.
  • Topology Preservation: Circular dendrogram charts aim to preserve the topology of the hierarchical structure, ensuring that clusters with closer relationships are placed closer together in the visualization. This topology preservation aids in the interpretation of clustering results and the identification of meaningful patterns within the data.
  • Enhanced Visualization of Connectivity: The circular layout of dendrogram charts can provide enhanced visualization of connectivity and inter-cluster relationships. By arranging clusters in a circular fashion, it becomes easier to identify connections between distant clusters and visualize how different parts of the hierarchy are interconnected.
  • Interactive Exploration: Modern circular dendrogram chart implementations often include interactive features such as zooming, panning, and tooltips, allowing users to interactively explore and analyze the hierarchical structure. Interactive visualization enhances user engagement and facilitates data-driven insights.

  • Node: Each node has a different label and values to differentiate each node.
  • Node Colour: Represents the type of node.
  • Links: Used to link nodes with specific properties.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: Clear visualization with easily identifiable data.
  • Size: Resizable and adapts dynamically to screen size.
  • Dynamic Data Handling: Manages large datasets with smooth performance and quick rendering.
  • Data Required: Sales Growth, brand awareness, unit sold, rate of interest, e-commerce, retails, modern trade, buy1 get1, bundle offer, free sample.
  • Tool Tip: Displays different properties for nodes and links.
  • Nodes: All nodes like Sales Growth, brand awareness, and more are visible.
  • Links: All edges connecting different groups of nodes are visible.
  • Image: Logo visibility.
  • Calculated Value: Each node’s value is visible inside the node.
  • Node Colour: Customizable via Power BI visualization.
  • Node Text Size: Adjustable from the Power BI visualization.

Premium Features:

  • Product Dropdown: Shows product groups, enabling specific product link visualization.
  • Offer Dropdown: Displays different offers for specific link visualization.
  • Time Filter Dropdown: Filters data by time range, such as weeks or other intervals.
  • Total Sale Value: Calculated value of total sales after offers.
  • Total Order Value: Calculated total order value.
  • Product Sold: Calculated value of products sold.
  • New Customer: Calculated new customer value based on offer awareness.
  • Legend Value: Product color and labels are visible as legends.
  • Dropdown Visibility: Option to hide or show dropdowns via Power BI visualization.

Use Cases:

  • Marketing Channel Performance: Understand contributions of channels like social media or TV ads to customer actions.
  • Customer Journey Mapping: Track customers from engagement to conversion, spotting drop-offs.
  • Promotional ROI Analysis: Link expenditures to generated revenue.
  • Campaign Effectiveness Comparison: Compare multiple campaigns for traffic or sales efficiency.
  • Segmentation Analysis: Highlight segment responses to promotions.
  • Budget Allocation Insights: Assess distribution and effectiveness of promotional budgets.

Conclusion:

A promo projection chart provides a clear visualization of how various marketing channels contribute to outcomes like conversions or revenue. It highlights high-performing channels, underperforming areas, and potential bottlenecks in the customer journey. By analyzing the flow of resources and results, businesses can identify which efforts yield the best ROI and make data-driven decisions to optimize future campaigns.

Name: Supply Chain Network Flow Chart by Office Solution
Description: A supply chain network is a system of entities that moves goods from suppliers to customers.
Long Summary: A supply chain network is a system of entities that moves goods from suppliers to customers.
Description Full:
A Supply Chain Network Flow Chart visualizes the movement of goods, information, and finances across a supply chain. It maps the journey products take from suppliers to consumers, detailing the processes, entities, and resources involved at each step. A well-structured supply chain network ensures that all interconnected entities, such as suppliers, manufacturers, warehouses, and retailers, work seamlessly together to move goods, services, information, and finances from suppliers to end customers.

Key Components:

  1. Supply Chain Network: Includes suppliers, manufacturers, warehouses, and retailers.
  2. Node Structure: Differentiates each node group, such as suppliers, manufacturers, etc.
  3. Node Colour: Each node group has a distinct color to represent its role.
  4. Links: Edges connecting nodes, representing relationships or flows.

Basic Features:

  • Visual Clarity: Ensures clear, easy-to-read visuals for quick data identification.
  • Data Required: Includes key nodes like suppliers, manufacturers, warehouses, and retailers.
  • Nodes: All key nodes (supplier, manufacturer, warehouse, retailer) are visible.
  • Links: All edges connecting different nodes are clearly visible.
  • Performance: Displays node performance at the border of each node group.
  • Node Colour: You can modify the color of nodes (supplier, manufacturer, warehouse, retailer).
  • Link Colour: Change the color of the links between nodes.
  • Node Performance Colour: Adjust the performance color using Power BI.
  • Node Text Size: Customizable text size for nodes.
  • Node Border Size: Customizable border width for nodes.

Premium Features:

  • Performance Dropdown: Showcases node performance with color coding (green for optimal, yellow for minor issues, red for major issues).
  • Delivery Dropdown: Displays time durations for delivery (1–3 days, 3–7 days, 7–10 days, over 10 days).
  • Volume of Goods Dropdown: Shows the volume of goods sent between nodes (high, moderate, low).
  • Colour Legends: Displays a color legend for nodes and links, indicating their meanings.
  • Zoom Feature: Adjust the size of the chart for better visibility.
  • Dropdown Visibility: Toggle the visibility of dropdowns.
  • Legend Text Size: Adjust the text size for legends.
  • Dropdown Label Change: Allows customization of dropdown labels.

Use Cases:

  1. Supply Chain Optimization: Enhances efficiency by optimizing routes, inventory levels, and reducing costs.
  2. Risk Management: Identifies vulnerabilities and tests resilience through scenario planning.
  3. Supply Chain Visibility: Provides real-time tracking and better decision-making.
  4. Demand Forecasting: Improves accuracy by synchronizing demand and supply.
  5. Collaboration and Communication: Improves coordination and relationships between partners.
  6. Sustainability and Efficiency: Supports eco-friendly practices and reduces environmental impact.
  7. Performance Monitoring: Tracks metrics to ensure efficiency and meet service level agreements.

Conclusion:

A Supply Chain Network Flow Chart visualizes the flow of goods, information, and finances. It helps optimize operations, manage risks, forecast demand, and monitor performance. By improving visibility and collaboration, it reduces costs, mitigates risks, and enhances supply chain resilience, leading to more efficient, agile operations and better customer satisfaction.

Name: Network Graph by Powerviz
Description: Simplify complex relationships with customizable Nodes-Links, Clusters for impactful visual insights
Long Summary: Simplify complex relationships with customizable Nodes-Links, Clusters for impactful visual insights
Description Full:
The Powerviz Network Graph is a visual representation of objects (called nodes or vertices) and the relationships or connections (called edges or links) between them. Its primary purpose is to illustrate how different entities are related or interact with one another.


The Powerviz advanced Network Graph includes features such as clustering, highlighting the relation between the nodes, fill pattern, 30+ color palette, conditional formatting, shape customization, line customization, directional arrow, and many more.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all the advanced settings features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner. 

Key Feature Highlights: 

  • Line Options: Customize the link between the nodes and add different styles and colors. 
  • Node Shape: Customize the shape of the nodes by selecting from various shapes, and icons or upload your own.
  • Labels: Apply data labels to enhance user experience. Display a combination of categories, values, and percentages of the total.
  • Data Colors: Offers 30+ color palettes including color-blind safe mode for better accessibility. 
  • Fill Pattern: Create patterns by selecting from a diverse range of options or upload your own.
  • Ranking: Filter out Top/Bottom N by each level. Either hide or show the remaining categories as "Others".
  • Conditional Formatting: Easily find outliers by using rules for measures or categories. Set up smart rules based on values, the top and bottom N.
  • Clusters: Group related nodes into clusters or communities to highlight patterns and sub-networks within the graph.
  • Relationships: Analyze the relationship between the nodes at a glance.
  • Animation: Apply animation such as pop-ups and highlight effects to enhance the visual.
  • Import/Export: Effortlessly export or import the theme for sharing or reuse.
  • Toolbars: Get more control over the Network graph with an advanced toolbar.

Other features include show condition, grid view, lasso and reverse lasso, and many more. 

Business Use Cases: 

  1. Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Visualizing relationships between customers, leads, and sales teams to improve targeting and communication strategies.
  2. Recommendation Systems: Using network graphs to map customer preferences and suggest products or services based on connections between user behavior and product similarities.
  3. IT Network Management: Monitoring and analyzing computer networks to identify vulnerabilities, optimize traffic, and ensure network security.
  4. Supply Chain Optimization: Mapping suppliers, manufacturers, and distribution centers to uncover bottlenecks, optimize logistics, and improve efficiency.
  5. Social Network Analysis (SNA): Understanding influence and interactions in social media networks to enhance marketing campaigns and brand visibility.

Name: DROPDOWN
Description: Table with Dropdown by Cells which operates independently, allowing users to select different option
Long Summary: Table with Dropdown by Cells which operates independently, allowing users to select different option
Description Full:
In Power BI custom visuals, it is possible to create a dropdown menu for every individual cell within a table. This is especially useful when building interactive visuals where users can make selections directly in the visual itself, such as choosing parameters, filtering content, or configuring options on the fly.
To enable this functionality, you must place the relevant column into a special data role field named "Dropdown".

Independent Cell Selections:
Each dropdown in the table operates independently, allowing users to select different options for each cell. This is more advanced than having a single dropdown filter or slicer, as it gives granular control at the cell level.

Dynamic Content:
The options for each dropdown can be either static (predefined in code) or dynamic (driven by data or external logic). You can also capture user selections and use them to trigger updates or calculations in the visual.

Benefits:
Enables high interactivity in table-based visuals.
Ideal for what-if scenarios, configuration tables, or editable matrix views.
Supports rich user experiences directly within the report canvas without external slicers or filters.

Example Use Cases:
Budget planning tools where users choose nation with region as column in "Key Grouping".
Product comparison tables with configurable features.
Show population in a region with countries as dropdown.

Name: Process Flow
Description: Visualize your business processes, including automatic variant computation and key metrics
Long Summary: Visualize your business processes, including automatic variant computation and key metrics
Description Full:
Uncover hidden information in your process data with the Process Flow visual, empowering you to make informed decisions and take appropriate actions.

The Process Flow visual takes your business process data (tickets, tasks, events, activities, ...) in the form of an event log and displays it in a clear and understandable format. Key metrics such as the lead time and number of event occurrences are available out of the box and the automatically computed variants can easily be filtered to gain an even deeper insight.

Key features

  • Clear and understandable process visualization, using a directed flow graph.
  • Build-in automatic variant computation and visualization, using a selectable bar chart.
  • Visualization of key metrics per event/transition as well as for the process as a whole.
  • Tooltips that can show configurable additional data fields, with support for different aggregation options.
  • Quick-menu to allow report viewers to change certain settings at runtime, for their session only.
  • All features customizable using Power BI's formatting settings, including the visual's color palette.
  • Integration with common Power BI features such as formats and selections.
  • Extensive and detailed online documentation for all functionality.

Visual inputs

The easiest way to start with the Process Flow visual is with an event log, that contains the following fields:

  • Case ID Identifier to group multiple events into a single run of the process. In the context of support tickets, this would be the ticket number.
  • Event ID Identifier for the individual events in the process. In the context of support tickets, this would be the ticket state (opened, under review, resolved, ...).
  • Timestamp When exactly the event occurred. In the context of support tickets, this would be the timestamp that denotes when a ticket was opened, claimed by someone for review or marked as resolved.

For more information please check out our dropzone documentation, which contains a detailed description for each available field, including their supported data types. Additionally, you can also try out our example report, to see how it all works in practice.

Start for free

The free tier can be used for evaluating the visual and testing it for specific use cases or datasets, without having to start a trial or commit to any purchases.

Please take note that the free tier is not intended for usage in a production deployment and will therefore truncate your process data to a meaningful subset and display watermarks if the limit is reached or certain configuration options are changed. For more information, please refer to our free tier documentation, which details the specific restrictions applicable under different circumstances.

About SCvation

SCvation GmbH specializes in business intelligence solutions, offering expertly crafted visuals for both Microsoft Power BI and MicroStrategy. Our visuals help to uncover insights of your data for making strategic decisions.

Name: E-Project Smart Slicer
Description: Custom slicer with additional performance and customization features
Long Summary: Custom slicer with additional performance and customization features
Description Full:
### E-Project Smart Slicer - an innovative and High-Performance Custom Slicer for Power BI

Introducing our cutting-edge **Smart Slicer Visual for Power BI**, a game-changing solution designed to revolutionize your data filtering experience. This visual enhances your report’s performance by providing a unique approach to filtering, offering unparalleled efficiency and responsiveness.

#### Key Features & Strategic Benefits
1. **Label-Based Filtering with Key Field Efficiency:**
   - Unlike traditional slicers, our custom visual allows filtering based on a key field while displaying user-friendly labels.
   - This approach minimizes the strain on your dataset, especially when writing complex DAX formulas using the SWITCH function.

2. **Significant Performance Improvement:**
   - Filtering is applied directly on the ID field, ensuring swift data retrieval and smoother interaction.
   - The enhanced efficiency makes this custom slicer ideal for large datasets where performance is critical.

3. **Seamless Integration:**
   - Designed to be easily incorporated into your existing Power BI reports, with minimal setup required.
   - Fully compatible with various data models and use cases.

4. **Improved User Experience:**
   - Simplifies the filtering process, enhancing report usability and overall user satisfaction.
   - Provides a clean and intuitive interface, making data exploration more accessible.

#### Features
- Four display styles:
  - Vertical checkbox list
  - Horizontal checkbox list
  - Vertical buttons
  - Horizontal buttons
- Fully customizable style (colors, fonts, size)
- Ability to enforce single or multiple selections
- Ability to auto-select first filter value if no value is selected
- Allows using a separate measure to override the filter value's labels

#### Why Choose Our Custom Slicer Visual?
Our Custom Slicer Visual for Power BI delivers performance optimization by efficiently filtering data through key fields while displaying comprehensible labels. This innovative approach results in smoother operations, particularly when utilizing complex DAX formulas, making it the ideal choice for users seeking high performance and user-friendly reporting solutions.

Experience the next level of Power BI filtering – Boost your reporting performance with our powerful custom slicer visual today!

Name: Risk Matrix by Profitbase
Description: From Insight to Action — Familiar Risk Visualization with Profitbase Risk Matrix
Long Summary: From Insight to Action — Familiar Risk Visualization with Profitbase Risk Matrix
Description Full:
Visualize Risk. Make Informed Decisions.

A risk matrix is one of the most effective tools for identifying, assessing, and communicating risk. With Risk Matrix by Profitbase, you get a dynamic and fully customizable matrix that brings clarity to your risk landscape.

Whether you're just getting started or managing a complex portfolio of risks, Risk Matrix helps you see the big picture—and the fine details.

Why Use Risk Matrix?

  • Clear, Visual Insight
    The familiar matrix layout makes risks easy to understand at a glance. Whether you're presenting to executives or working with risk teams, it's an excellent starting point for deeper investigation.

  • Customizable to Your Needs
    Go beyond the standard 5x5 grid. Configure your matrix to anything from 1x1 to 10x10. Adapt it to match your organization’s risk assessment framework.

  • Tailor Every Detail
    • Modify background colors section by section to reflect risk severity.
    • Add your own axis and category labels to reflect your unique terminology.
    • Adjust bubble sizes based on additional metrics—like financial impact or exposure.

  • Interactive and Actionable
    Risk Matrix isn’t just a static visual. Use it as a powerful filter—click on a bubble to drill down and view detailed information in connected visuals and dashboards.

 

A risk matrix is a great way to visualize risks. Being great to look at and easy to read, it's an exellent starting point to investigate your risks. 

 

Features:

  • Change from the default 5x5 matrix to anything from 1 to 10
  • Change background colors section by section
  • Add your own category labels
  • Change bubble size based on other values: e.g. potential financial loss
  • Use the Risk Matrix as a filter - select a bubble and see details on selected risks in other visuals

Use without the need to add tables and legends with translations, all of this is done for you. How much time, money, is spent constructing a complete visual story?
The first month is free! After that, your saving money by saving time.

Present your data, even hundreds of categories, your way with a wide array of customizations and theming.
Pareto charts can be used to identify significant causes with each bar representing a category or cause. One or more of the bars will account for the majority of outcomes.
Useful across industries and different types of processes pareto charts help to identify and focus on the most impactful contributors to a process in order to focus business decisions.

A Pareto chart is a horizontal bar chart sorting the categories in descending order by frequency or summed count on category combined with a line chart showing the cumulative percentage representing the amount each category contributes to the total.

Name: Time series Anomaly Detection
Description: Effortlessly evaluate the normality of variations over time and explain it.
Long Summary: Effortlessly evaluate the normality of variations over time and explain it.
Description Full:
Spot anomalies with precision using our Anomaly Detect extension for Power BI

Are you struggling to identify outliers in your data and understand performance inconsistencies? With Anomaly Detect, automate anomaly detection effortlessly, transform tedious manual checks into actionable insights.

Identify anomalies and understand their context:

This extension is designed to quickly and intelligently detect outliers in your key metrics, highlighting where and when your data deviates from normal patterns. By understanding anomalies in their context, you can take timely and impactful actions.

Intelligent, focused detection:

  • KPI Scoring: Automatically rank your KPIs by scoring the most relevant anomalies to focus on what matters the most. Quickly identify which metrics require immediate attention for deeper analysis.
  • Automated anomaly detection: Leverage a sophisticated confidence interval and baseline calculation to automatically pinpoint outliers in your data.
  • Customizable parameters: Adjust confidence levels, baseline points, and focus on anomalies above or below thresholds to match your analysis needs.
  • Continuous monitoring: Enable "latest point only" mode for real-time alerting without overwhelming your dashboard with excessive anomalies.

Interact and customize your detection:

  • Flexible key dimensions: Monitor anomalies on time-based metrics like dates or other dimensions such as product categories or countries.
  • Tailored metrics relations: Customize your KPIs, adjust units, rename steps, or focus on specific dimensions for more relevant results.
  • Personalized experience: Choose font styles, sizes, and even the language (French or English) to align with your company's branding and preferences.

Applications across industries:

  • Sales & Retail: Quickly detect anomalies in product sales, pricing, or category performance.
  • Web Analytics: Spot unexpected changes in conversion rates, traffic, or funnel performance.
  • Finance: Identify outliers in revenue trends or expenditure patterns.
  • Media & Acquisition: Track campaign performance deviations and optimize strategies.

What our clients are saying:

  • x2 improvement in identifying actionable insights through anomaly detection.
  • /5 reduction in time spent analyzing unexpected data shifts.
  • x10 return on investment achieved by acting on detected anomalies.

Accessible to all, enhanced for collaboration:

  • Free Version: Access the full functionality of this extension, ideal for individual use.
  • Premium Version: Publish and share reports online for a collaborative, branding-free experience tailored to professional needs.

Revolutionize your anomaly detection process: Ready to take control of your data and start making informed decisions? Visit docs.datama.io and experience the power of Datama Detect for Power BI today.

Name: Heatmap by Powerviz
Description: An Advanced customizable Heatmap with Colors, Shapes, and Small Multiples for detailed analysis
Long Summary: An Advanced customizable Heatmap with Colors, Shapes, and Small Multiples for detailed analysis
Description Full:
Heatmap by Powerviz provides a powerful way to visualize data density or value distribution across categories or dimensions using color gradients. It condenses complex datasets into an easy-to-interpret matrix format, where each cell's color intensity reflects the data's magnitude or frequency. The Heatmap is ideal for identifying patterns, correlations, and outliers within large datasets, making it indispensable for data-driven decision-making.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all the advanced settings, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Shapes: Select from various built-in shapes, including Default, Fixed, and Diverging varieties.
  • Data Colors: Offers 30+ color palettes including color-blind safe mode with the flexibility to add colors by data classes or by using a custom color field.
  • Data Labels: Choose from 3 display styles or add custom data labels with formatting options to customize the labels.
  • Axis Settings: Customize the axes by adding position and text formatting.
  • Grid Lines: Enhance the visual structure and readability of your data using grid lines.
  • Plot Area: Customize the plot area by choosing the maximum number of rows or columns to display.
  • Reference Lines: Plot lines on the Y-axis and X-axis to highlight a range of important points of an event.
  • Ranking: Filter out Top/Bottom N by each row or column. Either hide or show the remaining categories as "Others".
  • Total: Add total values on rows and columns with bars using advanced customization options.
  • Small Multiples: Split your visual into multiple, smaller visuals based on your selected fields.
  • Conditional Formatting: Easily identify outliers based on measure or category rules.
  • Grid View: Transforms the visual into an interactive table. Filter, Search, and Sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show Condition: Show/hide the visual based on a condition.
  • Native Features - Supports native features including cross-filtering, interaction, selection, tooltip, and bookmark.

Business Use Cases:

  1. Market Analysis: Use the heatmap to visualize and compare market trends, customer preferences, or sales performance across various demographics or geographical regions. It helps identify patterns and trends in consumer behavior or market dynamics.
  2. Performance Evaluation: Assess and track employee performance metrics, such as sales targets, productivity, or customer satisfaction ratings, over time. The heatmap can highlight strengths and areas needing improvement, aiding in performance management and decision-making.
  3. Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks or anomalies within financial or operational datasets by visually representing data patterns. The heatmap can reveal outliers, unusual trends, or areas of high risk, enabling proactive risk management strategies.
  4. Scientific Research: In scientific research, use the heatmap to analyze data correlations, distributions, or experimental results across different variables or parameters. It facilitates visualizing complex data relationships and patterns, assisting researchers in drawing meaningful conclusions.

NOTE

To learn more about the Heatmap by Powerviz, visit the website.

Name: egHeatmap
Description: A heatmap table to see different values per row by color.
Long Summary: A heatmap table to see different values per row by color.
Description Full:
The eHeatmap is intended to see the distribution of responses or values for each row.  Colors are customizable and displayed based on given value.  Map up to 6 values and colors. 
Each cell's value is colored based on the value of the cell and the color mapped to each value. 

- Customize total rows per column
- Allow for zooming in and out for layout purposes
- Customize colors  and map colors to values


Note:
Cells with value 1 are mapped to the color red
Cells with value 2 are mapped to the color green
Cells with value 3 are mapped to the color gray
Cells with value 4 are mapped to the color white

Sample Dataset (JSON)
[
{3, 1, 2, 1},
{2, 2, 3, 1}, 
{2, 4, 1, 2}, 
{2, 1, 2, 1}
]

Name: Cumulative by sio2Graphs
Description: Plot frequency against categorical or grouped data, creating a cumulative frequency distribution.
Long Summary: Plot frequency against categorical or grouped data, creating a cumulative frequency distribution.
Description Full:
“Cumulative by sio2Graphs” was designed to be quick and easy!
Hundreds of categories, no problem. Make it your own with a wide array of customizations.
Present your data without the use of high maintenance measures or complicated DAX formulas. Even a small number of measures can become cumbersome.

Cumulative frequency can help businesses understand the percentage a metric of interest is occurring at or less than at point x. This can help to set quality limits, track where resources are needed, plan for improvements, or use as a learning and marketing tool.

Plot cumulative frequency on the y-Axis against time or categorical boundaries on the x-Axis, creating a cumulative frequency distribution. Frequency is the number of times an event or outcome occurs. Distribution is how frequency is spread over categories, boundaries or time. The cumulative or relative frequency at point x is the sum of individual frequencies up to and at point x.

Customizations

  • Fonts, colors and sizes
  • Scrolling and resizing
  • Label placement and editing
  • Text hovering to increase readability
  • Value & currency formatting
  • Thinning arc percentage labels
  • Multiple coloring options
  • Value placement
  • Localizations
  • 1-Click formatting
  • Highlighting the process drivers
  • Display and highlight the Mean
Comments and Questions
  • cynthia@sio2graphs.com
Ratings and Reviews

Name: Mapa Polski - Województwa, Powiaty, Gminy
Description: Polska w Twoich Rękach: aktualna Mapa Polski z podziałem na województwa powiaty i gminy!
Long Summary: Polska w Twoich Rękach: aktualna Mapa Polski z podziałem na województwa powiaty i gminy!
Description Full:
"This application is available only in Polish [non-English language]".

Oddajemy w Wasze ręce to na co wszyscy czekaliśmy: mapę Polski z wbudowanym podziałem administracyjnym! Unikatowa, prosta w obsłudze, wydajna w działaniu i wyposażona w drill-down mapa pozwoli na skuteczną prezentację danych biznesowych i statystycznych w Waszych organizacjach. Komponent jest intuicyjny w użyciu: wystarczy zaznaczyć dane by zobaczyć efekt. Mapa będzie przydatna zarówno w firmach komercyjnych jak i w urzędach, jednostkach rządowych i samorządowych.

Dlaczego Nasza Mapa Polski?

Tradycyjne narzędzia analizy danych często ograniczają możliwości zrozumienia i interpretacji danych geograficznych. Nasza wizualizacja mapy Polski przewraca ten paradygmat, umożliwiając bardziej precyzyjne i interaktywne badanie danych na poziomie województw, powiatów i gmin.

Główne funkcje

  • Dane pod kontrolą i jasny obraz sytuacji: Nasza mapa pozwoli na wyświetlanie danych biznesowych z niespotykaną wcześniej precyzją na poziomie geograficznym. Śledź ilość klientów, sprzedaż, koszty i inne istotne metryki, dostosowując analizę do Twoich potrzeb biznesowych.

  • Opcja drążenia danych (drill-down): Zagłębiaj się w szczegóły, przekształcając wysokopoziomowe dane w konkretną wiedzę. Dzięki wbudowanej opcji drill-down możesz badać dane hierarchicznie, na poziomie województw, a następnie powiatów i gmin, uzyskując kompleksowy obraz sytuacji na terenie całej Polski. Sumę sprzedaży w województwie rozbij na poszczególne powiaty, wybierz konkretny powiat i sprawdź jakie gminy dały sumę sprzedaży w powiecie. Mapę możesz wyświetlać w Intranecie! Jeśli możemy Ci w tym pomóc, napisz do nas.

  • Formatowanie Gradientowe: Wykorzystaj moc kolorów, aby wizualnie uwydatnić istotne różnice w statystykach! Nasze formatowanie gradientowe umożliwia szybkie zrozumienie danych i identyfikację kluczowych obszarów wymagających uwagi. Sam wybierzesz odpowiednie kolory!

  • Intuicyjna Interakcja: Nasza mapa jest łatwa w obsłudze i przystępna w użyciu dla każdego użytkownika. Dzięki przejrzystemu interfejsowi użytkownika możesz szybko i efektywnie przeglądać, analizować i interpretować dane geograficzne bez konieczności specjalistycznej wiedzy.

Odkryj Nowe Możliwości z Naszą Mapą Polski: Niech Twoje dane mówią więcej niż tysiąc słów. Nasza wizualizacja mapy Polski pozwala Ci zgłębić złożone relacje geograficzne i biznesowe, otwierając drzwi do nowych możliwości analizy danych i podejmowania decyzji. Odkryj potencjał Polski w Twoich rękach dzięki naszej mapie.

Zacznij Już Dziś! Gotowy na nowe wyzwania? Wypróbuj naszą mapę Polski już dziś i doświadcz różnicy w analizie danych geograficznych. Odkryj nowe spojrzenie na krajobraz biznesowy Polski i podejmuj bardziej świadome decyzje z naszą mapą jako Twoim przewodnikiem. I pamiętaj: wielcy stratedzy zawsze nachylają się nad mapą!

Name: Workstream
Description: Workstream: Hierarchical Visualization for Microsoft Power BI
Long Summary: Workstream: Hierarchical Visualization for Microsoft Power BI
Description Full:
Unlock the full potential of project tracking with Engagy's "Workstream" – a cutting-edge visualization tool designed for Microsoft Power BI that effortlessly organizes tasks and phases into a comprehensible hierarchy. Experience the transformation of complex project timelines into straightforward, actionable insights.

Key Features

  • Hierarchical Task Display: "Workstream" transforms project planning into a visual journey, showcasing tasks and stages in an easy-to-follow, nested layout. It illuminates the project's roadmap, clarifying task order and dependencies at a glance, ensuring you always know what's next in the pipeline.

  • Streamlined Communication: With its hierarchical approach, "Workstream" turns your project's progress into a clear story, displaying each step in a simple hierarchy. It's the perfect tool for seeing the big picture and making smart choices with confidence.

  • Intuitive Interface: Say goodbye to the clutter of traditional Gantt charts or text-heavy plans. "Workstream" turns your project's progress into a clear story, displaying each step in a simple hierarchy. It's the perfect tool for seeing the big picture and making smart choices with confidence.

  • Customizable Viewpoints: "Workstream" offers high configurability, allowing users to tailor the visualization to their project's specific needs. From top-level overviews to detailed task timelines, adapt the tool to fit the unique narrative of your project's journey.

Applications

  • Project Progress Tracking: Ideal for monitoring the progression of tasks against your project's milestones, "Workstream" assists in pinpointing critical paths and prioritizing work effectively.

  • Performance Analysis: Our tool simplifies the task of identifying bottlenecks and inefficiencies, enabling teams to swiftly focus on areas requiring attention or adjustment.

  • Budget Tracking: Add financial data to your project planning with "Workstream." Our tool not only shows you the project's steps but also adds up the costs for each phase. Keep your budget on track and make cost-effective decisions with ease.

  • Timeline Management: assign specific dates to each stage and automatically calculate the duration. This feature ensures you're always informed about your project's timeline, helping you to meet deadlines and manage time effectively.

"Workstream" is more than just a chart; it's your guide to a clear path through the complex world of project management. Set a new bar for how you see your projects and steer your team to success with Engagy's "Workstream" in Microsoft Power BI.

Name: Map of Germany - Lands, Districts and Municipalities
Description: Map of Germany divided into federal states, counties and municipalities!
Long Summary: Map of Germany divided into federal states, counties and municipalities!
Description Full:
We all have been waiting for this moment: a ready to use map of Germany with a built-in administrative division! A unique, easy-to-use, efficient and equipped with drill-down map will help you with effective presentation of business and statistical data in your organizations. No more boring meetings with repulsive long data tables! The component is intuitive to use: just select data to see the effect. The map will be useful both in commercial companies and in offices, government and local government units.

Why Our Map of Germany?

Traditional data analysis tools often limit the ability to understand and interpret geographic data. Our visualization of the map of Germany overturns this paradigm, enabling more precise and interactive examination of data at the level of voivodeships, counties and municipalities.

Main Features

  • Data under control and a clear picture of the situation: our map will allow you to display business or statistic data with unprecedented precision at the geographical level. Track the number of customers, sales, costs and other important metrics, adapting the analysis to your business needs.

  • Drill-down: Drill down into details, turning high-level data into actionable knowledge. Thanks to the built-in drill-down option, you can examine data hierarchically, at the level of federal states and then counties and municipalities, obtaining a comprehensive picture of the situation throughout Germany. Break down the total sales in the federal state into individual counties, select a specific county and check which communes contributed to the total sales of the chosen county.

  • Gradient Formatting: Use the power of colors to visually highlight important differences in statistics! Our gradient formatting allows you to quickly understand your data and identify key areas that need attention. You will choose the right colors!

  • Intuitive Interaction: Our map is easy to use and accessible for every user. Thanks to the clear user interface, you can quickly and efficiently view, analyze and interpret geographic data without the need for specialized knowledge.

Discover New Possibilities with Our Map of Germany

Let your data speak more than a thousand words. Our Germany map visualization allows you to explore complex geographic and business relationships, opening the door to new opportunities for data analysis and decision-making. Discover Germany's potential in your hands thanks to our map.

Start Today!

Ready for new challenges? Try our Map of Germany today and experience the difference in analyzing geographic data. Discover a new perspective on Germany's business landscape and make more informed decisions with our map as your guide. And remember: great strategists always lean over the map!
