An all-inclusive visual for Product Owners and SCRUM Teams to quickly see epics, features, and user stories in a traditional Kanban view. You can also use JVIZ Strategic Roadmap to display organizational goals, objectives, and initiatives.

Whether you are a program manager, SCRUM master, Team Lead, or key stakeholder, JVIZ Strategic Roadmap provides a professional view into your goals and objectives.

● 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗟𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Organize your cards into multiple columns.
● 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗶𝘇𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘄𝗶𝗺𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗲𝘀: Adjust swimlane categories, size, and style.
● 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘁𝗲 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴: Quickly view work complete vs. remaining.

Name: JVIZ Tag List
Description: Visualize key words across your data story with tags
Long Summary: Visualize key words across your data story with tags

JVIZ Tag List is a lightweight Power BI visual that will complement existing dashboard filters, slicers and provides viewers a familiar word tag selection experience. JVIZ Tag List organizes a list of data in a single horizontal row. Each word in the tag list is encapsulated in a styled pill shape. A tag list allows users to quickly visualize key words associated with their data selection. Key Features include:

● 𝗧𝗮𝗴 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲: Adjust tag shape and edge roundness. 
● 𝗧𝗮𝗴 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗿: Use color picker to change tag colors. 
● 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺 𝗧𝗲𝘅𝘁: Customize text style and font decoration. 
● 𝗦𝘁𝘆𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲𝗱 𝗕𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀: Add stylized borders around tag pills. 
● 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗟𝗮𝘆𝗼𝘂𝘁: Display tags in narrow or wide layouts.

Name: Writeback Comments by Profitbase
Description: Comment on any data in Power BI and save changes to any destination
Long Summary: Comment on any data in Power BI and save changes to any destination

Writeback Comments by Profitbase lets users edit comments in Power BI, and save changes back to a database. It supports both plain text and rich text modes, allowing for simple or advanced formatting as needed.

Saving data requires access to Profitbase Flow (cloud) or an Azure Function app.

Description: A dot matrix plot chart allows you to group and order discrete data in units of dots.

Description Full:
JVIZ Dot Matrix is a clean and unique Power BI visual for when you need a quick comparison of discrete data across various categories to see how the parts relate to the whole.  Switch between various plot area distributions, adjust dot colors and sizing of plot area, and customize the legend and dot conversion labels to represent accurate information.

Whether you are a data analyst, project manager, or key stakeholder, JVIZ Dot Matrix provides a professional view into your discrete data.

Key Features include:

● 𝗣𝗹𝗼𝘁 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗯𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Graph proportional or weighted data.
● 𝗗𝗼𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝘆𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴: Adjust size, color, spacing and radius.
● 𝗗𝗼𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻: Visualize large volumes of discrete data.
● 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺 𝗟𝗲𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗱: Visualize dot color map and weight conversion.
● 𝗣𝗹𝗼𝘁 𝗗𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Swap plot direction and dot column visibility.
● 𝗛𝗲𝗹𝗽𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗼: Toggle the display of warning labels.

Name: 3DBI-Connected
Description: Bring spatial insight to your data.
Long Summary: Bring spatial insight to your data.
Description Full:
This is a variant of the (certified) 3DBI visual for Power BI. This variant allows you to dynamically load in 3D models that are cloud hosted, instead of manually inserting 3D models in the visual.
Just like the 3DBI visual, 3DBI-Connected will allow you to visualize your data about your assets directly in its spatial context. Use cases range from Property Management, BIM (quantities, scheduling, …) to plotting IoT data (color and filter objects by temperature, humidity, co2-levels, occupancy, wear, …) as well as Logistics (stock management, order picking, …) and Energy (plotting yield of solar panels or windmill farms) or any other sector where you might have a need for visualizing data in a 3D environment. The visual allows you to load in .3dbi files, created with one of the Creational tools offered by INFORMAXYZ (read more below), as well as open 3D file formats, such as Collada (.dae), GLB and OBJ, created with a wide range of available 3D modelling applications. 

The Creational tools INFORMAXYZ currently has available to create .3dbi files are: 1. Trimble SketchUp: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-sketchup/ 2. Autodesk Revit: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-revit/ 3. IFC files: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-ifc/ Tutorials on how to generate a model suitable for the 3DBI visual for Power BI can be found on the respective pages. Licensing information for those Creational tools is also available on the same pages.

Name: Task Stream Process Flow Chart
Description: Power BI custom visual for tracking task flows, milestones, and dependencies with customizable views
Long Summary: Power BI custom visual for tracking task flows, milestones, and dependencies with customizable views
Description Full:
The Task Stream – Process Flow Chart is a powerful and intuitive Power BI custom visual designed to help businesses visualize task flows, milestones, and dependencies within projects. This visual enables users to track progress, identify bottlenecks, and improve task management efficiency.

With a user-friendly interface, Task Stream allows for easy customization, including adjusting the number of milestones and tasks displayed, selecting colors, and modifying font sizes to enhance readability. This flexibility ensures that project managers and teams can tailor the view to meet their specific needs.

Key Features

  • Project-Based Views – Easily switch between projects to update the task flow visualization.
  • Structured Task Order – Tasks are organized by milestones (parent tasks) and finish dates for clear process tracking.
  • Customizable Colors – Choose specific colors for milestones and tasks to enhance visual clarity.
  • Adjustable View – Control the number of milestones and tasks displayed at a time, ensuring better navigation and focus.
  • Scalable Font Size – Modify the font size for improved readability based on the chart’s complexity.

Business Use Cases

  1. Project Management & Agile Workflows: Helps project managers and teams track task progress, milestones, and dependencies in Agile or Waterfall methodologies. Also, ensures teams stay aligned on priorities, deadlines, and potential delays, improving project efficiency.
  2. Product Development & Roadmap Planning: Visualizes key milestones and task dependencies in product development lifecycles. Also, aids teams in coordinating product releases, prioritizing features, and ensuring smooth execution.
  3. Business Process Optimization: Maps out operational workflows, identifying task dependencies and inefficiencies. Also, it helps businesses streamline processes, reduce bottlenecks, and improve overall efficiency.
  4. IT & Software Development: Displays task progress in software development projects, linking sprints, tasks, and release milestones. Also, it provides visibility into development timelines, facilitating better sprint planning and delivery tracking.
  5. Marketing Campaign Planning: Organizes campaign tasks and deadlines to ensure smooth execution across teams. Also, it helps marketing teams manage content creation, approvals, and launch timelines effectively.

Name: PlanIn BI - Data Refresh Service
Description: Visual ensures that the report page is consistently updated with the latest data.
Long Summary: Visual ensures that the report page is consistently updated with the latest data.
Description Full:
The 'PlanIn BI Data Refresh Service' is a Power BI-based solution, designed to integrate seamlessly with any Power BI report. This service acts as an add-on feature to our main Power BI visualization tool, 'PlanIn BI'. It ensures that the report page is consistently updated with the latest data, maintaining the accuracy and relevance of the information presented. Note that this service is fully functional only within the Power BI Service environment and is not supported by the Power BI Desktop version.
Please note that the 'PlanIn BI Data Refresh Service' requires additional purchases and licensing. For detailed information on pricing and licensing options, please contact us directly. Our team is ready to assist you with your data visualization and reporting requirements.

Name: PlanIn BI Revision
Description: Visual with writeback capability enables Power BI users to revision data within the Power BI report.
Long Summary: Visual with writeback capability enables Power BI users to revision data within the Power BI report.
Description Full:
PlanIn BI Revision is a comprehensive Power BI custom visual designed to provide full transparency over data modifications within planning and forecasting processes. Seamlessly integrated with PlanIn BI Matrix, this visual captures and logs every change made to planned values, enabling users to review, filter, and restore previous versions of their data.
Every data modification is recorded in a dedicated revision table, where changes are stored as deltas, tracking both the old and new values. Additionally, an activity log maintains a record of who performed each modification and when it occurred, ensuring full auditability. Users can explore the revision history, filter changes by user, date, or activity, and gain detailed insights into how their data has evolved over time.
PlanIn BI Revision offers powerful rollback functionality, allowing users to restore data to a specific activity or timestamp. Changes can be reverted fully or selectively, providing flexibility in managing historical edits. Users can also discard specific activities while preserving a complete record of all past modifications. Every rollback, discard, or restore action is logged as a new activity, ensuring a continuous and traceable audit trail without permanently erasing data.
Fully supported in Power BI Service, this visual does not function on Power BI Desktop. The PlanIn BI Revision visual requires an additional Power BI visuals, PlanIn BI Matrix and PlanIn BI - Data Refresh Service (available on AppSource), to enable real-time data refresh capabilities. A backend write-back web API (advised to be hosted on Azure Web Apps) is also required to enable write-back functionality. Supported databases include Microsoft SQL (on-premises/cloud), Azure SQL, and more. If you need compatibility with a specific database, please contact us with your requirements.
PlanIn BI Revision revolutionizes data governance within Power BI, providing users with complete control over their planning and forecasting data. With its advanced tracking, filtering, and rollback features, organizations can ensure data accuracy, maintain transparency, and confidently manage their reporting history.

Name: Copy - Dynamics 365 Finance business performance planning
Description: Effortlessly copy baseline data for new planning scenarios.
Long Summary: Effortlessly copy baseline data for new planning scenarios.
Description Full:
Scroll down on this page for the French version. Faites défiler cette page vers le bas pour accéder à la version française.
Copy visual empowers you to effortlessly transfer baseline data, including actuals or forecasts, into new planning or forecasting scenarios. You have the flexibility to choose the level of detail during copying, allowing for precise scenario creation. For instance, easily copy data from previous year's actuals as the foundation for a new plan, whether it is a complete copy or with specific dimensional filters, such as copying data for a particular department or product.

Key features:

  • Define specific "coordinates" of dimensions to copy and paste values from a source to a target, ensuring consistency and accuracy in scenario creation.
  • Create forecasts and budgets by building upon historical actuals, reducing redundancy and promoting accuracy.
  • Develop multiple forecast scenarios efficiently by building a base case and copying permutations as needed for comprehensive analysis.

Important
Business performance planning visuals require a Dynamics 365 Finance license. Learn more
Le visuel de copie vous permet de transférer sans effort des données de base, y compris des données réelles ou des prévisions, dans de nouveaux scénarios de planification ou de prévision. Vous pouvez choisir le niveau de détail lors de la copie, ce qui permet de créer des scénarios précis. Par exemple, vous pouvez facilement copier les données réelles de l’année précédente comme base d’un nouveau plan, qu’il s’agisse d’une copie complète ou de filtres dimensionnels spécifiques, tels que la copie de données pour un service ou un produit particulier.

Fonctionnalités clés:

  • Définissez des « coordonnées » spécifiques de dimensions pour copier et coller des valeurs d’une source vers une cible, garantissant la cohérence et la précision dans la création de scénarios.
  • Créez des prévisions et des budgets en vous basant sur les chiffres historiques, en réduisant la redondance et en favorisant l’exactitude.
  • Développez efficacement de multiples scénarios de prévision en élaborant un cas de base et en copiant les permutations nécessaires pour effectuer une analyse complète.

Important
Les visuels de planification des performances commerciales nécessitent une licence Dynamics 365 Finance. En savoir plus
Keywords: Forecast,Planning,Budget,Copy - Dynamics 365 Finance business performance planning
Simple Filename: Copy - Dynamics 365 Finance business performance planning

Name: Reporting - Dynamics 365 Finance business performance planning
Description: Design financial reports such as cash flow, income statement, balance sheet and more.
Long Summary: Design financial reports such as cash flow, income statement, balance sheet and more.
Description Full:
Scroll down on this page for the French version. Faites défiler cette page vers le bas pour accéder à la version française.

The Reporting visual is your go-to solution for generating polished financial reports within Power BI. It offers advanced row and column formatting, empowering you to create comprehensive financial statements such as cash flow, income statements, balance sheets, and more with ease.

Key features:

Name: Event Horizon Timeline Chart
Description: Power BI visual for tracking and analyzing milestones in a timeline fashion
Long Summary: Power BI visual for tracking and analyzing milestones in a timeline fashion
Description Full:
The Event Horizon – Timeline Chart is a powerful and highly customizable Power BI custom visual designed to help businesses track key milestones over time. Whether managing project deadlines, product launches, or critical business events, this visual provides an intuitive way to display and analyze milestones with flexibility and precision.

With dynamic scaling options and customizable milestone attributes, users can tailor their timeline to fit their exact needs. From monthly, quarterly, or yearly views to adjusting the number of visible scale points, this visual ensures that users can easily navigate through their milestones without losing sight of key events.

Key Features

  • Flexible Time Scaling – Switch between Monthly, Quarterly, and Yearly views.
  • Custom Date Range – Set your Start Date and End Date for a focused milestone view.
  • Status Customization – Define unique colors and shapes for milestones in different statuses (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, and Overdue).
  • Scalability & Navigation – Adjust the number of visible scale points to enhance readability and enable smooth scrolling.
  • Multi-Milestone Handling – Display multiple milestones at the same point, ensuring clear differentiation.

Business Use Cases

  1. Project Management & Roadmaps: Keep track of project phases, task deadlines, and delivery milestones. Also, ensure that team members have a clear timeline of project progression.
  2. Product Development & Releases: Visualize product launch cycles, feature rollouts, and development sprints. Also, track progress from planning to execution while identifying potential delays.
  3. Marketing Campaigns & Events: Plan and monitor marketing initiatives, promotions, and key event dates. Also, ensure proper coordination between teams for campaign execution.
  4. Compliance & Regulatory Deadlines: Keep track of critical compliance deadlines and audit schedules. Also, avoid penalties by staying on top of required regulatory submissions.
  5. Executive & Financial Reporting: Provide stakeholders with a high-level view of business milestones. Also, track financial reporting deadlines and key business performance events.

Note:

Name: dev2prod Variance Hero Visual
Description: Only Variance Hero allows you seamless switching between deviation visualization of PY, FC & Budget!
Long Summary: Only Variance Hero allows you seamless switching between deviation visualization of PY, FC & Budget!
Description Full:
Variance Hero gives you the possibility to compare deviations of different figures (e.g. actual figures, previous year's figures, plan figures, forecast figures) at a glance over time. In addition, you have the option of displaying values and comments dynamically and interactively as tooltips, which can be activated by mouseover.  

The special feature of Variance Hero is that the variances can be integrated or displayed separately. If the deviations are displayed separately, it is also possible to switch between absolute and relative deviation with a single click. Only Variance Hero also offers the possibility to switch between the display of variances compared to the previous year, budget and forecast by clicking in the visual. 

The standard formatting of the chart complies with the International Business Communication Standards (IBCS). However, in terms of formatting, you also have a wide range of customization options to design the desired visualizations according to your ideas and corporate identity.  

Variance Hero enables effortless and understandable visualization and analysis of figures and variances over time.

Name: Multi-Format / Animation / Text From Values Card (BI-Champ suite)
Description: Transform source data into a range of output formats - supporting animations, templates and copy
Long Summary: Transform source data into a range of output formats - supporting animations, templates and copy
Description Full:
This visual allows you to generate text (structured or unstructured) based on source data from your Power BI reports. This can be used to generate messages, content for posts, and stylized data for consumption in tools outside of Power BI. This makes it ideal to serve as a textual data card where you can control the output. Support for animations lets you build engaging (and fun!) reports.

You can choose from numerous preset formats, or roll your own output format using a simple yet powerful template language. Documentation for this is available at https://bizintelligencechampions.com/help/textfromval.

General features of Text From Values include:
  • Create text that's based on report data which can in turn be copied-and-pasted out of the visual and into other places such as posts, email and chat.
  • New in 2.3/4/5. Animation types supported: confetti, curtains, marquee, flip and fade; includes parameters that can be set through settings, or code (using the @animation function)
  • New in 2.2. Ability to react to changes in data, supporting alerts, including visual cues and requiring acknowledgment: great for dashboards that auto-refresh!
  • Optionally merge "like values" (for example, text values that only differ in case, diacritic usage, punctuation, etc.)
  • Generate well-formed output formats that Power BI does not normally export. Gain more control over tweaks to your data when making it available to other tools.
  • Control settings globally or at a column-level.
  • Able to use advanced mark-up which resembles HTML to build complex cards (1.2).
The sample pbix file that can be downloaded here and on bizintelligencechampions.com provides a detailed look at how you can use this visual; we highly encourage reviewing it since it can answer many questions (along with the video below).

Description Full:
Power Automate Process Mining Variant DNA allows users to easily visualize their processes in a way that displays the events that belong to each variant using blocks that resemble DNA.

It allows you to get an overview of all the process variants found in the business process, a glimpse of process characteristics and variations of the process, how standardized the process is and it allows you to identify differences or repeated patterns in your business process.

Name: Power Automate Process Mining - Process Map Visual
Description: Visualize a business process using a beautiful and easy to understand process map.
Long Summary: Visualize a business process using a beautiful and easy to understand process map.
Description Full:
Power Automate Process Mining Process Map allows users to visualize a process in a graphical way that can be used to find efficiencies and areas of improvement for a process. The visual allows the user to select different metrics, provides filtering capabilities and integrates with other Power BI visuals.

A process map provides a view of the activities performed in a process and their sessions. It represents the behavior of the process captured in data by means of activities and directed edges.

Process map activities (also known as nodes) represent a unique activity, or unique values of different selected mining attributes, performed, executed, or passed through in the process.

Frequency metric, time metric, or finance metric can be displayed for nodes. The system can display only one metric at a time.

The size and color of the highlight (also known as the halo effect) expresses the total proportion of the frequency, time metric in question in relation to the other nodes in the process map.

Chart edges represent transitions between individual events and describe the sequence of activities in the process. A transition between events means that they directly follow one after the other. The thickness of the edge and the number displayed next to it depend on the selected display metric (frequency, time, finance) and its value.
Keywords: process map,process mining,business process,Power Automate Process Mining - Process Map Visual
Simple Filename: Power Automate Process Mining - Process Map Visual

Name: Collage Pro by CloudScope
Description: Collage Pro displays images in the style of Instagram, using either a grid or detail display.
Long Summary: Collage Pro displays images in the style of Instagram, using either a grid or detail display.
Description Full:
Collage Pro allows you to beautifully display images within your Power BI report.

You can display images in either a compact grid display or a larger detail view in a style similar to Instagram. To display an image, you provide a connection to image data in your dataset. In addition to the image data, you can optionally display any of the following field types:

  • Video data, for playback
  • Permalink url
  • Author name
  • Author profile image
  • Caption or description
  • Date
  • Media type

In addition, you can provide any generic data fields that you wish (number, true/false, date, string). These data elements will be automatically formatted in the familiar Instagram style for numbers and dates.

Please note that as a certified visual, Collage Pro does not support links to external images via http or https urls. Your image and video data must be stored entirely within your own dataset, typically encoded in base64 or svg format.

Collage Pro can act as a filter to other visuals within your report. It also fully supports the Power BI bookmark feature.

Licensing

Collage Pro requires a license, except for when used in the Power BI Desktop application. For most organizations, you can choose an inexpensive per-user license option in the AppSource store.

Please note that the AppSource license does not support "Publish to Web" or "Embedded" scenarios. To enable Collage Pro to work in unsupported environments, visit the Collage page to learn more.

Name: Stream Graph
Description: A stacked area chart with smooth interpolation. Often used to display values over time
Long Summary: A stacked area chart with smooth interpolation. Often used to display values over time
Description Full:
A stream graph, is a type of stacked area graph which is displaced around a central axis, resulting in a flowing, organic shape.
Stream graphs display the changes in data over time of different categories through the use of flowing, organic shapes that somewhat resemble a river-like stream. This makes Stream Graphs aesthetically pleasing and more engaging to look at.
In a Stream graph, the size of each individual stream shape is proportional to the values in each category. The axis that a Stream Graph flows parallel to, is used for the time scale.
Stream graphs are ideal for displaying high-volume datasets, in-order to discover trends and patterns over time across a wide range of categories.

This is an open source visual. Get the code from GitHub: https://github.com/Microsoft/powerbi-visuals-streamgraph

Name: Attribute Control Chart
Description: Monitor process quality: facilitating timely anomaly detection and continuous improvement
Long Summary: Monitor process quality: facilitating timely anomaly detection and continuous improvement
Description Full:
The Attribute Control Chart in Power BI offers a comprehensive view of process quality by allowing users to monitor defects/defectives and their corresponding metrics. This visual supports six types of Attribute Control Charts, including:

  • c chart: Monitors the number of defects in each sample when the sample size is constant.
  • u chart: Tracks the number of defects per unit when the sample size varies.
  • Laney u' chart: A modified version of the u chart to adjust for overdispersion or underdispersion in your data.
  • p chart: Observes the proportion of defective items in each sample when the sample size varies.
  • Laney p' chart: A modified version of the p chart to adjust for overdispersion or underdispersion in your data.
  • np chart: Displays the count of defective items in each sample when the sample size is constant.

Benefits:

  • Improved process visibility: Offers a visually intuitive representation of process performance, empowering users to make data-driven decisions and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Early detection of anomalies: Enables early detection of deviations from expected performance levels, helping to mitigate quality issues and prevent costly defects.
  • Enhanced collaboration: Facilitates collaboration and communication among cross-functional teams by providing a shared understanding of process performance metrics and trends.

Sample use cases:

  • Manufacturing: Monitor defect rates in production lines to ensure product quality and reduce waste.
  • Healthcare: Track the occurrence of adverse events or medical errors to enhance patient safety and care quality.
  • Customer Service: Analyze the frequency of customer complaints or service errors to identify areas for process improvement and enhance customer satisfaction.

Key Features:

  • Dynamic data analysis: Users can explore and analyze data trends by filtering and slicing data based on various attributes such as time periods, product categories, or production lines.
  • Statistical control limits: The visual dynamically calculates and displays control limits, allowing users to quickly identify variations in the process and distinguish between common cause and special cause variations.
  • Automatic signal detection: The visual automatically detects significant signals in your data, allowing users to focus on signals and ignore random noise.
  • Format the objects: All lines, markers and axes can be formatted independently, and support theme settings.
  • Selection & highlighting: Like any standard Power BI Chart you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the Attribute Control Chart.
  • Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip.
  • Full bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the Attribute Control Chart supports Bookmarks.
  • Drill-Down capability: Users can drill down into specific data points to investigate underlying factors contributing to quality issues or improvements.
  • Real-Time monitoring: Provides real-time updates as new data is ingested, enabling users to stay informed about process performance and take timely corrective actions.

All functionality of the Attribute Control Chart is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

This visual is compatible with Power BI Desktop December 2022 and newer.

Name: Power BI Feedback Pro
Description: Collect user feedback with ratings and comments, seamlessly integrated with Azure Application Insigh
Long Summary: Collect user feedback with ratings and comments, seamlessly integrated with Azure Application Insigh
Description Full:
Power BI User Feedback Pro

Power BI User Feedback Pro is a powerful custom visual designed to help organizations securely gather actionable insights directly from their dashboard users. This tool enables creators to understand user needs, improve dashboard usability, and deliver greater value, all while ensuring that all data remains securely within the enterprise.

Who Benefits from This Offer

This tool is ideal for:

  • Power BI Dashboard Creators: Gain valuable insights to refine dashboard design and usability.
  • Data Analysts: Collect feedback to drive data-driven improvements and optimize reporting.
  • Business Intelligence Professionals: Enhance user engagement and reporting effectiveness.
  • IT Administrators: Manage feedback data securely within enterprise environments.

Customer Needs Addressed

Understanding how dashboards perform in real-world usage is critical to ensuring their effectiveness. Power BI User Feedback Pro addresses this by:

  • Providing a seamless way to collect ratings and feedback directly within Power BI reports.
  • Ensuring secure data handling, with all feedback stored and analyzed through Azure Application Insights, keeping data within the organization’s trusted environment.
  • Offering a customizable experience that adapts to organizational needs, including branding options and advanced analytics.

Key Features

  • Real-Time Feedback Collection: Gather user ratings (1-5 stars or NPS-style 10-star ratings) and detailed comments directly within dashboards.
  • Azure Application Insights Integration: Store and analyze feedback with advanced telemetry tools, ensuring all data remains securely within the enterprise.
  • Customizable Options: Configure feedback properties like rating scales, comment boxes, and visual design to match your organization’s needs.
  • Enhanced Dashboard Usability: Use actionable insights to continuously improve Power BI reports and optimize user engagement.
  • Unlimited Dashboards: Apply the visual across as many dashboards as needed without additional licensing constraints.
  • Net Promoter Score (NPS): Use a 10-point rating scale to evaluate user satisfaction and loyalty directly in your dashboards.

Why Choose Power BI User Feedback Pro?

This tool goes beyond collecting feedback—it ensures your data is protected, remaining entirely within your organization’s control. With secure integration, actionable insights, and flexible customization, Power BI User Feedback Pro becomes an indispensable part of your Power BI ecosystem, enabling continuous improvement of reporting solutions and delivering greater value to users.

Requirements

To set up Power BI User Feedback Pro, you’ll need:

  • Access to Power BI Desktop and a Power BI Pro license.
  • An Azure Application Insights resource to collect and store feedback data.
  • Permission to configure the Power BI report and access Application Insights data.
Keywords: Power BI Feedback Visual,User Ratings for Power BI,Power BI User Feedback,Power BI Feedback Pro

Long Summary: Analyze how users interact with reports published in Power BI Online

Power BI User Tracker

Unlock Insights into User Interactions

By integrating seamlessly with Azure Application Insights, this tool empowers teams to track usage metrics, evaluate report effectiveness, and optimize dashboard performance based on real user behavior.

  • Custom Event Tracking: Log specific user activities, such as filter interactions, to assess report interactivity.

  • Data Security: All feedback and usage data is processed and stored securely within Azure Application Insights, ensuring it never leaves your organization’s control.

Who Benefits?

This visual is ideal for:

  • Reporting Managers: Optimize reporting strategies based on actual usage data.
  • Project Managers: Ensure dashboards align with project goals and stakeholder needs.
  • Developers: Gain insights to refine the design and functionality of Power BI reports.

Business Use Cases

  • Improve Adoption Rates: Take action to boost usage of key reports across the organization.

Start leveraging Power BI User Tracker to transform user behavior data into actionable insights while ensuring your feedback data remains securely within your organization.

Name: 3AG Systems – Column Chart With Upper and Lower Bounds
Description: Quickly identify out-of-bounds column chart entries.
Long Summary: Quickly identify out-of-bounds column chart entries.
Description Full:
Column Chart with Upper and Lower Bounds highlights data points that either above/below a user-defined upper/lower bound. The visualization is meant for showing out-of-range values, and can be applied to financial, operations and other use cases (for example budgeting or machine vibration).

 

Customization options include resizing the data label font sizes, adjusting units (to thousands-K, Millions-M, Billions-B), inverting out-of-bounds colors and adjusting decimal places on labels.

 

This visualization is ideal for ensuring that actual results fit within pre-defined ranges.

Name: Global Launch Estimates
Description: Visualize your locations in the Map view highlighted based on the associated year.
Long Summary: Visualize your locations in the Map view highlighted based on the associated year.
Description Full:
Global Launch Estimates is a type of chart which is used to render the locations of various companies grouped by the associated year. Locations are nothing but countries of different regions such as AfME, Asia, Europe, Lat-Am and NA. It supports two types of views, one is World map view and another one is Regional Map view. As the name suggests world map will render world map with highlighting all the countries from data based on the Year field. The Regional map view renders only the countries of particular region with zoom-in version of that region. It also renders highlight notes which is a description / writeup about the region optionally. Each country or location has a hyperlink which will point to any document related to that location. Both the views supports filtering by regions. Each location is highlighted by a color which is based on the Launch year of that location. Both the views supports legend by Year and Color.

The customization options are Title, View Regional Map, View Highlights, and Default Region.

Title: The value given in this option will be rendered as a title to the chart. For Regional Map the selected region will be rendered with the title automatically.

View Regional Map: If we enable this option, it will render the Regional map with the default region focused in.

View Highlights: This option is used to show or hide the highlights of a particular region.

Default Region: This option sets the default region to be rendered when we enable Regional map.

Limitation: The chart will show a maximum of 1000 records in the UI.

Restriction: The chart will show 1 year prior, current and 8 years in the future by default.

Name: Lipstick Column Chart
Description: Compact and precise visual comparison of two measures with a Lipstick Column Chart
Long Summary: Compact and precise visual comparison of two measures with a Lipstick Column Chart
Description Full:
Regularly the standard Clustered Column chart is used to compare two measures within a number of categories. If one of these measures has been added as a reference (secondary measure) to increase the context of the primary measure it would be better to clearly show this priority difference.

This is precisely what the Lipstick Column Chart does: It shows the primary measure per category on the foreground, and places the secondary measure behind it for a precise comparison of both values. Since both values are placed on top of each other it also becomes a more compact alternative to show both measures per category.

Key features of the Lipstick Column Chart are:

Format the objects: Each of the bars (both primary and secondary) can be formatted like the bars in the Power BI Clustered Bar/Column Chart;

The Axis formatting options are in line with the options you know from the Power BI Clustered Column & Bar Charts, so no need to learn a new interface;

Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the Lipstick Chart;

Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to Include/Exclude data points;

Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip. You can even use another report page as a tooltip.

Full Bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the Lipstick Column Chart supports Bookmarks

Conditional formatting: The Lipstick Column Chart supports conditional formatting for both bars.

Data labels: Like any standard visual you also can show data labels in the Lipstick Column Chart

Analytics lines Reference lines can be added to the Lipstick Column Chart by configuring them in the Analytics pane;

All functionality of the Lipstick Column Chart is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. A license can be purchased on our website. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

Name: Circle Packing with Clusters (BI-Champ Suite)
Description: Group data in nested circles, optionally cluster related data using machine learning
Long Summary: Group data in nested circles, optionally cluster related data using machine learning
Description Full:
This visual allows you to quickly identify possible relationships and similarity in your semantic model data, without having to resort to using R or Python: it's largely drag-drop-and-click! It uses an algorithm based on "Partition Around Medoid" (PAM), with extensions allowing one to weight features independently and search for parameters that yield more effective clustering. This is considered an example of unsupervised machine learning. It has extensions that support:
  • Circle packing (including zooming), or tabular layout styles; the circles / bubble style is often very good to visualize clusters
  • Option exists to "disable clustering" which turns the visual into a pure circle pack display
  • Can "search" text in data points, highlighting matches
  • Coloring settings, including coloring like values, highlighting medoids, etc.
  • Control over cluster naming
  • Export results to the clipboard for easy import into Excel
  • Ability to weight features automatically or manually
  • "Solution finder" - lets you explore different settings to find "better" solutions
  • Cross-filtering and drill through support
The sample pbix file that can be downloaded here and on bizintelligencechampions.com provides a detailed look at how you can use this visual; we highly encourage reviewing it since it can answer many questions (along with the video below).

The visual is free to use in Power BI Desktop for one user. Name: Ahp Decision Maker
Description: A multi-criteria decision support tool, calculate which are the best choices.
Long Summary: A multi-criteria decision support tool, calculate which are the best choices.

Ahp Decision Maker is a multi-criteria decision support tool that uses the AHP (Analytic Hierarchy Process) method. It allows you to define criteria that should be maximized or minimized and, based on this, calculates the percentage preference for each option, helping you identify the best choice.

Name: Collage by CloudScope
Description: Collage displays images in the style of Instagram, using either a grid or detail display.
Long Summary: Collage displays images in the style of Instagram, using either a grid or detail display.
Description Full:
Collage is a way to beautifully display images within your Power BI report.

You can display images in either a compact grid display or a larger detail view in a style similar to Instagram. To display an image, you provide a url. In addition to the image url, you can optionally display any of the following field types:

  • Caption
  • Media date
  • Media type
  • Video url
  • Permalink
  • Author profile image
  • Author name

In addition, you can provide any generic data fields that you wish (number, true/false, date, string). These data elements will be automatically formatted in the familiar Instagram style for numbers and dates.

Collage can act as a filter to other visuals within your report. It also fully supports the Power BI bookmark feature.

Licensing

Collage requires a license, except for when used in the Power BI Desktop application. For most organizations, you can choose an inexpensive per-user license option in the AppSource store.

Please note that the AppSource license does not support "Publish to Web" or "Embedded" scenarios. To enable Collage to work in unsupported environments, visit the Collage page to learn more.

Name: Workforce
Description: Visualize your workforce in a tabular view.
Long Summary: Visualize your workforce in a tabular view.
Description Full:
Workforce is a type of chart which is used to render companies and their staffs in a table view. Each department or Product or sub division of the company can be rendered as column in a table. Each column or vertical view has company name, product name, no of staffs and staff details. The staff details are categorized into four levels which are Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4. It supports two types of footer texts. One is per column and other is global footer for the visual.

The customization options are Title, Row Titles, Footer Text, Flag, Header Image URL and Footer Image URL.

Title: The value given in this option will be rendered as a title to the chart.

Row Titles: By usng this option we can rename the staff categories which are Level 1, Level 2, Level 3 and Level 4 by default.

Footer Text: This option is used specify the global footer for the visual.

Flag: This option is used to render a flag by country name at the top left corner of the visual.

Header Image URL: The URL given in this field will be rendered as an image to the header of the report.

Footer Image URL: The URL given in this field will be rendered as an image to the footer of the report.

Following are the limitations within the visualization
The visulization will show a maximum of 10 records in the UI.

For Support: powerbi-support@theratraq.com

Name: Video Pro by CloudScope
Description: Make your reports come alive with the power of video
Long Summary: Make your reports come alive with the power of video
Description Full:
Add video to your Power BI report, and instantly add context, understanding and engagement. This visual is designed for businesses of all sizes.

Video Pro by CloudScope works using video information supplied by your report's dataset. You can also add tooltips for additional context.

You can set options to enhance the video presentation, including whether to display user controls, allow auto-play, support looping and more.

Formats supported

Video supports all of the popular video formats, including mp4, mov, webm and ogg. Because of Power BI security restrictions, Video doesn't work with commercial video platforms like YouTube or Vimeo.

It's important to understand that as a certified visual, Video Pro can't access external resources like video files using a URL. You must embed all of the data used to display a video within your report's dataset. Because of this restriction, the maximum size of the videos supported by Video Pro is relatively small - about 1.6mb. If you want to display larger videos, try the uncertified version - Video by CloudScope.

Licensing

Video Pro by CloudScope requires a license. For smaller organizations or teams, you can choose an inexpensive per-user option in the AppSource store. For larger user communities or for environments that are not supported by AppSource licensing, contact CloudScope.

Please note that the AppSource license does not support "Publish to Web" or "Embedded" scenarios. To enable Video Pro to work in unsupported environments, contact CloudScope directly for a license.

Name: X-Bar and Range Control Chart by PQ Systems
Description: An SPC chart for analysis of process stability and variability of data with many values per subgroup
Long Summary: An SPC chart for analysis of process stability and variability of data with many values per subgroup
Description Full: This chart type is used for subgrouped data, where each subgroup is made up of two or more values. Points plotted on this chart are the average (X-bar) of the subgroup data. This chart shows an indication of central tendency, or where the charted data is centered. X-bar charts can give an understanding about the variation between subgroups. Control charts are designed to help to understand and reduce variation in a process over time. More specifically, they are designed to minimize two common mistakes: 1. Adjusting a process when it would be better to leave it alone. 2. Not adjusting a process when an adjustment is likely required. Control charts help to predict how a process will behave. If a reasonable number of data points all show as in-control on a control chart, you can make a useful prediction about your process: Unless the process is changed in some way, it will continue to produce results centered on this mean and varying within these limits. If the control chart shows data points that are outside the limits or trends, or runs above or below the mean, this does not allow you to make a useful prediction about your process. This process is not stable and not predictable. Unless something is changed, we cannot be certain about the mean or the dispersion of data resulting from this process. This predictive nature of control charts and their ability to minimize the mistakes described above are what makes them such valuable business tools. When to use this chart: 1. When you want to see if your process is stable and predictable; 2. When you want to see how planned change affects a process; 3. When the time order of the data values is preserved; 4. When you have collected data in subgroups of two or more. This chart is part of PI VIZpack™ by PQ Systems, a collection of eight process improvement charts for Power BI®. They provide a clear way to visualize and evaluate process behavior and performance. Get started with a free two-week trial today. After the trial, you may continue using the basic features or upgrade to the premium version. To learn more visit our website.
Keywords: lean,six,sigma,X-Bar and Range Control Chart by PQ Systems
Simple Filename: X-Bar and Range Control Chart by PQ Systems

Long Summary: Display beautiful data-bound images with tooltips and links using data from your Power BI reports.
Description Full:
Image Pro is designed to bring your compelling images into your Power BI report.

Does your dataset include image data? These could include company logos, product images, employee photos and more. Using Image, you can display these images right within your reports with the appropriate context.

If your data includes other fields, you can add a tooltip to the image, or turn it into a clickable link that will direct users to a relevant URL.

Image includes a variety of formatting options designed to highlight your images in the best way. You can add borders, stretch and fill images, and turn them into round icons.

Image turns every report designer into a graphic artist, allowing you to manipulate images through CSS to create maximum impact.

Images supported

Image Pro works with a variety of image formats, including gif, jpg, png and svg. However as a certified visual, this visual does not support links to external images via http or https. Your data must be stored within your own dataset, typically in base64 or svg format.

Name: Milestone Trend Analysis Chart
Description: Effectively manage multiple projects and track their progress with valuable visual insights
Long Summary: Effectively manage multiple projects and track their progress with valuable visual insights
Description Full:
In every medium to large project there is a set of milestones. Milestones are critical moments during a project that are used to mark project progress. But we also know the dates of these milestones can change: some are brought forward and some get delayed.

These changes in milestone dates are early warning signals of challenges in your project's progress. The Milestone Trend Analysis Chart for Power BI gives every project manager a clear overview of these changes. It visualizes what is and is not working in the project. It also helps identify patterns and scope issues while conducting project risk analysis.

Key features of the Milestone Trend Analysis Chart are:

  • Visualization of milestone trends: get a clear overview of multiple milestone changes and easily detect the milestones brought forward or delayed;
  • Formatting options are in line with the options you know from the Power BI Line Chart, so no need to learn a new interface. And of course, theme colors and settings are supported;
  • Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the Milestone Trend Analysis Chart;
  • Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to include and exclude data points;
  • Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behavior (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip;
  • Full Bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the Milestone Trend Analysis Chart supports Bookmarks.

All functionality of the Milestone Trend Analysis Chart is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. This can be an effective way to tell a story that involves progress to goal, relative values, explanation of values, and much more. This is extremely well-suited to building compelling infographics, and serves well as a gauge.

Name: Dumbbell Column Chart
Description: Unleash the power of comparison with the Dumbbell Column Chart
Long Summary: Unleash the power of comparison with the Dumbbell Column Chart
Description Full:
Data visualisations play a fundamental role in answering an important data question:”How does result A compare to result B?”. Typical examples of these questions are:

  • How does the sales of this month compare to the sales of last month?

  • What is the difference between the number of documents processed this year compared to last year?

  • How does the number of planned-visitors compare to the number of unplanned-visitors at our locations?

Key in answering these kind of questions is explicitly visualising the difference between the two results. This is the strength of the Dumbbell Column Chart: showing the values and the difference between them.

Key features of the Dumbbell Column Chart are:

Format the objects: Each of the data point objects (marker and line) can be formatted by selecting a color and size. Additional, the line can be switched on/off and for the marker one can switch on/off the fill color. You can also select a marker style from a number of shapes;

The Axis formatting options are in line with the options you know from the Power BI Clustered Column & Bar Charts, so no need to learn a new interface;

Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & (Partial) Highlighting functions within the Dumbbell Column Chart;

Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to Include/Exclude data points;

Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip. You can even use another report page as a tooltip.

Full Bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the Dumbbell Column Chart supports Bookmarks

Data labels: Like any standard visual you also can show data labels in the Dumbbell Column Chart

Conditional formatting The markers and lines support conditional formatting to change their appearance based on data and rules;

Analytics lines Reference lines can be added to the Dumbbell Column Chart by configuring them in the Analytics pane;

All functionality of the Dumbbell Column Chart is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. A license can be purchased on our website. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

Name: Animator for Power BI
Description: Create custom, data-driven chart and infographic animations based on any SVG image.
Long Summary: Create custom, data-driven chart and infographic animations based on any SVG image.
Description Full:
The Inovista Animator is a web based application that allows users to import SVG images and create intelligent animations that change their behavior based on external data. This Power BI visual allows a user to take a data-driven animation created in the Inovista Animator and load it into Power BI.

Variables in the animation can be linked directly to Power BI data values or defined as user editable properties. In the Animator, a full range of animations are available including Movement, Rotation, Scaling, Path Animation, Text Animation, Clipping, Masking, Text Offsets, Morphing and Wave Motions. Animation can also be driven by events such as mouse clicks.

Highlights
  • This extension will take any animation created in the Inovista Animator and convert it into a Power BI component. Animations may be charts or infographics driven by Power BI data or simply decorative items such as moving logos.
  • The animations can be exported from the Animator as JSON files or they can be copied to the clipboard. In Power BI, the JSON file can be loaded or can be pasted directly from the clipboard.
  • In the Animator, all aspects of the animation can be modified by creating variables, for example how much of an image to display to simulate a bar chart. Each variable can be defined as either a data item or property. In Power BI, data items are linked to Power BI data and properties can be set by the user. Examples of properties may be fonts or colors.
  • Once defined, data values can be updated by filters or any data update.
  • Tooltips are available for all data driven element in the image. Each item has an optional tooltip checkbox which shows or hides the element tooltip

Name: ValQ-Plan
Description: ValQ for planning, budgeting, forecasting, what-if simulations, scenario analysis and reporting
Long Summary: ValQ for planning, budgeting, forecasting, what-if simulations, scenario analysis and reporting
Description Full:
Introducing ValQ, the modern no-code planning solution that is very intuitive, interactive and for instant strategic decision making. It integrates seamlessly with Microsoft Power BI. ValQ has been architected and modernized to Unlock wide range of your planning and forecasting use cases with ValQ's innovative visual no-code business modelling user experience.

  • Independent and Serverless: ValQ operates without the need for databases, servers, or IT support, offering a hassle-free experience.
  • Analyst-Centric Design: No coding or scripting skills are required to build models in ValQ
  • Scalable Templates: Easily scale your model using templates while keeping it dynamic
  • Mathematical Formulae & Functions: Leverage a library of spreadsheet-like mathematical formulae and functions to build complex planning models.
  • Simple Model Management: Live data preview, error validation, bulk editing capabilities, advanced search, and filtering for smooth model management.
  • Notes: Perform cell-level and node-level notes.
  • Reporting: Generate reports in various styles with charts and export them to Excel/PDF.
  • Generate reports of different styles with charts and export to excel/pdf
  • Presentations: Interactive Presentation Mode: Present your finalized decisions to management with an interactive presentation mode that delivers a seamless experience

Simulations & Analysis

  • What-If Simulations: Perform what-if simulations on the fly using a drag-drop interface and visualize impact on outcomes instantly & intuitively in tree as well as spreadsheet like format
  • Scenario Comparisons: Create multiple scenarios and compare scenario outcomes in a few minutes, not hours.
  • Insights and Decisions: Gain valuable insights into model performance with chart visuals and make quick actionable decisions using the KPI tracker.

Time-Series forecasting

  • Multiple Methods: Perform time-series forecasting without external libraries. Choose from various methods like Linear Trend, Weighted Average, Moving Average, ARIMA, Single Exponential Smoothing, Holt’s Method, and Holt’s Winter Method.

Planning

  • Plan Creation: Create plans based on recent performance, forecasting methods, or start from scratch with a blank template for zero-based budgeting
  • Smart Planning Interface: Leverage an intelligent and editable table interface for intuitive top-down and bottom-up planning, complete with simple mathematical operations with scaling.
  • Efficient Updates: Automatically distribute updates across planning hierarchies and time with spreading and allocation methods, including weights-based, trend-based, and driver-based, along with goal seeking.

Additional Information

Name: Chart Flare
Description: Ring Chart Custom Visual for Power BI.
Long Summary: Ring Chart Custom Visual for Power BI.
Description Full:
Ring Chart Custom Visual for Power BI, a captivating circular data visualization tool designed to enhance your reports designed to help track your KPI's.
Explore our Ring Chart Custom Visual, a captivating circular data visualization tool designed to enhance your reports. This visually engaging chart provides an intuitive way to present and analyze key metrics effortlessly. 
With customizable colors and dynamic data visualization, the Ring Chart adds a modern touch to your reports, ensuring an enriched experience for users. Name: Cycle Plot
Description: Discover your seasonal patterns with the Cycle Plot
Long Summary: Discover your seasonal patterns with the Cycle Plot
Description Full:
Time series data are great to clarify the changes over time in measures, and the line chart is the favourite chart for this type of data. But displaying results with a normal line chart can also obscure important patterns, especially if the measure contains some form of seasonality. The Cycle Plot (first introduced by Cleveland, Dunn, and Terpenning in 1978) is a type of line chart specifically developed to show seasonal time series.

The Cycle Plot helps you to visualise trends within your seasonal data. It has the strengths of common line charts, without obscuring important cyclical patterns. The cycle plot offers a great deal of flexibility in the choice of your variables: think of months vs. year, hours vs. day or months vs. presidential period.

Let’s illustrate this with an example. Say we are looking at temperatures in a certain city over a few years. We expect that Winters are colder than Summers. Plotting this with a line chart will yield a line with a cyclical pattern: low values in Winter, high values in Summer. However, it's hard to tell if temperatures in January are increasing or decreasing over the years. With the Cycle Plot, a subplot can be created for each month, showing the change in temperatures over time for that month. All the subplots together still show the seasonal pattern as well, as seen in the image below.

Key features of the Cycle Plot are:

  • Show central line: Add a median or average line per subplot, to provide more context to your chart;
  • Format the objects: Your measurements and central lines can be formatted independently, and supports the theme settings;
  • The Axis formatting options are in line with the options you know from the Power BI Line Chart, so no need to learn a new interface;
  • Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the Cycle Plot;
  • Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to (amongst others) Drill down and Include/Exclude data points;
  • Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip;
  • Full Bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the Cycle Plot supports Bookmarks.

All functionality of the Cycle Plot is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

This visual is compatible with Power BI Desktop May 2020 and newer

Name: Gas Detection Chart
Description: Displays gas readings over time.
Long Summary: Displays gas readings over time.
Description Full:
PowerBI Gas Exposure Analytics App for Industrial Safety
In the complex environments of oil & gas, petrochemical refining, drilling, and construction operations, the safety and well-being of personnel hinge on the meticulous monitoring of gas exposures. The PowerBI Gas Exposure Analytics App is engineered to meet this critical need, offering a sophisticated yet intuitive solution for visualizing gas readings from multiple sensors across various units of measure.

Value Proposition:
Our app revolutionizes the way Industrial Hygienists, Safety Leaders, Operations Managers, and Technicians visualize and interpret gas exposure data. Traditional methods often fall short in providing a cohesive view of gas readings, especially when dealing with multiple sensors and fluctuating data points. Our solution addresses this challenge head-on by employing small multiples to keep readings for each gas distinct, yet interconnected. This design choice is crucial for identifying relationships between different gas sensors, which can be influenced by factors such as cross-sensitivity or environmental changes. The app's ability to display sensor data alongside alarm thresholds and operational modes offers a comprehensive overview, enabling users to make informed decisions swiftly.

For the Business Audience:
Designed with the needs of industrial safety professionals in mind, our app offers a seamless integration into the daily workflow of Industrial Hygienists, Safety Leaders, Operations Managers, and Technicians. Whether it's gauging personal gas exposures, assessing risk levels in operational areas, or detecting equipment faults and fugitive emissions, our app provides a clear, actionable insight that is critical in maintaining safety standards and ensuring operational efficiency in high-risk industries.

Target Industries:
Tailored for the demanding environments of oil & gas, petrochemical refining, drilling, and construction, our app is a vital tool for any organization committed to upholding the highest safety standards. The visual design makes this chart an indispensable asset for companies operating in these sectors.

Innovative Features:
•	Multiple Sensor Visualization: Our app displays data from various gas sensors, ensuring a comprehensive monitoring system that reflects the complexity of industrial environments.
•	Dynamic Thresholds and Alerts: Set and view multiple sensor alarm thresholds, allowing for immediate response to potential hazards.
•	Interactive Time Slicing: Utilize the click-and-drag slicer to zoom into specific time periods, focusing on the data that matters most.
•	Operational Mode Insights: Track different operational modes of the devices and sensors, such as diffusion and pump-driven gas detection, providing deeper insights into the data.

In summary, the PowerBI Gas Exposure Analytics App is more than a visualization tool—it's an integral component of your safety protocol, ensuring that every decision is informed, timely, and data-driven. Elevate your safety standards and operational efficiency with an app designed to meet the challenges of today's industrial landscape.

Name: Go To Stratum
Description: Go From Dashboard Visualization To Actionable Data In A Single Click.
Long Summary: Go From Dashboard Visualization To Actionable Data In A Single Click.
Description Full:
The Go To Stratum visual links together the data on your Power BI Desktop with related outside information using URL access. Quickly and seamlessly move from a high-level visualization in your Power BI dashboard to a website that displays detail data that drives greater insights and supplies actionable information.  

In the Go To Stratum visual, simply identify the “Field that Contains a URL” on the fields tab. This field will be used to open a new browser tab when the user selects an associated value in a Power BI visual. Click the configured Go To Stratum visual whenever you need to see the linked data.  

For any feature requests or questions about this visual send an email to our team at info@Silvon.com.

Name: 3DBI
Description: Bring spatial insight to your data.
Long Summary: Bring spatial insight to your data.
Description Full:
3DBI is a 3D model viewer for Microsoft Power BI.
The 3DBI visual will allow you to visualize your data about your assets directly in its spatial context. Use cases range from Property Management, BIM (quantities, scheduling, …) to plotting IoT data (color and filter objects by temperature, humidity, co2-levels, occupancy, wear, …) as well as Logistics (stock management, order picking, …) and Energy (plotting yield of solar panels or windmill farms) or any other sector where you might have a need for visualizing data in a 3D environment.

Out of the box, and without an AppSource license, the 3DBI visual allows you to load in .3dbi files, created with one of the Creational tools offered by INFORMAXYZ (read more below). With an AppSource license, the 3DBI viewer can also load in open 3D file formats, such as Collada (.dae), created with a wide range of available 3D modelling applications.

The Creational tools INFORMAXYZ currently has available to create .3dbi files are:
1.	Trimble SketchUp: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-sketchup/
2.	Autodesk Revit: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-revit/
3.	IFC files: https://kg-dev.be/project/3dbi-for-ifc/

Tutorials on how to generate a model suitable for the 3DBI visual for Power BI can be found on the respective pages. Licensing information for those Creational tools is also available on the same pages.

Name: Icon Map Pro
Description: Advanced geospatial analytics made simple with Icon Map Pro for Microsoft Power BI
Long Summary: Advanced geospatial analytics made simple with Icon Map Pro for Microsoft Power BI
Description Full:
Icon Map Pro, the new professional version of Icon Map from Tekantis, has been built from the ground up with an extensive set of new features and a simplified interface. This tool offers a robust solution for visualising and analysing geospatial data within Microsoft Power BI. It is designed for data analysts, GIS specialists, and business intelligence professionals, addressing the need for seamless integration of geographic insights into BI dashboards. Users can effortlessly transform complex geospatial data into actionable visuals, enhancing decision-making and strategic planning with the intuitive low-code/no-code Power BI interface.

Icon Map Pro provides an extensive list of capabilities including:

Background mapping

  • Background maps with multiple styles from Icon Map's own servers
  • Support (with an API key) for third party background maps including; Azure Maps, Esri ArcGIS, Google Maps, Mapbox, MapTiler and Ordnance Survey
  • Support for custom background maps from raster, vector and WMS sources

Overlays & reference layers

  • Daylight terminator
  • GeoJSON, Esri Shapefile, KML files
  • ArcGIS feature layers (with an API key)
  • Weather from Azure Maps or OpenWeatherMap (with an API key)
  • Traffic from Google Maps or Azure Maps (with an API key)
  • Custom raster or WMS layers

Data layers

  • Circles and clustered circles
  • Images including those hosted within the Power BI data
  • Shapes from Power BI data in Well Known Text (WKT) and GeoJSON formats
  • Shapes from remotely hosted files or uploaded local files in Esri Shapefile, GeoJSON or KML formats
  • ArcGIS feature layers (with an API key)
  • Lines
  • H3 cells (hexagons)
  • Vector tiles
  • Heatmap
  • Data-bound text labels
  • Ability to exceed 30000 rows of data (may impact performance)

General

  • Lasso tool, distance measurement, scale (metric, imperial, nautical), zoom and zoom lock controls
  • Drill-down and drill-through support
  • Support for customizable tooltips and report page tooltips
  • Extensive conditional formatting options

For enterprise licensing or support for Power BI Embedded, Publish to Web, Government and Regional Clouds and Power BI Report Server, please contact sales@tekantis.com.

Name: Inforiver Writeback Matrix for Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting
Description: Enterprise-grade writeback matrix for building connected & secure planning (xP&A / FP&A / EPM) apps
Long Summary: Enterprise-grade writeback matrix for building connected & secure planning (xP&A / FP&A / EPM) apps
Description Full:
Inforiver Writeback Matrix is the most comprehensive no-code writeback and planning solution for Power BI. It supports data write back to on-premise & cloud destinations including SQLServer, Azure SQL, Azure Synapse, Fabric Lakehouse/ Warehouse, Dataverse, Snowflake, Databricks, RedShift, BigQuery, OneDrive, SharePoint, and webhook REST API endpoint URL destinations.

KEY FEATURES

The Inforiver Writeback Matrix delivers all features supported by Inforiver Reporting Matrix, and more:

  • Advanced data input field types - including numeric, text, single/multi select dropdowns, check box, person and date fields
  • Write back/ save data in SQL and Parquet formats; write back from reading view; write back specific rows & columns; write back with context set by external slicers; use webhooks to trigger Power Automate workflows, Azure functions, HTTP / XMLA endpoints
  • Create secure comments and conversations; tag users; trigger notifications; schedule comment digests;
  • Create static snapshots after period close or at custom frequencies; compare variances;
  • Create and compare planning scenarios; write back scenarios
  • Self-service scheduling and bursting of reports; schedule at custom frequencies; schedule to multiple users based on report tabs, custom filters, etc., schedule PDF/Excel reports to external stakeholders
  • Enhance writeback scalability and performance through filter context support and chunk processing options
USE CASES

The key features listed above unlock new use cases that were not possible with Power BI earlier. Some of them include:

1. Create templates to capture user data inputs during planning

Create Excel-like templates where multiple users can enter data in reading view; Leverage advanced security and permissions;

2. Build Integrated Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting Applications (xP&A)

Create discrete planning apps and consolidate plans in a single report. E.g., Consolidate Salary, OpEx, Revenue, and COGS Plans from different reports into a single company-level P&L plan.

  • Create budgets from scratch, or based on prior year actuals
  • Create forecasts easily for up to 5 years
  • Perform rolling forecasts with closing periods
  • Perform top-down planning allocations & distributions (based on other measures or drivers)
  • Use goal seek capabilities
  • Lock/unlock specific cells, rows & columns for editing
  • ... and more
3. Aggregate, Transform & Stream live data between Power BI reports

The Writeback Matrix now comes with InfoBridge®, a new service that helps you aggregate, transform, pivot and stream data live between reports. Imagine these scenarios:

  • A sales forecast app can stream 'quantity sold' to a COGS planning app
  • A granular daily sales forecast app built for Germany feeds data to a global sales app that summarizes weekly sales by country.
ENTERPRISE-GRADE SECURITY & GOVERNANCE

The writeback matrix delivers comprehensive security and governance.

  • Admin-level security: Control user access to writeback destinations and connections
  • User-level security: Designate specific users with column-level permissions / ACL (data input fields), row level permissions (insert row), create scenarios, lock/unlock cells, etc.,
  • Define approval workflow mechanism for data writeback and streaming.
  • Review & approve adjustments made by users along with comments while showing current vs. previous values.
  • Use audit log to track who-changed-what-and-when.

Explore More

Visit our website to learn about our offerings and pricing. Connect with us on LinkedIn and YouTube. Join the conversation in our community or schedule a demo with our sales team.

Name: Inforiver Premium Table
Description: Built for high-volume workloads to handle wide data, large table, and up to 1,000 columns exportable
Long Summary: Built for high-volume workloads to handle wide data, large table, and up to 1,000 columns exportable
Description Full:
Inforiver Premium Table offers a no-code interface to create smart, interactive tables—fully customizable and export-ready.

🌟Handle large datasets with an interactive, high-performance table—offering advanced formatting, filtering, and pixel-perfect exports in Power BI.

Why Inforiver Table Is the Clear Choice

  • 📦 Scales to large and wide datasets effortlessly with support up to 1000 columns,ensuring fast performance for complex, wide-format reports
  • 📊 Display Multiple Measures Showcase AC, PY, PL, and FC side by side for quick variance analysis—ideal for business and financial reporting
  • ◀️ ▶️ Pagination Support Navigate large datasets easily with built-in pagination and row selector controls
  • 📤 Export all data regardless of what is visible on the screen along with formatting preserved

Inforiver - Premium Table vs Reporting Matrix: When to Use What

Feature Premium Table Reporting Matrix
Layout Flat, row-wise (Excel-style) Pivoted, grid-style with row/column hierarchies
Aggregation Raw or pre-aggregated Dynamically grouped & calculated
Hierarchy Support Minimal; Column grouping only Strong; row and column hierarchies
Export Capability Pixel-perfect Excel/PDF exports Structured, grouped export
Best For Detailed, operational, or audit reports Aggregated summaries, performance comparisons

INFORIVER TABLE HIGHLIGHTS:

1. 🧰 Advanced Table Capabilities

  • Support for up to 1000 columns for wide datasets and detailed analysis
  • Organize related columns into groups with expand/collapse controls
  • Blend fields into one smart cell
  • Speed up reporting with ready-to-use templates
  • Built-in total calculations—no formulas required
  • Pin columns for easier navigation
  • Top N filtering with % options and customizable "Others" group
  • Filtering by dimensions, measures, and dates

2. 🎨 Formatting & Visual Presentation

  • Format cells with fonts and colors, and highlight key data using conditional formats like color scales, data bars, and quick rules
  • Hide/unhide rows, columns, values & measures
  • Skip rows that impact the total by hiding them, or skip and show rows to retain their impact while keeping them visible
  • In-cell charts, smart scaling, and fixed column widths for clean, consistent tables

3. 📊 Data Input & Calculation

  • Add rows, enter data in-cell, and build custom columns with Excel-style formulas
  • Excel-like formulas with 70+ functions across math, logical, text, finance, and statistics
  • Input data and easily distribute it across rows or columns
  • Granular control over aggregation methods including visible rounding for financial accuracy

4. 📝 Annotations & Notes

  • Add notes at cell, row, column, or header levels with customizable colors and backgrounds
  • Footer notes and notes column
  • Access all notes in a centralized panel with a dedicated summary section for overall commentary

5. 📚 Export & Configuration Management

  • Formatted export preserving styles, notes, and conditional format
  • PDF with custom page settings & backup/restore configs via JSON

Learn more about this visual:

  • Technical resources - Inforiver website
  • Have queries about the visual? Reach at Inforiver Community
