Name: Zebra BI Tables
Description: Create P&Ls, variance analyses, and interactive dashboards with the leading Power BI matrix visual
Long Summary: Create P&Ls, variance analyses, and interactive dashboards with the leading Power BI matrix visual
Description Full:
Zebra BI Tables is the #1 table visual for Power BI, built for fast, flexible, and decision-ready reporting. From P&L statements to variance reports and sales dashboards, create powerful, actionable business reports with just a few clicks. Gain immediate insights with the combination of tables and charts.

Start your 30-day free Pro trial of Zebra BI Tables.


Built for Financial, Sales & Operational Reporting

Zebra BI Tables offers a unique possibility to create reports with calculation logic (invert, result, skip) like P&Ls with a single click. By adding it to the data model directly, the logic is applied to the table with a single drag and drop.


Use Zebra BI Tables for diverse business cases:

  • Consolidated financials dashboards
  • Cost center reports and budget vs. actual comparisons
  • Price-volume-mix variance analysis for sales and profitability
  • Sales dashboards and KPI tracking
  • Product and brand portfolio reports
  • Inventory and working capital management
  • HR analysis
  • Commentary-rich dashboards for executive reporting

Choose the Right Table Type for Every Use Case

With Zebra BI Tables, you get 4 purpose-built Power BI table visuals:

  • Comparison tables with automatic variance calculations
  • Hierarchical tables for expandable, multi-level analysis
  • Cross-tab tables for dynamic row and column breakdowns
  • Calculation tables for finance layouts like income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow reports

Perfect for Forecasting in Power BI

  • Add up to 3 measures for Plan, Actual, Forecast
  • Built-in absolute and relative variance analysis
  • Seamless table-to-chart slider
  • Scenario comparisons across periods, versions, or departments

Interactive Matrix Visual with Drill-Down & Variances

  • Drill-down, drill-up, expand all
  • Top N + Others
  • Smart page tooltips and dynamic visual titles
  • Fully responsive layout for web and mobile

Customize with Full Flexibility

  • Create up to 20 custom-calculated measures
  • Quick functions: % of Grand Total, running totals, etc.
  • Advanced formula editor
  • Fully adaptable layout, styling, and formatting options
  • Insert brand images in rows

Power BI Commentary with Dynamic Annotations

Zebra BI Tables includes powerful dynamic comments that help you deliver context-rich insights directly within your reports, no need for data model changes or external tools.

  • Add, edit, and delete comments directly on the visual
  • Fully responsive to slicers and filters
  • Highlight key trends, outliers, or insights
  • Combine numbers with qualitative explanations
  • Empower teams to collaborate on performance reviews

Certified and Secure

Zebra BI Tables is a Microsoft-certified custom visual, ensuring full compliance, performance, and security for all users.

It is also IBCS® certified, promoting best-practice standards for consistent, data-driven storytelling across your organization.


Works Seamlessly with Zebra BI Charts & Cards

Pair Zebra BI Tables with Zebra BI Charts and Zebra BI Cards to unlock fully integrated, visual-first reporting across all business functions.


Free & Pro Versions Available

Zebra BI Tables is available as a free Power BI visual on AppSource with limited features. Unlock full functionality with a Zebra BI Pro license.

Migrating from an Earlier Version?

If you're currently using Zebra BI Tables 5.4, contact us at support@zebrabi.com for help upgrading to the latest version.

Name: Markdown & Mermaid Visual
Description: Markdown viewer and editor for Power BI with Mermaid Diagramming and charting tool
Long Summary: Markdown viewer and editor for Power BI with Mermaid Diagramming and charting tool
Description Full:
Markdown language markup

Markdown viewer and editor for Power BI, powered by react-md-editor and Mermaid

What is markdown markup language?

Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor. John Gruber created Markdown in 2004 as an easy to read markup language. Markdown is widely used for blogging and instant messaging, and also used elsewhere in online forums, collaborative software, documentation pages, and readme files.

Source: en.wikipedia.org

Name: BumpChart by iFour
Description: The Bump Chart for Power BI tracks ranking changes over time, highlighting trends.
Long Summary: The Bump Chart for Power BI tracks ranking changes over time, highlighting trends.
Description Full:
The Bump Chart custom visual for Power BI provides an engaging method to visualize shifts in rankings or positions over time. It is particularly effective for illustrating how entities such as products, teams, or individuals experience changes in their ranks. visual tool highlights relative changes and patterns among various categories, delivering insightful perspectives on performance dynamics. Users can extensively customize the visual, including options for modifying the X-axis, Y-axis, Legend, Line, Marker and Gridlines.

Key feature

  • X-axis setting-: The X-axis plays a crucial role in data visualization, and this feature offers extensive customization options. users can modify the font size, font family, and font color to enhance readability.

  • Y-axis setting-: Users can personalize the Y-axis settings based on their data representation needs,font adjustments for axis labels are available.

  • Legend setting-: The legend is essential for understanding the different data series in a chart,with this feature, users can modify the text appearance.

  • Line setting-: Users can fine-tune the appearance of lines in the visual, includes modifying the line thickness, changing colors dynamically based on data values, and selecting different line styles (solid, dashed, dotted) to distinguish trends effectively.

  • Marker setting-: Markers help highlight specific data points in bump charts,users can select marker shapes choose from circles, squares, triangles, and more. Modify marker size Increase or decrease marker size for better emphasis. change marker colors apply custom colors to differentiate between data series.

  • Datalabel-: Enabling data labels provides a direct view of values on the chart and allows users to toggle data labels on and off, customize font styles.

  • Gridlines-: Gridlines act as reference guides in a chart. Users can enable or disable gridlines choose whether to display them. adjust gridline thickness make gridlines more prominent or subtle. customize gridline color change to match the chart’s overall theme. apply dashed or solid styles differentiate major and minor gridlines.

Business use cases

  • Market share analysis-: Company wants to analyze the market positions of key competitors over the past five years. By leveraging a bump chart, the company can track how its ranking fluctuates against competitors, allowing for strategic decision-making to strengthen its market presence.

  • Employee performance tracking-: A company uses a bump chart to visualize the rankings of employees based on performance metrics over time. This helps HR managers identify consistent top performers and those who need development support.

  • Product sales trends-: A retail business tracks the ranking of various products in terms of sales volume over the last 12 months. The bump chart helps identify which products are gaining popularity and which ones are declining.

  • Website traffic sources-: Marketing teams analyze the ranking of different traffic sources (organic, paid ads, social media, referrals) over time to optimize digital marketing strategies based on the most effective channels.

  • Sports team rankings-: Sports analysts track the rankings of different teams throughout a season, using a bump chart to visualize changes in performance and strategize accordingly.

Visualize ranking shifts over time with our engaging Bump Chart custom visual. We offer Power BI consulting services to help you with personalized visuals that work for you. Partner with iFour and get started now!

Name: Territory Visual by EasyTerritory

Long Summary: The Territory Visual, based on Azure Maps, brings spatial business intelligence to Power BI!
Description Full:
Does your business need to analyze and easily share territory maps across the enterprise? From the developers of EasyTerritory, the Territory Visual for Power BI lets you get the most from your business information!

The EasyTerritory Territory Visual supports consuming territory polygons (GeoJSON) defined in the EasyTerritory web portal. EasyTerritory is the leading territory management solution that provides access to postal code (ZIP Code) data for the United States many more countries for building territory polygons with ease. Additionally, the Territory Visual can be used to map business (point) data such as accounts, leads, and opportunities.

Territory Visual Features:

  • Territory Drilldown: Drill-down down through up to 8 levels of territory hierarchy

  • 8 Levels of Territory Drilldown: Easily connect to your data and display territory polygons.

  • Heat Map Classification: Color-code your territories based on any metrics from your data model.

  • Custom Heat Map Classification Ranges: Choose your own custom ranges for heat maps.

  • Territory Lookup: Look up an address to quickly jump to the right location on the map.

  • Business Intelligence: Add in your business data such leads, accounts, and opportunities as points to determine how your territories are performing.

Name: PieChart by iFour
Description: Pie chart visually represents proportions of a whole, with labeled slices for each category
Long Summary: Pie chart visually represents proportions of a whole, with labeled slices for each category
Description Full:
A custom visual pie chart divides data into colored slices, each representing a category with size proportional to its share of the whole. Features include category labels, dynamic colors, interactive tooltips, and optional legends and animations. Users can click slices for filtering, making it ideal for visually exploring parts-to-whole relationships.

Key features

  • Width-: Modify the width to change the overall size and proportions of the Pie chart.

  • Rotation-: Rotate the chart to change the viewing angle, making specific slices more prominent.

  • DataLables-: Our visual offers flexible data labeling options, allowing you to toggle visibility, adjust font size and color, and fine-tune numeric formatting (e.g., units and precision). Perfect for delivering precise insights at a glance.

  • Legends and tooltips-: Enable a legend to label slices and apply custom styles. Tooltips display additional details when hovering over slices.

  • Interactive filtering-: Click on any slice to filter your dataset in real time, making it easier to analyze individual segments.

  • Slice color setting-: This feature enables users to personalize the color scheme of the chart slices, Users can assign specific colors to each data category, improving the visual distinction between slices.

Business use cases

  • Sales data analysis-: Visualize the contribution of different products or regions to total sales.

  • Market share comparison-: Compare the market share of different companies or products.

  • Customer segmentation-: Show the distribution of customers across different segments like age groups, regions, or purchase categories.

  • Expense breakdown-: Display the proportion of different expense categories in a budget.

  • Survey results-: Illustrate the percentage of responses for different survey options.

Enhance your reports with a custom-built Pie chart visual. Our Power BI consulting services help you get visuals that work exactly how you need them to. Partner with iFour now.

Phone: +1 410 892 1119

Name: graphomate matrix
Description: Meaningful Tabular Visualization: Data-Driven, Fully IBCS-Compliant, In-Cell Charts and Calculations
Long Summary: Meaningful Tabular Visualization: Data-Driven, Fully IBCS-Compliant, In-Cell Charts and Calculations
Description Full:
Highlights of the graphomate matrix:

  • Table Design According to IBCS
  • Clear Presentation Thanks to In-Cell Charts like Deviations and Sparklines
  • Flexible and Conditional Formatting for Each Column, Row or Single Cell
  • Performant and Interactive Display of Large Hierarchies in Rows and Columns
  • Calculation of Variances, Aggregations, Custom Formulae and N + Rest
  • Full Control with a Sophisticated Set of Properties

The graphomate matrix is our new table component for Power BI, Microsoft Office, Tableau and SAP Analytics. Because tables are omnipresent, no report can do without them. Hence, Microsoft Excel is still the number crunchers' favorite tool. The disappointment is all the greater after working with the limited standard table components in BI front ends. But with the graphomate matrix you get full control to create a meaningful table in the BI front end of your choice.

Using our own formatting language - the Cell Formatting Language (CFL), which is based on JavaScript - you get complete freedom over the appearance of the graphomate matrix. You want to highlight single cells depending on their value? Highlight totals rows? Use a table as a heatmap? The values of individual table cells should determine their font size? The graphomate matrix enables you to implement all your requirements for a meaningful table design.

Our matrix supports IBCS rules like deviations as bar or needle charts, column scenarios and background bar charts. In addition, it enables both hierarchical and tabular (CrossTab) views, hierarchies can also be used in the columns and additionally columns with their own calculations can be added - for example, for variance calculation.

The graphomate matrix for Power BI is free to use and contains all available features. In Power BI Desktop it can be used without restrictions. In the Power BI Online service it additionally shows a watermark. To use the matrix online without a watermark, feel free to ask us for time-limited demo versions or purchase subscription licenses. For more information, please visit our website.

Name: graphomate bubbles
Description: Meaningful portfolio analyses with up to 5 key figures and two value axes also as scatterplot
Long Summary: Meaningful portfolio analyses with up to 5 key figures and two value axes also as scatterplot
Description Full:
Advantages of the graphomate bubbles at a glance:
  • two value axes
  • mapping of portfolio analyses according to the scheme of the BCG matrix
  • Small multiples display (top n + rest, display according to space availability)
  • connection of bubbles to represent developments over time
  • application of conditional formatting
  • support of different zoom modes for increased readability
  • IBCS compliant

In contrast to other graphomate extensions, our graphomate bubbles offer two value axes. This allows different representations such as bubble charts, scatterplots or multidimensional portfolio analyses. In accordance with individual requirements, the large range of settings realizes the representation of different pie charts.

The goal of the visualization is to get a quick and easy overview of distributions and relationships among data points. Patterns and outliers can be recognized quickly for better interpretation and decision-making. For example, deviations from a previous year’s value can be plotted on the arc.

The graphomate bubbles for Power BI are free to use and contain all available features. In Power BI Desktop it can be used without restrictions. In the Power BI Online service it additionally shows a watermark. To use the matrix online without a watermark, feel free to ask us for time-limited demo versions or purchase subscription licenses. For more information, please visit our website.

Name: graphomate charts
Description: graphomate charts is a highly customizable visualization component
Long Summary: graphomate charts is a highly customizable visualization component
Description Full:
The graphomate charts, graphomate´s first product, remain our top seller. Through constant evolution and optimization we are able to offer our customers the most sophisticated chart component on the market. Based on six chart types you can easily implement the recommendations of the International Business Communication Standards (IBCS). At the same time graphomate charts can be customized to fit your needs.



In addition to bar and column charts, you can use needle and stacked bar charts, but also waterfall charts – for example for P&L or contribution margin calculations – to realise a standardized notation.



The advantages of graphomate charts at a glance

  • fully integrated into Power BI: drill downs, highlights, selections and tooltips are supported

  • six chart types that can be aligned horizontally or vertically

  • different chart types in one chart (“combination charts“)

  • easy integration of absolute and percentage deviation diagrams

  • Comparison Group for uniform scaling of charts within a reporting application

  • freely definable scenarios – color, fill pattern, shape – per data series or data point

  • highlighting of differences between data points via single and multi highlighting

  • display of additional data-driven reference lines

  • automatic avoidance of label collisions

  • template management via the graphomate server

  • definition of outliers

  • comprehensive formatting options for category, data series and data labels

  • hierarchical representations of category labels

  • display of a value axis

  • title field, scaling helper and separator frames

  • advanced own property sheet



The graphomate charts for Power BI is free to use and contains all available features. In Power BI Desktop it can be used without restrictions. In the Power BI Online service it additionally shows a watermark. To use the charts online without a watermark, feel free to ask us for time-limited demo versions or purchase subscription licenses. For more information, please visit our website.

Name: Galigeo for PowerBI
Description: Geomaps Made Simple: Galigeo's Location-Driven Insights for Power BI
Long Summary: Geomaps Made Simple: Galigeo's Location-Driven Insights for Power BI
Description Full:
Galigeo for Microsoft Power BI enables organizations to visualize, analyze and operate location-based data to gain new insights, make informed decisions and improve their business processes.
Designed for data analysts, business intelligence professionals, GIS experts and business teams, it offers a wide set of both technical and business features to harness the location dimension contained in any data into actionable insights.

Geodata Visualisation

By leveraging drag-n-drop interface, Galigeo lets you plot any of your KPIs on the map. Points, polygons, lines, all sort of geometries can be displayed. Multiple layers are supported, without any number limitation.
You can create the following type of representations (non-exhaustive list):

  • Choropleth
  • Color Ranges
  • Proportional Symbols
  • Qualitative Values
  • Heatmap
  • Cluster
  • Flows
  • H3 and Hexagons
  • Customizable labels
  • Customizable tooltips
  • ...

It supports all native map functionalities, like scroll, zoom in and out, pan, pinch, drill-down and drill-through.

Spatial Analysis

Galigeo gives you access to advanced spatial analysis in a self-service fashion, to spatially select and filter data on the map:

  • Crow-fly distance (also called Isodistance), in metric or imperial
  • Drive-time (by car, foot, truck, bike)
  • Free-drawing
  • Animated Time Series
  • ...

These selections can then be exported in a different formats: Excel, CSV, but also Shapefile or GeoJSON.

Territory Management

Galigeo lets you access advanced territory design features directly in Power BI. You can create your own territories manually, or automatically using any category data, SQL queries or even spatial selections such as proximity, distance and drive-time.

Galigeo aggregates any on your KPIs on these territories, that remain dynamic as you can edit them back whenever you want, and compare several versions.

Geodata Connection

Galigeo can connect to a wide varieties of geodata files and services.
It also comes with built-in catalog of geodata (administrative boundaries), such as US Zipcodes. This catalog can be enriched with your ow geodata.
If needed, Galigeo can also directly act as a lightweight GIS-server.
All projection systems (EPSG) are supported. It supports any countries around the world.

  • Latitude and Longitude (x and y) coordinates read from the data
  • Address geocoding (converting addresses to latitude and longitude)
  • Shapefile
  • GeoJSON
  • GeoPackage
  • Esri ArcGIS Feature Service
  • Esri ArcGIS Map Service
  • Esri ArcGIS Operational Layer
  • WFS (OGC Standard)
  • WMS (OGC Standard)
  • WMTS (OGC Standard)
  • Open-source GIS Servers (GeoServer, MapServer, ...)
  • Open-data portals
  • Weather services
  • Natural Event services (USGS, NOAA ...)
  • ...

With its powerful geomapping and geodata analysis capabilities, Galigeo delivers impact for companies in a every industries: retail, FCMG, manufacturers, distribution, wholesale, government & public administration, transport & logistics, energy, helping them gain a competitive advantage by leveraging the location dimension contains in the data.
Galigeo for Power BI offers a user-friendly interface, hundreds of customization options, as well as flexible deployment in the cloud or on-premise.

With Galigeo for Microsoft Power BI, organizations unlock the full potential of location-based data to drive business outcomes.

Galigeo usage is based on license per user, with two different profiles: creator (creates and manages maps) and consumer (consumes maps in read-only mode). Starting at 5€/user/month.

It fully works in Power BI Desktop, Online (Service) and Embedded.

For over 20 years, Galigeo has been a world leader in Location Intelligence solutions, serving hundreds of trusted clients across the globe

Name: hi-chart Reporting Studio
Description: Perfect business graphics are automatically prepared for your data. There is no easier way.
Long Summary: Perfect business graphics are automatically prepared for your data. There is no easier way.
Description Full:
With hi-chart Reporting Studio for Power BI, all important graphics for clear and easy-to-understand reports, presentations and dashboards can be implemented in a single visual.

Clear thanks to a built-in notation concept, graphic perfection and highlighting that directs the viewer's gaze.
Easy thanks to drag-and-drop operation, wizards, automatic classification of data according to business meaning, and default settings that can be adjusted at any time.
Efficient thanks to automatically suggested chart types that create very high quality graphics in seconds, and to automatically calculated variances.

All charts and tables are built dynamically from the data structures and adapt to changes as they occur.

Each automatism can be customised to your own needs with user-defined settings.

The chart elements can be combined in almost any way to achieve the most suitable result. For instance, variance charts can be added to charts as well as to tables.

The visualisation types can be changed subsequently as desired, so there's nothing to limit your ideas as you design your graphic. For example, you can switch between

  • charts and tables,
  • table columns and chart columns,
  • base values, delta variances and percentage variances,
  • grouped, stacked and individual columns, bars and areas,
  • single charts and small multiples,
  • normal and waterfall visualisations, as well as
  • columns/bars, point-lines, areas and needles.

The title of a visualisation is automatically generated in multiple lines based on the data and can be customised as desired.
The built-in notation concept ensures that the same things always look the same and different things look different.
This ensures that graphics for dashboards, reports and presentations are understood quickly and correctly.

Highlighting can be used to emphasise values, differences and scaling.
Comments can also be used to comment on content that has no space for comment text.
Waterfalls are formed fully automatically with subtotals and grand totals using hierarchies that can be modelled in Power BI.

With duplicated data sources, several different charts can also be displayed in one visual.

With the object size concept, the labelling always remains in proportion to the chart elements.

hi-chart Reporting Studio supports Power BI cross-filtering. This means that dynamic dashboards are very easy to implement, as are combinations with other Power BI visuals.

Please visit hi-chart.com for more information.

Keywords: IBCS, SUCCESS, management reporting, charts, tables, Hichert, dashboards, Excel, Power BI, Qlik Sense

Name: Line with Bubble Chart
Description: Chart with combination of Line & bubble in which both objects can be derive with a numerical measure
Long Summary: Chart with combination of Line & bubble in which both objects can be derive with a numerical measure
Description Full:
Combination of Line and Bubble Chart for Data Analysis by Office Solution

A Line and Bubble chart is a graphical representation that combines line and bubble elements to represent data points and trends in a visually distinct format. The line connects data points to display trends over time or categories, while bubbles vary in size to reflect a numerical field or measure.

This chart is ideal for visualizing relationships between two variables while incorporating an additional layer of information through the bubble size. The ability to customize both the line and bubble aspects provides a dynamic and detailed view of your data.

Key Concepts:

  • Line Representation: Each line in the chart represents a specific category or series, showing the trend or relationship between two variables.
  • Bubble Representation: The size of each bubble corresponds to a numerical value, providing an additional dimension to the data beyond just the X and Y axis.

Customization Features:

  • Flip X and Y Axis: Users can switch the X and Y axes to rotate the chart from vertical to horizontal, giving more flexibility in data presentation.
  • Zoom Feature: The ability to zoom into specific sections of the chart for a closer examination of particular data points.
  • Growth Trends and Connectors: Users can add growth trends and connectors on command to highlight the relationship between data points, helping to better understand the progression or decline in values.
  • Reference Lines: Reference lines can be added on command to show key thresholds or benchmarks, making it easier to interpret data.

Data Point Comparison:

  • Flagging Differences: Users can select two data points in the chart and right-click or hover to view simple statistics such as the sum, average, or difference between the selected points, making comparison easy and intuitive.

Axis Customization:

  • Custom Ranges on Y Axis: Users have the flexibility to change and select custom ranges shown on the Y axis, ensuring that the chart scales according to specific data analysis needs.

Shape Customization:

  • Configurable Shapes: Each line in the chart connects data points represented by shapes. These shapes can be customized for each category, enhancing visual differentiation and making the chart more engaging.

Basic Features:

  • Resizable and Dynamic: The chart is responsive and dynamically resizable, ensuring it adapts well to different screen sizes and displays data smoothly.
  • Show/Hide Axes: Users can show or hide axes through toggle options from the visualization pane, allowing for a more focused presentation when necessary.

Premium Features:

  • Logo Removal: The premium version supports the removal of the logo for a cleaner chart appearance.
  • Custom Data Selection: Use the dropdown feature to select specific datasets for the chart, allowing users to filter data and visualize particular aspects of interest.
  • Top N Feature: Allows users to select and display the top N items based on the numerical values of the bubbles or lines, enhancing focus on key data points.
  • +Basic Features

Use Cases:

  • Business Analysis: This chart helps organizations analyze trends and compare data points, giving insights into business growth, customer segmentation, and sales performance.
  • Data Science & Analytics: Ideal for visualizing relationships between multiple variables, this chart is useful in data-driven decision-making.

Conclusion:

The combination of a Line and Bubble chart is a versatile and powerful tool for data analysis. With its ability to present trends and numerical values simultaneously, it provides a comprehensive view of complex data sets, making it an essential tool for business and data analytics.

Description Full:
BENE.BIZ Date Range Slicer visual allows users to filter data dynamically based on selectable timeframes, ranging from milliseconds to years, adjusting the filter context to reflect the specified period leading up to the current date.

The slicer operates based on the user’s current local time and intelligently accounts it for filtering data.

Did you ever wonder how to filter data by the last 24 hours, last 3 weeks, last year etc.? The BENE.BIZ Date Range Slicer visual is the solution for you!
It significantly simplifies the creation of reports with “last period” filtering functionality. This functionality distinguishes it from traditional date/time slicers, which rely on absolute date intervals and typically become less user-friendly after data refreshes – often causing selections to become outdated.

With the BENE.BIZ Date Range Slicer, report creators and users always benefit from consistent, up-to-date results for most current timeframes without needing to periodically adjust their filter selection to filter the latest timeframe. This ensures that your stakeholder will be able to see relevant results immediately after opening the report, without the need to adjust date/time filters to reflect the latest period.

Name: Hexbin Scatterplot by iFour
Description: Technique for analyzing relationships between two numerical variables and identifying data density
Long Summary: Technique for analyzing relationships between two numerical variables and identifying data density
Description Full:
A Hexbin Scatterplot is a powerful visualization technique for analyzing relationships between two numerical variables and identifying data density. It works by dividing the data space into hexagonal bins, reducing overlap and visual clutter

Best Practices for Using Hexbin Scatterplot

Choose the Right Bin Size: Adjust hexagon size to find the right balance between detail and clarity. Smaller bins provide fine detail, but larger bins simplify the chart
Use an Effective Color Gradient: Choose intuitive color scales (e.g., light to dark) to represent data density, and include a clear color legend for interpretation.
Highlight Key Insights: Annotate clusters or outliers, and use tooltips to display detailed information when hovering over the hexagons for better understanding

When to use Hexbin Scatterplot?

Hexbin Scatterplots are particularly useful in situations where traditional scatterplots may struggle to clearly represent the data. Here are the key scenarios when you should consider using a Hexbin Scatterplot
Large Datasets: Ideal when you have a large number of data points, where a traditional scatterplot would suffer from over plotting.

Density Analysis: Use to identify areas of high and low concentration of data points in the chart.

Cluster and Trend Identification: Effective for spotting clusters, patterns, or correlations between two continuous variables.

Visualizing High Variability: Useful when data has high variability, noise, or outliers that may be masked in standard scatterplots.

Analyze relationships and data density with our custom Hexbin Scatterplots. Collaborate with iFour for top-notch Power BI consultation and create flawless BI visuals.

Long Summary: Add natural-language insights — out-of-the-box — for accelerated data understanding.
Description Full:
Featuring the latest natural-language experience, Arria for Power BI now includes an extended set of analysis types for even more use cases.

Intelligent Narratives: Bring together advanced analytics and natural-language summaries to instantly reveal insights. With Intelligent Narratives, you can instantly create automated narrative insight generation to complement your visuals.

Arria Answers: Have a conversation with your data using dynamic natural language query (NLQ) — on demand. Using an integrated chat interface, ask your data specific questions and get precise answers.

Highlights:

  • Instant narrative, actionable insights — out-of-the-box.
  • From sales performance to expense variance, you no longer have to sift through mountains of data to get the answers to your organization’s most important questions.
  • Instant access to information. Writing reports takes minutes instead of hours.
  • Data understanding is available to everyone, which means consistent interpretation and better decision-making across the organization.
  • Get more insights from your data with a few clicks — and no coding!
  • Explain data in natural language to support your visuals.

Features:

  • Intelligent Narratives: Easily configure narratives for your dashboard using apps built for various types of data analysis. See the video here: https://vimeo.com/455877728
  • Arria Answers: Query your data for instant insights and deeper detail – separate from your generated narrative within your dashboard. Move back and forth between Answers and Intelligent Narratives. See the video here: https://vimeo.com/455880380
  • Multiple deployment models for enterprises: Arria-hosted Public Cloud, Arria-hosted Private Cloud, or Customer-hosted Deployment (behind your firewall).
  • Compatible with Power BI Mobile

Intelligent Narratives include:

  • Descriptive Statistics. Analyzes measures over combinations of dimensions. Describes any data points that are deemed to be unusual when compared to the mean of the measure.
  • Time-Based Variance. Performs variance analysis and generates narrative to report key insights. Analyzes and reports the performance of one measure between two time periods, along with a breakdown of important drivers and offsets.
  • Target-Based Variance. Performs variance analysis and generates narrative to report key insights. Computes and reports the variance between an actual value and a target or budgeted value; it also drills down through a number of dimensions to build the narrative.
  • Describe a Pie Chart. Performs analysis of a measure by dimension. Describes results as percentages and values, identifying critical insights and explaining the significance of outliers.
  • Describe a Bar Chart. Analyzes measures over combinations of dimensions. Generates narrative that reports on the significant statistics and/or variances, as shown in a bar chart.
  • Describe a Line Chart. Analyzes measures over combinations of dimensions, over time. Generates narrative that reports on the significant statistics and/or variances, as shown in a line chart.
  • Trend Analysis. Analyzes changes in trend of a measure over time. Highlights significant shifts and drills down through a number of dimensions to build the narrative.
  • Ranking Analysis. Provides a summary of the top and bottom rankings of combinations of dimensions over time, and highlights changes in rank.
  • Anomalies. Detects, highlights, and contextualizes anomalies in a dataset, drilling down through multiple dimensions to build the narrative.
  • Correlations. Detects and highlights correlations between series of data points, drilling down through multiple dimensions to build the narrative.

Value

  • Fully interactive data-driven narratives.
  • Capture BI-analyst knowledge within the system for improved accuracy and consistency.
  • Make your Power BI analytics more informative and easier to understand.
  • Interpret the findings, summarize the key insights, and point out specific facts.
  • Generate narratives suited for your specific use case by choosing apps and making configuration selections.

Name: Individuals and Moving Range Control Chart by PQ Systems
Description: An SPC chart for analysis of process stability and variability where the sample size is one.
Long Summary: An SPC chart for analysis of process stability and variability where the sample size is one.
Description Full: An individuals and moving range (X-MR) chart is a pair of control charts for processes with a subgroup size of one. Used to determine if a process is stable and predictable, it creates a picture of how the system changes over time. The individual (X) chart displays individual measurements. The moving range (MR) chart shows variability between one sample and the next. Individuals and moving range charts are also used to monitor the effects of process improvement theories. The Moving range chart creates range values to plot by finding differences between consecutive samples. Control charts are designed to help to understand and reduce variation in a process over time. More specifically, they are designed to minimize two common mistakes: 1. Adjusting a process when it would be better to leave it alone. 2. Not adjusting a process when an adjustment is likely required. Control charts help to predict how a process will behave. If a reasonable number of data points all show as in-control on a control chart, you can make a useful prediction about your process: Unless the process is changed in some way, it will continue to produce results centered on this mean and varying within these control limits. If the control chart shows data points that are outside the limits or trends, or runs above or below the mean, this does not allow you to make a useful prediction about your process. This process is not stable and not predictable. Unless something is changed, we cannot be certain about the mean or the dispersion of data resulting from this process. This predictive nature of control charts and their ability to minimize the mistakes described above are what makes them such valuable business tools. When to use this chart: 1. When you want to see if your process is stable and predictable; 2. When you want to see how planned change affects a process; 3. When the time order of the data values is preserved; 4. When you have collected data in subgroups of one – one value at a time. This chart is part of PI VIZpack™ by PQ Systems, a collection of eight process improvement charts for Power BI®. They provide a clear way to visualize and evaluate process behavior and performance. Get started with a free two-week trial today. After the trial, you may continue using the basic features or upgrade to the premium version. To learn more visit our website.

Name: Multi Card KPIs by TME AG
Description: A multiple cards Power BI visual to display and compare KPIs
Long Summary: A multiple cards Power BI visual to display and compare KPIs
Description Full:
What is Multi-Card KPIs?

Multi-Card KPIs is a Power BI visual which lets you create KPI cards with a modern look and feel. Users can create up to 10 cards in each direction (row, column).

Features

It provides a set of data and comparison fields that lets a user create up to 10 cards at once. A card consists of four main sections (data label, category label, image, and comparison), and each of these sections is fully customizable. Here is a feature list for the visual:

- Customization for each card consists of, background color, show/hide border, border width, border color, highlighted color strip on any side of the card.
- Display multiple cards in a row or column orientation and manage the distance between each card.
- There is a built-in icon for each card, but for more customization, the user can use their own icons by providing just a URL or even hide the icon completely. The icon provides further options to be resized, set a border radius, and even make the icon transparent from 0 to 100 level transparency.
- Data and category labels are also fully customizable including font size, font family, bold, italic, and text color.
- For comparing two measures, the user can set highlighted border strip color for positive(+), negative(-), or equal(=) percentage. The cards show this strip as well as up and down arrows following the percentages.
- (NEW) In comparison, the user can select the arrow direction and can show comparison result in percentage as well as actual value.

When a license is required?
- If you want to use more than one card
- If you want to use the comparison feature
- If you want to use a highlighted border strip for your card which could be used according to comparison scenarios (>, <, =) to match your needs

Please visit our website https://tme-ag.de/tme-multi-card-kpis for more details, demos, and prices.

Name: Lollipop Bar Chart
Description: Declutter your comparisons with a Lollipop chart
Long Summary: Declutter your comparisons with a Lollipop chart
Description Full:
Standard bar charts are ideal for showing a single measure per category so you can easily compare each of the categories with the rest. However, if you have larger number of categories (>10) in a bar chart it is possible the chart itself becomes “heavy” because large part of the surface of the chart will be filled with the bar color(s).

To avoid this clutter one can use the Lollipop Bar Chart as an alternative to the standard bar chart. It shows an marker (mostly a dot) per category at the corresponding measure value for each category. The marker is connected to the measure-axis origin by a subtle line. The marker combined with the line make it a Lollipop Chart.

Key features of the Lollipop Chart are:

Format the objects: Each of the data point objects (dot and line) can be formatted by selecting a color and size. Additional, the line can be switched on/off and for the dot one can switch on/off the fill color;

The Axis formatting options are in line with the options you know from the Power BI Clustered Bar Chart, so no need to learn a new interface;

Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the Lollipop Chart;

Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to Include/Exclude data points;

Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip. You can even use another report page as a tooltip.

Support for Datalabels Datalabels can be added and formatted;

Conditional formatting The markers and lines support conditional formatting to change their appearance based on data and rules;

Analytics lines Reference lines can be added to the Lollipop Bar Chart by configuring them in the Analytics pane;

All functionality of the Lollipop Bar Chart is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. A license can be purchased on our website. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

Name: Shielded HTML Viewer
Description: Visualize your HTML formatted content to add valuable context to your figures.
Long Summary: Visualize your HTML formatted content to add valuable context to your figures.
Description Full:
Most business applications allow users to enrich the data by adding additional context. Often, this additional context (like comments and feedback) is stored as HTML formatted text. This allows the user to not only include the content, but also apply all kinds of formatting to the content (like Bold, Italic, lists, tables, etc.).

Being able to show this additional context adds value to reports and dashboard, as it helps the readers to better understand the presented figures.

The Shielded HTML Viewer will seamlessly display any HTML-5 formatted text next to other figures in your Power BI reports.

The Shielded HTML Viewer will only process and render HTML-tags and -attributes that are specified in our allow-list. This to mitigate potential security risks (such as inline scripting). Any tag or attribute not specified on the allow-list will be ignored.

The HTML5-elements which are allowed by the Shielded HTML Viewer are:

Content sectioning: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6

Text content: blockquote, dd, div, dl, dt, hr, li, ol, p, pre, ul

Inline text semantics: a, b, br, code, em, i, q, s, small, span, strong, sub, sup, wbr

Table content: caption, col, colgroup, table, tbody, td, tfoot, th, thead, tr

Version 2.0 also includes support for SVG-tags, support for Data URL's for images and support for using the NAV-tag to add navigation to your report (See this link for more information.)

This visual offers in-app purchases and comes with free access to evaluate the paid features.

All functionality of the Shielded HTML Viewer is available for free within Power BI Desktop. The licensed version is needed for sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

Long Summary: Stacked Bar Chart by Akvelon is enhanced by rectangle selection of bars

Stacked Bar Chart by Akvelon has similar functionality as product Stacked bar chart and allows you to plot bars based on category and value data from your data source. Additionally it supports rectangle selection - such filtering allows to select multiple bars within rectangle area. This feature will help you to filter specific cluster within your data and update your report accordingly.
Other important features are:
- Legend that supports selection
- Ability to change colors of the bars - you can set specific color for each Legend category

How to use Small Multiple feature:

Visuals have following additional “small multiple” field buckets:
- Column By
- Row By (can be filled only together with Column By)

User can define rows and columns of the visual in two ways: 
- Set both “Row By” and “Column By” field buckets. In this case rows and columns will be generated based on those category values
- Set only “Column By” field bucket and leave “Row By” empty. In that case there will be only one dimension of small multiple categories, and small multiples will be generated from left to right and wrap to the next row – similar as left-to-right text direction in a page.

Note: Color saturation can be set only if Legend is not set.

Name: Packed Bubble Chart - xViz
Description: Packed Bubble Chart to plot data clusters, & gain data driven insights for effective decision making
Long Summary: Packed Bubble Chart to plot data clusters, & gain data driven insights for effective decision making
Description Full:
The xViz Packed Bubble chart, also known as the Bubble cluster chart, is highly recommended for displaying hierarchical data as densely packed circles of various sizes and colors. Each circle represents a category or sub-category in the data hierarchy, with its color representing a dimension and its size being determined by a metric value.

A packed bubble visualization is similar to a bubble chart, except that the bubbles are tightly packed rather than dispersed in a grid. A packed bubble visualization can be used to display a large amount of data and readers can easily and quickly identify patterns in large datasets.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Custom Bubble - Visualize data as colored bubbles to provide an aesthetic representation for your end-users. With the custom bubble size option, you can set the minimum and maximum bubble size.
  • Cluster Mode – Cluster the bubbles to easily identify sub-categories and categories. You may also configure the cluster size and enable cluster totals.
  • Grouping – Add a measure to the legend field to group the bubbles and easily include/exclude certain categories.
  • Conditional Formatting – Create various formatting rules so that the bubbles can be colored according to predefined conditions. This gives your end users a simple-to-understand view of the data.
  • Data labels
    • – Customize to show category, value, % or Total, or all combinations to perform additional analysis. You can also set the text scaling to word wrap or responsive for a data label that scales with the bubble’s size.
  • Number Formatting – You have full flexibility to customize decimal places, % totals individually, edit decimal and 1000’s separators in the visual.
  • Summary Table – Gain a tabular overview to slice and filter your data.

Why choose xViz visuals?

  • Portfolio of 20 advanced enterprise grade visuals with 50K users

  • Trusted by 1500+ customers including fortune 500 companies

  • Over 500k+ downloads across 40+ countries

Apex Gantt Chart is an advanced tool designed to visualize project schedules and timelines. Its ability to seamlessly integrate with the data structure of widely used scheduling software such as Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project enables business users to enhance their project management reporting within Microsoft Power BI.

Apex Project Management aims to incorporate cutting-edge technology into project management. Our experienced project managers work closely with IT experts to address the needs of project teams, emphasizing schedule visualization.

Apex Gantt Chart boasts powerful features and capabilities that make it an ideal choice for project teams and stakeholders. These include:

  • Custom tooltip: The tool supports custom tooltips, allowing users to add additional information and details to the Gantt Chart.

  • Additional columns: Apex Gantt Chart provides users with the ability to display additional columns — such as start, finish and progress — enhancing project management and monitoring.

  • Customizable chart areas: The formatting pane in Apex Gantt Chart offers many customization features, allowing users to tailor the chart's appearance to their specific needs and preferences.

Apex Gantt Chart targets business professionals, including project managers, schedulers, project teams, and stakeholders who rely on schedules to manage their daily operations. Its application is not limited to specific industries, though it is particularly well-suited for construction, engineering, and manufacturing. Regardless of industry, anyone who needs to visualize timelines and/or schedules in their business operations can benefit from the Apex Gantt Chart.

Overall, Apex Gantt Chart is an essential suite with great features and capabilities, making it an indispensable tool for successful project management.

Name: Ultimate Venn Diagram
Description: Explore Set Intersection using Venn or Euler Diagrams
Long Summary: Explore Set Intersection using Venn or Euler Diagrams
Description Full:
Venn diagrams are a common way to show set overlaps between sets. For up to *five* sets, they give a good overview how sets are overlapping. Euler diagrams are a variant in which the area of the overlap corresponds to the amount itself. An alternative more scalable version for more sets is available as "Ultimate UpSet Plot". This is an interactive Venn Diagram implementation based on UpSet.js (https://upset.js.org). More information can be found at https://upset.js.org/integrations/powerbi/.

Common use cases: 
 * Customer segmentation in which one customer belongs to multiple groups/communities
 * HR candidate evaluation in which a candidate has multiple skills
 * Advertising channel evaluation
 * everywhere in which someone fills out a multiple choice form field, like: "How have you heard from us?"

Name: SMART KPI List
Description: Increase the power of your KPI’s by adding context with the SMART KPI List
Long Summary: Increase the power of your KPI’s by adding context with the SMART KPI List
Description Full:
One of the principal goals of any dashboard is to inform its users by creating an overview of multiple key performance indicators (KPIs). A good dashboard shows all relevant KPIs in a single screen, so we need a compact and effective way to display them. The SMART KPI List is created specifically for this purpose.

Usually the S.M.A.R.T framework is used as a guide in the setting of objectives. Here we have used it to describe this visual:

  • Specific

    To allow for our dashboard to be specific we need to display all important indicators in one single overview and make sure we surround the indicator with sufficient context. Measures that need our immediate attention can be highlighted, done with a red dot next to the sparkline;

  • Measurable

    A value on its own is a weak indicator of your performance. By providing context this can be greatly improved. A sparkline shows you the trend to determine if you are moving towards your goal. By including a target value you can determine your distance from that goal. This is done by adding both a number and a target line in the bar chart to visually indicate progress. You can even show the difference between the current value and the target as a percentage by a deviation chart (as shown in the example below);

  • Achievable

    By adding target values you allow the reader to not only determine if a metric has met expectations, but also show the difference with the actual results;

  • Relevant

    Within the sparkline you can add a bandwidth of acceptabel results (the grey area in the example) which helps the user to identify “normal” and “abnormal” results in the past. You can also include qualitative ranges behind the value bar converting it into a Bullet Graph;

  • Time-bound

    The sparkline adds the required historic context to each indicator to enrich the indicators signals. The Last date column provides you insights in the latest refresh date of the indicator;

Key features of the SMART KPI List are:

  • A comprehensive overview of your KPI’s: Create a clear overview of your KPIs in the right context to tell the complete story. No more messing around with separate tables, line charts and bar charts;

  • Format the objects: Each of the columns can be formatted individually. Additionally, for the sparkline and bars you can change basic settings like the used colours;

  • The formatting options are similar to the options you know from standard Power BI charts, so no need to learn a new interface;

  • Selection & Highlighting: Like in standard Power BI Charts you can make use of the Selection & Highlighting functions within the SMART KPI List;

  • Context menu: Like in standard Power BI Charts you have access to the context menu to Include/Exclude data points;

  • Full tooltip support: Besides the default Tooltip behaviour (show the value of the element you hover) you can also add additional fields to the tooltip. You can even use another report as a tooltip.

  • Full Bookmark support: like any of the standard visuals the SMART KPI List supports Bookmarks.

All functionality of the SMART KPI List is available for free to try within Power BI Desktop. A licensed version is available for production usage and sharing the reports with your colleagues in Power BI Service. A license can be purchased on our website. Need more information? Visit our site at: https://visuals.novasilva.com

Name: Icon Pack by TME AG
Description: Icon pack is a Power BI visual to search and display icons in your report
Long Summary: Icon pack is a Power BI visual to search and display icons in your report
Description Full:
What is Icon Pack Visual? Icon pack as the name suggests provides a large number of icons that you can use in your Power BI reports. How does it work? You just need to add the visual in your report and insert or drag any data column to the visual. That's it. Visual will show a wide variety of icons where you can search and choose according to your choice. You can select any icon to add to your report (pro icons require a license). Which problem does it solve? Making your report interactive and aesthetically pleasing is an important aspect of Power BI but unfortunately, there is no built-in mechanism where users can search and add different types of icons or images into your report. Icon Pack solves this issue by providing high-quality icons just one click away without the hassle of designing your own or finding the icons from the web. You will not only find high-quality icons but has the possibility to change them according to your need. Features: - No need to look outside of Power BI to find icons that match the theme of your report - Search unlimited icons

- Single or multiple word search - Huge library of high-quality icons - General customization of the visual including (background color, transparency mode) When a license is required? - Choosing pro icons - Change the color of the icon - Set transparency of the icon - Using high contrast mode Please visit our website https://tme-ag.de/tme-icon-pack/ for more details, demos, and prices. We are always available at pbi@tme-ag.com for your questions and feature requests.

Name: Comparison Chart
Description: Compare connected information with a reference  e.g. individual stocks vs market index
Long Summary: Compare connected information with a reference  e.g. individual stocks vs market index
Description Full:
The Comparison Chart is an advanced line chart that allows you to visualize a comparison of connected information:
  • sales of my products vs. market
  • team performance vs. company performance
  • top shares vs. an index
The Comparison Chart allows you to easy and clearly present a comparison between multiple connected data series (like the sales of your different products) with a benchmark like externally acquired market data. Just choose the x-axis from your calendar table, the products to the legend, the measure from your sales table to the values and the measure of your market data to the compare values fields. Choose your own custom colors and styles for the lines, the compare data can also be shown as an area. The legend can be shown in different places. Find the perfect style for your report. You can use the switch next to the legend to toggle the aggregation of all shown category values to a single line. If you would want to compare data in a standard line chart for more than one data series (e.g. your different products) you either need to create measures for each of your products and add them to the values of the line chart or use the product as legend in the line chart and filter only the products you want to see, To compare the individual with benchmark data you are not able to use the legend for your measures. With the Comparison Chart you can have both: A dynamic number of measures (e.g. top 5 products) AND an index for comparison purposes. The free version shows the top 5 values in the free version. More categories are supported in the Pro version. More information on: https://www.comparisonchart.info

Name: Power BI Visual Editor

Name: Funnel Charts
Description: Create a funnel plot to identify outliers in your cross-sectional data
Long Summary: Create a funnel plot to identify outliers in your cross-sectional data
Description Full:
Funnel plots are a popular tool for identifying outliers when comparing measurements from multiple organisations or establishments. These charts allow you to identify whether a given unit is likely to be statistically different from the others, after accounting for the uncertainty due to differing/limited amounts of observations, by drawing "control limits" within which 99.8% of observations are expected to fall. 

The visual is implemented purely within PowerBI and has no dependencies on external programs like R or Python. The visual natively supports tooltips as well as cross-plot filtering and highlighting.

The following chart types are (currently) implemented:

  - Proportion
  - Indirectly-Standardised Ratios
  - Ratio of Counts (Rates)

The visual also provides an additive adjustment for overdispersion, as discussed in: 

Spiegelhalter DJ. Handling over-dispersion of performance indicators. BMJ Quality & Safety 2005;14:347-351. https://qualitysafety.bmj.com/content/14/5/347
Publisher: Government of Western Australia - Department of Health

Name: Flexa Design
Description: Design interactive Power BI reports with Flexa Design styling buttons and layouts
Long Summary: Design interactive Power BI reports with Flexa Design styling buttons and layouts
Description Full:
Flexa Design is a Power BI visual add-on that enables analysts and developers to craft stunning, user-friendly reports in seconds-no advanced design skills required.

Key Features:

  • Dynamic Button Library: Choose from toggle buttons, standard buttons, slicer buttons, and interactive menu buttons, paired with hundreds of intuitive icons.
  • Flexible Layout Options: Design sleek sidebars or headers with modern shapes to elevate your reports.
  • Effortless Design Tools: Streamline report styling, freeing analysts to focus on data analysis.

With Flexa Design, you can transform your Power BI reports into visually appealing, professional dashboards in just minutes— bringing your data to life visually and effortlessly.

For licensing and commercial use, please visit FlexaIntel.com .

Name: Flexa Analytics
Description: Power up Power BI with advanced simulations & self-service analytics
Long Summary: Power up Power BI with advanced simulations & self-service analytics
Description Full:
Power Up Power BI with Advanced Simulations & Self-Service Analytics

Flexa Analytics is an advanced Power BI visual add-on designed to empower business users with Monte Carlo simulations and all the enhanced capabilities of Flexa Tables. This upgraded visual enables teams to run probabilistic forecasts, explore "what-if" scenarios, and make confident decisions under uncertainty — all without code and within Power BI's familiar interface.

Simple enough for everyday users. Powerful enough for analysts. Flexa Analytics turns every report into an interactive workspace for forecasting, risk modeling, and data-driven strategy.

Key Features
  • Monte Carlo Simulation: Simulate thousands of possible outcomes to model uncertainty, forecast risk, and explore probabilities — right inside Power BI, no coding required.
  • Quick Variance Calculations: Instantly calculate percentages, ratios, and value differences — with built-in visual feedback.
  • Pivot Like Excel: Enable viewers and developers to pivot data and build custom views for troubleshooting or insights — even after publishing.
  • Unlock All Hidden Data: Access all columns from the original source, even beyond what’s visible in published reports.
  • Data Simulation Within the Table: Adjust inputs and assumptions live in the report to run what-if scenarios.
  • Header-Based Filtering: Filter data directly from column headers — intuitive, flexible, and slicer-free.

Flexa Analytics Goes Beyond Static Dashboards — enabling every user to simulate, explore, and lead with data. All inside Power BI.

Name: decomposition_tree
Description: Decomposition tree visual lets you visualize data across multiple dimensions
Long Summary: Decomposition tree visual lets you visualize data across multiple dimensions
Description Full:
Decomposition Tree is a very useful tool for exploratory data analysis. It allows you to break down a measure or metric into its contributing factors, helping to understand how different dimensions contribute to a particular outcome. It's especially useful when you want to perform root cause analysis or when you need to analyze data across multiple levels of granularity. It

1) provides an interactive and easy visual interface for data exploration.
2) helps in the aggregation of data and it’s easy to drill down.
3) Saves a lot of time by providing quick root cause analysis for finding patterns and trends in data.
4) lets you analyze data across multiple dimensions.


All functionalities of this visual are available for free within Power BI Desktop. In Power BI Online Service, it will show a watermark. To use the visual without watermark in Power BI Online, please purchase license subscription For more information visit https://www.excelnaccess.com/decomposition-tree/ or contact zubair@excelnaccess.com

Name: dandelion
Description: Compare different categories and their breakdown in one single view
Long Summary: Compare different categories and their breakdown in one single view
Description Full:
Dandelion chart visualizes your data in the form of a column chart plus the breakdown of your data as Dandelion flowers above the columns.

This visual offers a unique and wholistic way to depict the parent / child relationship between 2 fields in the "Category" section of the visual.

For example if you have yearly and monthly sales data, you can drag and drop "Years" and "Months" fields in the Category section and your sales value field in the Measure section of this visual. Your Yearly data will be depicted as column chart and its breakdown by months will be depicted as flowers above each column/bar.

All functionalities of this visual are available for free within Power BI Desktop. In Power BI Online Service, it will show a watermark. Name: Category Comparison Bar Chart
Description: The Bar Chart you've probably never seen before
Long Summary: The Bar Chart you've probably never seen before
Description Full:
The Category Comparison Bar Chart was developed to offer more options for comparing data for all Power BI users.

 

The visual has many features put together that can help visualize and understand your data.

  • The comparison area is the space where you focus your analysis on one category
  • The differences show your selected category in comparison to the other categories
  • The brush is a powerful feature that allows seeing the entire dataset you're analyzing. For example, it helps to see if a distribution has a long tail or if it's rather normally distributed. It also allows easy navigation if you want to focus on a subgroup of your data
  • The analytics is the place where you supercharge your analysis with easy to add metrics like average, median, percentiles and constant lines that can be used as targets or goals

 

Some possible use cases:

  • Comparing sales performance across teams
  • Comparing financials across business units
  • Comparing actuals vs. targets
  • Comparing performance vs. goals

 

The visual offers lots of customization options.

  • The main differentiator of this bar chart is the ability to choose a category and compare it to the others
  • You have a search field embedded in the visual itself
  • You have a brush that helps with selecting a portion of your dataset and also visualize its the entire distribution
  • You have an analytics section very similar with the analytics pane of the native Power BI line chart

 

The Brush is a handy feature that helps navigate, select and see all the categories and their distribution. Double click to select all.

The Search helps you find your desired category for analysis.

The Analytics section lets you add more comparable dimensions, like targets and goals as constant values or average, median and percentiles.

  • Minimum, maximum, average, median, and percentiles calculate automatically and dynamically based on the categories selected. Moving the brush or changing the metric will update these analytics
  • Above / below numbers show how many categories are above and below the given analytics
  • Hovering over the analytics label will show the differences of each category to the analytics.
  • Clicking on the analytics label will fix an overlay and the differences over each category

 

Important The Category Comparison Bar Chart comes together with the Multi Line Chart With Tooltips. 
For the same price and with the same license, you get access to 2 of the most powerful line and bar charts in the Power BI marketplace. To learn more, visit www.bisamurai.com.

Please note that the free version of the visual has limited capabilities but we offer free trial licenses.

To get a license for both Category Comparison Bar Chart and the Multi Line Chart With Tooltips visit www.bisamurai.com.
Keywords: bar chart,compare bar,category bar,Category Comparison Bar Chart

Name: KPI Matrix
Description: Arrange KPI cards in a matrix to display them within the context of up to two dimensions.
Long Summary: Arrange KPI cards in a matrix to display them within the context of up to two dimensions.
Description Full:
KPI Matrix is a versatile and dynamic KPI card visual that uniquely combines KPI cards with the possibilities of a matrix layout. This allows you to visualize the relationship between two dimensions in a way that no other visual can.

With KPI Matrix, you can effortlessly create and design multiple KPI cards in a row, column or matrix layout. The matrix layout is particularly powerful, enabling you to put your KPI in the context of two dimensions in order to visualize the relationship between these dimensions.

Each card in the matrix displays a measure and optionally a target value or another measure for comparison, along with an indicator to visualize the difference between the two measures. Choose from three indicator types: arrow/triangle, text color, or background color. Enhance each card’s informative value with two mini chart styles that show current or historical trends of actual and target values, as well as their differences. The drill function allows you to adjust the mini chart’s level of detail.

The background color of each card can also serve as an actual/target indicator, and with conditional coloring, you can transform the entire matrix into a heatmap. All cards, including those in the row or column headers, allowing for data point selection to filter or highlight data on the report page. You can even hide row and column headers and place their content directly on the cards, making them look like individual KPI cards while remaining selectable.

Want to display multiple key performance indicators on a single page without the hassle of formatting and positioning each one individually? Use KPI Matrix! Choose a row or column layout to format all at once, or use the matrix layout to contextualize the cards with two dimensions. Make your cards an active part of your interactive dashboard by allowing users to filter data by selecting one or multiple cards, rows, or columns.

Key features include:

  • Various formatting options
  • Text or image as row or column headers
  • Slicing by selection of cards, rows, or columns
  • Drillable mini chart in two styles (line or indicative area)
  • Various conditional background formatting options
  • Individual column or row-specific formatting (number format, indicator direction, display unit)
  • Automatic sizing: card and text size adapt to the visual size and card layout

Supported languages: English and German

New features (v1.0.4.0+):

  • Support for highlight mode in addition to filter mode
  • Automatic wrapping of longer texts
  • Formatting options to define maximum card heights and widths
  • Alternative licensing option for environments that do not support default licensing (e.g., Embedded and Report Server). Licenses available upon request.

New features (v1.0.4.4+):

  • Select from 10 different indicator styles, which can be further customized (stretching, colors, opacity)
  • Experience endless possiblities individualizing your card layouts with customizable layout areas and various alignment options

Name: fantail_flashbi
Description: The FanTail brings hierarchical data to life with dynamic, interactive radial layout with drilldown.
Long Summary: The FanTail brings hierarchical data to life with dynamic, interactive radial layout with drilldown.
Description Full:
The FanTail

Imagine peeling an onion – layer by layer – revealing deeper insights at each level. That’s precisely what our Fantail does but without the tears! Each layer tells a part of your data story from the core to the outer rings, making it simple to grasp even the most complex hierarchies. The dynamic and enticing drill down encourages interaction and investigation of your data by all levels of leadership. The rings in the chart are divided based on their hierarchical relationship to the parent node, having multiple segments, showing the contribution of a particular dimension in that hierarchy.

 

Great Scenarios to Use the FanTail:

Sales Data: Visualise sales breakdowns (sector width) and call success rates (sector color) by state, region, and salesperson. Instantly identify key statistics, providing insights into landing paths, revenue sources, and more.

Website Analytics: Visualise website traffic patterns, user engagement metrics, and conversion rates. Break down data into hierarchical segments to identify areas for improvement and optimise user experience.

Financial Reports: Present complex financial data like revenue streams, expense categories, and profit margins. Drill-down capabilities allow detailed analysis of financial performance at various levels.

Project Management: Visualise project timelines, task dependencies, and resource allocation. Get a clear overview of project progress and identify potential bottlenecks.

Customer Insights: Analyse customer demographics, purchase behaviour, and satisfaction levels. Understand customer preferences and tailor marketing strategies accordingly.

Why Choose Our FanTail?

Unmatched Visual Excellence: The FanTail is the best custom visual on the market! It stimulates relative thinking and is easy to understand. It effectively showcases how one ring breaks into sequential segments, connecting all aspects and levels into a cohesive whole.

Efficient Space Utilisation: Using radial orientation, the FanTail utilises space more efficiently than linear hierarchical visualisations. It ensures all elements on the same level are equally important, eliminating the dichotomy between periphery and centre. It's intuitive and easy to use.

Enhanced Connectivity: The FanTail can access external services or resources, providing seamless integration and connectivity that enhances functionality and usability.

Engaging and Interactive: The FanTail encourages interaction and investigation of your data at all leadership levels. Its dynamic drill-down capabilities make it a powerful tool for in-depth analysis and decision-making.

Name: Deneb: Declarative Visualization in Power BI
Description: Use the powerful Vega or Vega-Lite languages to create custom visuals directly inside Power BI
Long Summary: Use the powerful Vega or Vega-Lite languages to create custom visuals directly inside Power BI
Description Full:
Deneb is a custom visual for Microsoft Power BI, which allows creators to use the declarative JSON syntax of the Vega or Vega-Lite languages to build their own bespoke data visualizations, without having to learn web development. This is similar to the approaches used for creating R and Python visuals in Power BI, with the following additional benefits:
  • No additional dependencies on local libraries or gateways for your end-users when publishing reports - Visuals will render in any Power BI client.
  • Specifications are rendered directly inside Power BI rather than being delegated to another location (typically resulting in faster render times for end-users).
  • Built for the web, meaning that it's possible to integrate with Power BI's interactivity features, with some additional setup.
By becoming familiar with the Vega-Lite and Vega languages, and learning to "think visually", you can greatly expand your visual options within Power BI. You can visit the main website at https://deneb-viz.github.io to learn how to get started. The site also covers the Power-BI specific side of things including how you can develop your visuals to potentially leverage visual canvas integration capabilities, such as tooltips, context menus and cross-filtering other visuals.
Keywords: vega,vega-lite,Deneb: Declarative Visualization in Power BI
Simple Filename: Deneb_ Declarative Visualization in Power BI

Name: IFC Viewer
Description: 3D IFC Viewer in Power BI for seamless BIM collaboration
Long Summary: 3D IFC Viewer in Power BI for seamless BIM collaboration
Description Full:
Free 3D IFC Viewer Visual for Power BI Desktop. It enables users to visualize and analyze IFC models within Power BI, making it an essential asset for professionals in construction, architecture, engineering, building maintenance, and property management who need to interact with BIM data effectively.

Why choose IFC Viewer for Power BI?

  • Power BI Desktop with our IFC Viewer visual is free
  • No extra software/login required
  • Open IFC files from your desktop or cloud storage
  • Privacy: User controls data storage
  • Link model to external data (cost, schedule)
  • Create 3D views with custom charts & KPIs
  • Integrate with Microsoft 365 (Lists, Excel, SharePoint)
  • Add custom workflows to your data
  • AI-ready data architecture

Steps to Use the IFC Viewer in Power BI:

  1. Download the sample Power BI report from AppSource.
  2. Open the downloaded report with Power BI Desktop (Download Power BI Desktop if you haven't already installed it). The sample model will load automatically.
  3. To load a custom model, navigate to Transform data > Edit Parameters under the Home tab.
  4. Paste the copied IFC file path (web link or local file path) into the respective parameter field in Power BI.
  5. Confirm your changes by clicking OK.
  6. After editing the parameters, apply the changes in Power BI by selecting Apply Changes from the prompt.

Key Features:

  • Load IFC models from any source supported by Power BI
  • Power BI can refresh its data models with the latest IFC data through scheduled, manual refresh options for up-to-date insights and optimized performance
  • Select any IFC element within the 3D model to instantly view its properties and metadata
  • Dynamically link IFC properties to Power BI dashboards for real-time analysis.

Licensing Information

You can use the Power BI IFC Viewer Visual for free in Power BI Desktop, but a license is needed for Power BI Online.

Documentation and Support

  • Documentation
  • Online IFC Viewer
