Name: Aster Plot Chart
Description: A customizable Aster Plot chart for Power BI to visualize proportions with angular and radial values
Long Summary: A customizable Aster Plot chart for Power BI to visualize proportions with angular and radial values
Description Full:
The Aster Plot is a unique and visually engaging custom visual for Power BI that combines aspects of both pie charts and radial bar charts. It enables users to visualize categorical data with two numerical metrics simultaneously—one represented by angle and the other by radius—providing a multi-dimensional way to explore proportions and comparisons.

Key Features

  • Displays data using both angular width and radial length.
  • Allows users to show more information than a typical pie or donut chart.
  • Supports dynamic formatting, tooltips, and interactive legends.
  • Fully customizable with color, labels, tooltips, and sorting options.
  • Responsive to Power BI slicers, filters, and drillthrough actions.

Data Requirements

To use the Aster Plot visual effectively, your dataset must include:

  • 1 Dimension (Category): This defines each slice or segment of the Aster Plot.
  • 1 Measure (Value): This determines both the angle and/or radius based on settings.

Use Cases

This visual is suitable for a wide range of analytical and presentation scenarios, including:

  • Marketing performance by channel (e.g., impressions vs. spend)
  • Sales contribution by region with growth magnitude
  • Customer segmentation by volume and profitability
  • Comparative visualization of KPIs with proportional weights

How It Works

Each category is rendered as a wedge or slice with:

  • Angle: Typically proportional to the measure value, showing relative weight or share.
  • Radius: Represents the second aspect of the measure, such as magnitude, growth, or intensity.

This dual encoding provides more information density in a compact circular format.

Customization Options

The Aster Plot visual includes the following formatting capabilities:

  • Color configuration by category or measure
  • Label display: category names and values
  • Tooltip formatting and additional fields
  • Legend visibility and positioning
  • Sorting options based on angle, radius, or total value
  • Radius scaling control for fine-tuned data emphasis

Best Practices

  • Use when you want to represent two measures on the same chart.
  • Ensure category count is manageable (ideally fewer than 20 for readability).
  • Avoid clutter by limiting the number of decimal places in labels.
  • Use consistent measure units for easier comparison.

Limitations

  • Does not support more than one category or more than one measure at a time.
  • May become hard to interpret with a large number of categories.
  • Not ideal for precision reading—better suited for pattern and proportion visualization.

Installation and Setup

To install the Aster Plot visual:

  1. Download the visual from Microsoft AppSource or import from file.
  2. In Power BI Desktop, go to the “Visualizations” pane and click “... (Import a visual from a file)”
  3. Load the .pbiviz file for the Aster Plot.
  4. Drag your desired fields into the Category and Measure wells.
  5. Customize the formatting options as needed.
Keywords: Aster Plot,Aster Diagram,Aster Visual,Aster Plot Chart

Name: Writeback Grid
Description: Unlocks advanced data editing and seamless writeback using an intuitive grid visual
Long Summary: Unlocks advanced data editing and seamless writeback using an intuitive grid visual
Description Full:
Overview
The Writeback Grid is a powerful visual tool that allows you to write back changed data to multiple data sources directly from within the Power BI platform in a secure and atomic manner. This functionality is enabled through a backend-agnostic web service that acts as an intermediary between the visual component and your backend, without storing any data. This combination is particularly beneficial for business users and data analysts, as it enhances data quality, streamlines workflows, and allows for manual data population to support data warehousing or machine learning processes directly from within Power BI.

Licensing & Pricing
The PRO plan follows a per-user model, providing everything needed for the Writeback Grid to function, including the visual component and a fully managed web service. The PREMIUM plan is a per-instance (flat rate) model, offering access to a dedicated web service, fully managed either by us or by yourself, with access to the underlying container image hosted within our container registry. In addition, PREMIUM supports Hybrid Connection Endpoints for easily connecting to on-premises databases, Private Endpoints for enhanced security, and Power BI Embedded to enable access for external customers. The free version of the Writeback Grid visual allows for writing back only one single record at a time and includes a watermark. Licenses can be conveniently purchased from the AppSource, with license management and automatic invoicing handled in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center. If you choose the PREMIUM model, access details will be provided directly by us vial email.

Network & Security
The Writeback Grid is not certified by Microsoft due to its use of an external service, which Microsoft cannot control. We ensure security through the built-in encryption mechanisms of both HTTPS and ODBC for data transfers, along with an additional end-to-end encryption mechanism for user credentials. Depending on your backend's network configuration, you may need to whitelist the web service's IP address in your firewall settings and open the inbound database ports. Please note that the web service cannot connect to non-exposed local databases such as "localhost" or "127.0.0.1".

Upgrades
Both the visual component and the web services are regularly enhanced with new features, which are automatically updated in your report. Your web service will always have the latest version available for both plans. If you are self-hosting the web service, you only need to pull the new image from our container registry.

Support
The visual is designed to be very simple and intuitive, typically not raising many questions. However, we are happy to support you along the way and answer any additional questions.

Check our product page Writeback Grid to see the supported backends and features. If you have any further questions or feature requests, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@creativedata.io or visit our Wiki.

Name: Datellers Nested Total Bar Chart
Description: An alternative to Stacked Bar Charts, showing Segment-To-Totals for Comparison.
Long Summary: An alternative to Stacked Bar Charts, showing Segment-To-Totals for Comparison.
Description Full:
The Nested Total Bar Chart, an alternative to the stacked bar chart, organizes bars to display a total at the top of each group, simplifying the comparison between individual segments and their overall total. This design improves clarity by distinguishing the total value from the individual components, making comparisons more intuitive. It’s especially useful for maintaining a clean, simple visual while clearly highlighting both individual contributions and the total within each category.

1. Clear Comparison to Total: The total value for each group is explicitly shown in the total bar, making it easy to compare individual bars to the overall total.
2. Improved Readability: Unlike stacked bars, which can become cluttered, the nested design keeps the total separate from the individual segments, enhancing clarity.
3. Accurate Contribution Analysis: The total bar clearly shows how each individual data point contributes to the overall total, making it easier to interpret proportions across categories.
Keywords: Nested Bar Chart,Segmented Total,Stacked Bar,Datellers Nested Total Bar Chart

Name: Sunburst Chart
Description: Showcase hierarchical data with clarity—radial, readable, and ready for Power BI storytelling
Long Summary: Showcase hierarchical data with clarity—radial, readable, and ready for Power BI storytelling
Description Full:
Sunburst Chart by VisioChart

The Sunburst Chart by VisioChart is a highly visual and engaging way to present hierarchical data in Power BI. Designed for simplicity and flexibility, this chart displays categories in a circular, radial layout that helps users easily understand how parts of a hierarchy contribute to the whole.

With support for up to five levels of categories (dimensions), you can visually represent nested structures such as departments, product families, or geographical regions. The chart also allows for an optional measure to size each segment proportionally, making it easy to identify which categories dominate at any level.

Unlike tree diagrams or traditional bar charts, the Sunburst Chart uses concentric rings to show hierarchy levels. The innermost ring represents the first dimension, with each outer ring displaying the next level in the hierarchy. This design provides a compact and elegant view of complex data structures without overwhelming the user.

Key Features:

  • Supports 1 to 5 hierarchical dimensions
  • Optional support for 1 measure (numeric value)
  • Displays data as proportional segments in concentric rings
  • No drill-down or drill-through features – what you see is what you get
  • Ideal for static presentations of structured or grouped data
  • Fully integrated into the Power BI environment
  • Interactive tooltips for better data interpretation
  • Customizable colors and labels for enhanced clarity

Common Use Cases:

  • Visualizing company organizational hierarchies
  • Analyzing sales distribution across categories, subcategories, and products
  • Displaying customer segmentation based on location, age group, and spending level
  • Summarizing financial data by department, account type, and cost center
  • Presenting website structure or content categories

The Sunburst Chart is perfect for users who want to showcase static, hierarchical data in an attractive and digestible format. Whether you're summarizing business performance or showing breakdowns within a dataset, Sunburst Chart by VisioChart helps bring clarity and insight to your Power BI reports.

Designed with performance and readability in mind, this visual ensures your audience can quickly grasp the structure and significance of your data – all without leaving the Power BI experience.

Name: Stacked Bar Chart with Line by JTA
Description: Clustered bar chart with stacked detail and trend line overlay
Long Summary: Clustered bar chart with stacked detail and trend line overlay
Description Full:
Stacked Bar Chart with Line by JTA - The Data Scientist's Visualization Tool

Overview

This custom Power BI visual from JTA - The Data Scientists seamlessly blends the clarity of a traditional bar chart with the flexibility of a stacked bar, enabling an insightful view of multiple metrics in a single, cohesive display.

Each category features two bars:

  • A solid bar that represents the total value of a primary metric, giving an immediate sense of overall volume or performance.
  • A stacked bar that breaks this total down into individual components (e.g., product-level or subcategory contributions), revealing the underlying structure behind the headline number.

Overlaying this bar setup is a dynamic line chart, which tracks a secondary metric across categories. This layered visualization allows for direct comparison between trends and totals, helping users:

  • Identify patterns and deviations,
  • Spot mismatches between volume and value,
  • Extract deeper, actionable insights at a glance.

The visual supports rich customization options, allowing users to configure the stacking, color schemes, and axis formatting to suit specific analytic goals. Whether used for comparing product sales, departmental contributions, or multi-tiered KPIs, this chart empowers users to navigate complex data with clarity and precision.

Features of Stacked Bar Chart with Line:

  • Change Chart Orientation
    • Move the stacked bar: You can shift the position of the stacked bar from left to right or vice versa for better visual alignment.
  • Customize Axes
    • Modify the X and Y axes to enhance the chart’s appearance and readability.
    • Use the dual Y-axis feature:
      • One Y-axis for the bar chart; The other for the line chart.
      • Customize the range.
  • Adjust the Legend
    • Customize the legend position (top, bottom, side).
    • Change the look and feel, spacing, and even the width for clarity.
  • Style the Elements
    • Tweak the line and column styles—color, thickness, and shape—to match your preferred aesthetic or branding.
  • Interactivity Features
    • Click on bars or legend items to highlight or filter specific data.
    • Filter reports dynamically by clicking on any bar in the chart.
    • Emphasize key insights by highlighting bars and linked legend items.
  • Dive Into Customization
    • Explore all the settings to tailor the chart exactly to your needs.

If you have any doubts reach out to custom.visuals@thedatascientists.com.
Keywords: analytics,bar chart,stacked ,Stacked Bar Chart with Line by JTA
Simple Filename: Stacked Bar Chart with Line by JTA

Name: Bar and line chart with table
Description: Visualize bar and line chart with table integrated for detailed analysis
Long Summary: Visualize bar and line chart with table integrated for detailed analysis
Description Full:
This custom visual for Power BI combines a bar and line chart with an integrated table, providing a comprehensive view of your data in a single visual. It's ideal for visualizing trends and relationships between different metrics while also displaying the underlying data in a tabular format for detailed analysis. It has the following features:

  • Combined Bar and Line Chart: Display two different measures on the same chart, one as bars and the other as a line, allowing for easy comparison and identification of correlations
  • Integrated Table: Show the underlying data used for the chart in a table below the chart, providing detailed values and enabling in-depth analysis
  • Interactive Elements: Users can interact with the chart and table, such as hovering over data points to see tooltips, and filtering data
  • Formatting Options: Customize the colors, fonts, and styling of the chart and table to match your report's theme
  • Support for Measures and Dimensions: Works with various measures and dimensions from your Power BI data model

    • How to Use:
  • Assign Data Roles: Drag and drop the appropriate fields from your data model into the following data roles:
  • Category (Dimension): The dimension to use for the x-axis (e.g., Product category, month)
  • Bar Values (Measure): The measure to display as bars
  • Line Values (Measure): The measure to display as a line
  • Configure Formatting: Use the visual's formatting option in the Format pane to customize the appearance of the chart and table

    • Data Requirements
  • One dimension for the Category axis
  • At least one measure for the Bar or Line Values (Up to 10 bars or lines)

    • Formatting Options
    Chart:
  • Bar Color
  • Bar Transparency
  • Line Color
  • Line Style
  • Marker
  • Legend
  • Data Labels

    • Table:
  • Font Size, Font Family, Bold, Italic and Underline
  • Turn on/off the series
  • Display Units

    • More customization features will be added in the future based on the feedback
Keywords: Bar and line with table,bar table,line table,Bar and line chart with table

Name: Sankey Chart by Powerviz
Description: Unravel Complex Flows with Clarity using the Sankey Chart by Powerviz
Long Summary: Unravel Complex Flows with Clarity using the Sankey Chart by Powerviz
Description Full:
Sankey chart by Powerviz is a flow diagram that visualizes the proportional movement of data, resources, or processes between different categories or stages, using weighted flows to represent the magnitude of connections.

The advanced Sankey Chart includes vertical and horizontal charts, adding multiple levels, highlighting and moving nodes, fill patterns, 30+ color palettes, conditional formatting, ranking, sorting, import/export, and many more.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all advanced settings features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Chart Option – 2 in 1 visual, switch easily between vertical and horizontal Sankey chart.
  • Node Customizations – Options to adjust node appearance, spacing, visibility, and interactions for better readability and visual clarity in Sankey charts.
  • Multi-Level Sankey – Add multiple levels to your chart, enabling clear visualization of complex flows across various hierarchical stages.
  • Labels – Add Data labels and Header labels to improve readability.
  • Image Labels – Add dynamic image URLs as labels inside or outside to enhance the visual representation.
  • Data Colors – Offers 30+ color palettes, including color-blind safe mode for better accessibility.
  • Fill Pattern – Create patterns by selecting from a diverse range of options or uploading your own.
  • Ranking – Filter out Top/Bottom N by each level. Either hide or show the remaining categories as "Others".
  • Conditional Formatting – Easily find outliers by using rules for measures or categories. Set up smart rules based on values, the top and bottom N, and the percentage of the total.
  • Hide Null/Blank Nodes – On a click, hide Null nodes.
  • Import/Export – Effortlessly export or import the theme for sharing or reuse.
  • Templates – Select from predefined templates or create your own.
  • Annotation – Add notes to tell better stories with the same visual, making it easier for people to collaborate and understand every detail.
  • Grid View – Transforms the visual into an interactive table. Use pivot mode, filter, search, and sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show condition – Show/hide the visual based on a condition.

Business Use Cases:

  1. Customer Journey Analysis: Visualize how customers move through various sales funnel stages, identifying drop-offs and optimizing conversion rates.
  2. Financial Flow Tracking: Track revenue streams, expenses, and budget allocations to understand how funds are distributed and used within an organization.
  3. Supply Chain and Logistics: Map product flows across suppliers, manufacturers, distributors, and customers to identify inefficiencies and optimize processes.
  4. Energy Usage Analysis: Analyze energy inputs and outputs across systems to identify waste and improve efficiency in energy consumption or production.
  5. Marketing Campaign Analysis: Visualize how leads from different channels (e.g., email, ads, social media) convert through the sales funnel and identify the most effective channels.

To learn more about the Powerviz Sankey Chart, visit the website 

Check out the feature video and other tutorials. Learn about the Sankey Chart with detailed documentation.

Name: Seasonal Chart
Description: Plot time-series data, identify patterns, and compare year-over-year trends with ease
Long Summary: Plot time-series data, identify patterns, and compare year-over-year trends with ease
Description Full:
This custom Power BI visual specializes in generating clear, intuitive seasonality charts that display historical ranges and patterns in your time-series data. Perfect for analyzing recurring patterns across years, this visual shows:

*   **Historical Ranges:** Instantly view minimum and maximum boundaries for each time period (day/week/month).
*   **Central Tendency:** Track average values against historical ranges to identify typical seasonal behavior.
*   **Current Performance:** Compare current period values against historical patterns to spot anomalies.

**Key Features:**

*   Automatic calculation of seasonal min/max/average bands
*   Flexible time aggregation (daily, weekly, monthly views)
*   Customizable colors and formatting options

**Ideal Applications:**

*   Sales performance analysis
*   Weather pattern studies
*   Energy consumption tracking
*   Retail inventory planning
*   Tourism seasonal trends
*   Agricultural yield analysis

This visual helps business analysts, data scientists, and decision-makers quickly understand historical patterns and identify when current performance deviates from expected seasonal ranges, all without complex statistical setup.

Name: Smart Grid-Map
Description: Precise Geospatial Mapping and Data Visualization for Power BI
Long Summary: Precise Geospatial Mapping and Data Visualization for Power BI
Description Full:
This custom map is ideal for any Global Information System (GIS) or any other user who has data related to Grids. No more complex post-processing, It delivers very easy and performant data visualization with all capabilities of Microsoft Power BI for data interactivity and data analytics. The easiest way to visualize raster-data professionally. Introductory details of our custom visual, a powerful tool designed for precise geospatial mapping and data visualization of raster data.
  • This tool allows users to create interactive custom polygons using corner points, enabling the creation of square or quadrilateral shapes anywhere in the world.
  • It can display centroids (latitude and longitude) on the top layer of the polygons, providing a clear and concise view of your data.
  • It accepts various open AreaSeals (OAS), 4-point shapes as geo-spatial data-equivalents, input fields such as centroids/center points (x, y), polygon inputs (4 corner points x, y), legend, bubble size, and tooltip.
Value Proposition: Are you a GIS user or someone working with grid-related data? Simplify your data visualization and analysis with Smart Grid-Map. Say goodbye to complex post-processing and experience the power of precise geospatial mapping in Microsoft Power BI. Our tool allows you to create interactive custom polygons using corner points, enabling the creation of square or quadrilateral shapes anywhere in the world. With the ability to display centroids on top of polygons, you can gain clear insights into your data. Key Features:
  • Easy and performant grid-data visualization with Microsoft Power BI
  • Precise geospatial mapping of raster data in WGS84.
  • Customizable colors, transparency, and style.
  • Handles large grid-datasets efficiently.
  • Supports various 4-point grid quadrilateral shapes.
Key Benefits:
  • The main benefit of the Smart Grid-Map feature is the ability to easily visualize and analyze grid data in a precise and user-friendly manner using Microsoft Power BI.
  • WGS84 as input co-ordinate system allows easy integration of almost any data source.
  • Full customizability allows you to create a visual according to your own preference.
  • It supports large datasets of GIS without need of clustering.
  • Seamless visualization of GIS grids.
Just import your data, make the drag-and-drop matching and you will get amazing insights of your raster-data. Click the “Buy now” button above to get started with Smart Grid-Map, and experience the power of precise geospatial raster-data mapping with our Custom Power BI Visual. For more information, please visit our website (https://the-green-bridge.com/) About Us: At The Green Bridge, we specialize in providing innovative solutions for geospatial intelligence unified grid-mapping and agile data management. With a wide market reach and a trusted customer base, we offer unique tools and have received industry recognition for our services worldwide. Additional links:
  • Official TGB Website: https://the-green-bridge.com/
  • Smart Grid-Map by TGB: https://the-green-bridge.com/smart-grid-map/
Solve your geospatial mapping challenges today with ease by clicking "Get it now" in the top left corner. Experience the power of Smart Grid Map and unlock the full potential of your raster data via integrating your data to Microsoft Power BI. For more information, visit our website.

Name: Innofalls Charts
Description: Waterfall and bar charts with new comparison features. Stacked, deviations, grouping and more!
Long Summary: Waterfall and bar charts with new comparison features. Stacked, deviations, grouping and more!
Description Full:
Create engaging reports and offer unimagined comparison possibilities!

With Innofalls you can create many types of charts: Waterfall charts, bar charts, stacked bar charts.

We offer a new way to set up and explore your visual. Our concept of “navigation instead of configuration” lets you create your chart in an interactive manner. Use our drill down history to combine multiple drill downs and create the waterfall chart you need - fast.

You can add dynamic comparison charts with a single click, even as a report viewer. Switch between chart types anytime to view your data from a different perspective.
Furthermore, we offer advanced features like waterfall stacking, chart grouping by columns and other interactive features like Undo and Redo.

Have a look at our introduction video, for a brief overview how to get started with Innofalls.

Don't hesitate to contact us for support. Email us at info@innofalls.com or visit our support area at www.innofalls.com/support.

This visual is free without limitations for Power BI Desktop. For any other environment (e.g. Power BI Service) you need a license. You can request a free 30-day trial license on our website.

Chart Types:

  • Delta Waterfall Charts
  • Running Total Waterfall Charts
  • Deviation Waterfall Charts
  • Stacked Waterfall Charts
  • Bar / Column Charts
  • Stacked Bar / Column Charts
  • Deviation(Variance) Charts
  • Custom Combinations of Chart Types (New)

Interactivity:

  • Sorting and Top/Bottom N
  • Conditional Formatting (New)
  • Drill Down History
  • Undo / Redo
  • Dynamic Zoom
  • Dynamic Deviation Chart Selection
  • Full Menu in Reading View (can be disabled)

Other Features:

  • Chart Grouping by Measures, Dimension or Both
  • Automatic Chart Orientation
  • Automatic Rest Depending on Visual Size
  • Power BI Theme
  • IBCS Formatting
  • Drill Down Preview


Please see our change log for recent updates.

Filtering reports by date should be quick and effortless. Your Timeline Slicer makes it easy to select date ranges using an intuitive, interactive slider - offering a seamless experience that feels like a native Power BI visual.

Key Features:

Name: Metro Map
Description: Transform complex distribution steps into a clear, metro-style map that can help reveal bottlenecks
Long Summary: Transform complex distribution steps into a clear, metro-style map that can help reveal bottlenecks
Description Full:
Visualize logistics, distribution, and process flows with Metro Map

Metro Map is a unique way to visualize flow data, perfect for showcasing supply chains, transport networks, production processes, and stage gates. Unlike force-directed graphs, Metro Map allows for convergence of paths, better representing real world pathways.

Metro Map takes pairs of start and end nodes as input, and joins them all up, displaying a metro-style map of nodes and paths. This makes it easy to track logistics routes and dependencies. Hover or click on a node to highlight connections, helping users instantly understand the precedent and dependent paths in the network.

Why choose Viz Data for Power BI?

We design beautiful and highly functional custom visuals that seamlessly blend into your Power BI reports while maintaining the polish of PowerPoint and modern web design. We strive to make our visuals easy to use, with clear error messaging to help users learn how to use the visual.

Key Features and Benefits

  • ⚡ Flow Visualization: Transform start and end data into an interconnected map
  • ⚡ Node & Path Highlighting: Hover or click on a node to reveal its dependencies and connected paths.
  • ⚡ Customizable Design: Adjust line thickness, node size, and colors.
  • ⚡ Interactive Formatting: Set node hover effects and control label positioning relative to nodes
  • ⚡ Works in unsupported environments: License checks are skipped where user identity cannot be verified (e.g., Publish to Web), ensuring broad accessibility.

How to test and buy

Name: Warning Icon
Description: A conditional visual, which displays an icon when a number series reaches a certain level
Long Summary: A conditional visual, which displays an icon when a number series reaches a certain level
Description Full:
Highlight key insights with dynamic warning icons

Warning helps flag important data points for your users by displaying an icon only when specific conditions are met. Instead of cluttering your report with unnecessary alerts, Warning preserves space by appearing only when values reach critical thresholds.

For example, if tracking Debt, you can set Warning to display an alert only when it exceeds a certain level. If it remains within a safe range, no icon appears, keeping your report focused on what matters most.

Why choose Viz Data for Power BI?

We design beautiful and highly functional custom visuals that seamlessly blend into your Power BI reports while maintaining the polish of PowerPoint and modern web design. Our aim is to make all our visuals easier to use than standard visuals.

Key Features and Benefits

  • ⚡ Conditional Icons: Display an icon only when data meets defined conditions, reducing unnecessary distractions.
  • ⚡ Multi-Level Alerts: Set up to three different icons for different number ranges—use a green tick for safe values and a red cross for critical levels—and select an icon to display if there is an error in the data .
  • ⚡ Versatile Use Cases: It's not just ticks and crosses: choose from 14 icons to flag risks, highlight achievements, or indicate trends with meaningful symbols.
  • ⚡ Tooltips for Clarity: Add explanations for users directly in the formatting pane—e.g., "This visual appears if losses exceeded $100k this month."
  • ⚡ A picture paints a thousand words: Summarize numeric datasets with clear visual indicators, reducing cognitive load for users.

Name: Metric
Description: Stylish visual that reduces a series to a single value, using intelligent notation for large values
Long Summary: Stylish visual that reduces a series to a single value, using intelligent notation for large values
Description Full:
Showcase your KPIs with an intelligent and customizable display

Metric is a simple yet powerful way to display key performance indicators (KPIs) in your Power BI reports. Designed for clarity and customization, Metric presents your KPI in a transparent or colored box, with its series name in a matching opaque box. The result is a sleek, modern visual that enhances the readability of your data.

Unlike traditional KPI visuals, Metric allows for full control over alignment, color, transparency, and formatting. Whether you need a bold, centered number or a subtle inline metric, Metric adapts to your report’s style while ensuring your audience understands the data.

Why choose Viz Data for Power BI?

We design beautiful and highly functional custom visuals that seamlessly blend into your Power BI reports while maintaining the polish of PowerPoint and modern web design.

Key Features and Benefits

  • ⚡ Customize Units: Display values in thousands, millions or trillions using a custom divisor, or let the auto option intelligently abbreviate numbers. Set the precise number of decimals you need. If a data format is set, it will take precedence.
  • ⚡ Customize Format: Display your KPI and series name in a fully adjustable format—choose a sleek underline, a transparent overlay, or a single box that combines both elements.
  • ⚡ Flexible Alignment: Position the KPI at the top or bottom, left or right, and align the series name as needed.
  • ⚡ Theme Integration: Automatically inherits Power BI theme colors but user can overwrite this if no theme is detected.
  • ⚡ Data-Aware Formatting: Recognizes financial formats, decimal places, and display units (thousands, millions, billions, etc.).
  • ⚡ Clever Tooltips: Add an explanatory tooltip without needing a data series—just type directly into the formatting pane.
  • ⚡ Minimalist Mode: Hide the series name and make the KPI box transparent for a subtle underline-style display.
  • ⚡ Great on Any Background: Looks clean with light themes and stands out on dark backgrounds.

Name: Process Flow Diagram
Description: Process Flow Diagram is a stylish Power BI custom visual that makes your reports stand out
Long Summary: Process Flow Diagram is a stylish Power BI custom visual that makes your reports stand out
Description Full:
Make your reports beautiful with a PowerPoint-style banner that filters by category

Process Flow Diagram represents your process, progress or phases as a customisable sequence of interlocking arrows, which filter or highlight on click, and can be coloured in multiple ways to add a touch of class to your Power BI reports.

Why choose Viz Data for Power BI

We strive to make beautiful and highly functional custom visuals that mimic the standard offering from Microsoft, so we support Tooltips, Edit Interactions highlighting and filtering, data-driven sorting and colouring. We think Power BI reports have the potential to look as good as a PowerPoint presentation or website, while retaining a great deal more functionality.

Key Features and Benefits

  • ⚡Engaging & Intuitive Design: Seamlessly blend the polish of web design and presentations into your Power BI reports with beautiful interlocking arrows.
  • ⚡Free in unsupported environments: We believe the web is Power BI's superpower, so in cases where we cannot check user licenses (e.g., Publish to Web), we skip license checks altogether. (This is subject to change.)
  • ⚡Cross-Filtering: Users can filter or highlight other visuals by clicking on an arrow, using Edit Interactions to set the click behavior they want.
  • ⚡Data-Driven Coloring: Highlight the flow of a process with color gradients, or draw attention to particular phases using data-driven heatmap coloring.
  • ⚡Data-Driven Sort Order: If your phases—like days of the week—defy alphabetic sorting, provide a numeric series by which to sort your arrows.
  • ⚡Data-Driven Arrow Size: Provide an optional data series and you can drive the size of each arrow from the data.
  • ⚡Customise Arrow Shapes: Choose between curved or pointed arrows, change the direction of arrows, and specify the level of pointiness.
  • ⚡Tooltips as standard: Category data and any numeric data you provide are shown in standard Power BI tooltips.
  • ⚡Quick Manual Arrows: If you just need a quick arrow visual, you can supply semi-colon separated terms for your arrows: these don't support filtering or data-driven coloring, but they are fast and beautiful!

Name: accoMASTERDATA Enterprise - Writeback, MDM, Masterdata, Table
Description: A masterdata edit visual tool with writeback in Power BI
Long Summary: A masterdata edit visual tool with writeback in Power BI
Description Full:
Visual with writeback directly in Power BI for Masterdata management

Edit and save data directly in Power BI

If you experience issues with the buy and transaction though AppSource please contact us for alternative ways to purchase licenses.

accoMASTERDATA easily embeds a powerful data edit tool directly into Power BI. Also, it allows write-back to various data sources directly from within the tool. Quick and easy project management, Master data, Comments and analysis.

WHY accoMASTERDATA?
If you want to optimize and professionalize any master data process that requires manual input from your employees, then accoMASTERDATA can help you. accoMASTERDATA is a simple and very flexible solution based on Power BI functionality. It can support any process that requires values, text or date/time input from employees around the organization. As an integral part of Power BI, you have many options to customize your master data solution according to your needs - both technically and visually. At the same time, you avoid users need to switch system when they need to budget and plan and in the next moment check their daily reporting.

WHAT IS accoMASTERDATA?
accoMASTERDATA addresses the necessary data edit process but bypasses the issues that attach to the major Masterdata tools. With accoMASTERDATA you get a cheap and extremely fast implemented reporting solution that uses the agility and data security of Power BI. Via accoMASTERDATA, users can provide input to the underlying data model e.g. in a Product master data creation and maintenance process. The built-in Power BI security model ensures that entry users will only see the subset of data that pertains to them. The effect of the entries will immediately be visualized on the graphic objects, which provides a better overview.

REQUIREMENTS
(1) Requires Microsoft Power BI (https://powerbi.microsoft.com)
(2) To be able to save data, you need to access to a SQL table for writeback functionality
(3) A license for accoMASTERDATA

HOW TO
accoMASTERDATA is a Power BI custom visualization that can be downloaded directly from Power BI though Microsoft App. The solution gives you a simple way to off loaded your master data in Power BI (Writeback). The only additional thing you need is a place for storing your writeback data and a License key. Data needs to be stored in a SQL table in an Azure Database.

SUPPORTED FEATURES
• Insert/delete/update row
• Adjust data -> numbers, Boolean, text or date/time
• Row level comments
• Locking cells/columns based on conditions
• Dynamic or static dropdown based on DAX logic
• Edit/read only mode
• Custom column calculations (absolute and relative)
• Power BI native-like design
• Row Level Security
• Audit logs
• Extended data input validations using regular expressions

POPULAR USE CASES
• Master Data maintenance
• Handling of payables receivables
• Status confirmation
• Row level comments
• Ad-hoc dimensions and extended metadata to existing dimensions.

MAIN BENEFITS OF accoMASTERDATA
• Use any existing Power BI model
• Supports all DAX calculations
• Benefit from your existing Power BI knowledge and resource
• No servers and no need for additional applications or interfaces
• No need to train people in new systems
• Benefit from current and future enhancements of Power BI
• Simple and easy maintenance
• Low cost
• Will work where powerbi.com works

For more information and pricing, please visit https://www.accotool.com


Currently this visual in not compatible with the Safari browser on MacOS.

Name: Linear Gauge by Powerviz
Description: An advanced visual to track the progress on a linear scale against the targets
Long Summary: An advanced visual to track the progress on a linear scale against the targets
Description Full:
Linear Gauge by Powerviz is an intuitive visual to track the progress against the Targets in a Horizontal/Vertical scale with many preset Templates to choose from.

A Linear gauge is an advanced visual that is commonly used to display the progress against set targets on a linear scale, with an axis displaying a range of values or percentages. The Linear Gauge quickly conveys the current status or progress of a task or value being measured. It is regularly used for project management, performance tracking, and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs).

Check out the live demo here.

To access all advanced settings features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Gauge Style - Choose from a various Gauge styles like linear, bar-in-bar, cylinder, and thermometer with both vertical and Horizontal orientation. It also comes with additional options to customize the gauge radius, orientation, and more.
  • Templates - Use the well crafted Gauge Templates to easily get started and customize it later as needed.
  • Scale - Choose the scale to be either absolute or percentage number format, including an option to customize min-max range with various formatting choices.
  • Targets - Set a custom target or apply a target using a value field, also option to add various types of target markers.
  • Data Colors - Choose from various color palettes with Single, Comparison and Gradient colors .
  • Band - Select from 7 different themes and adjust the number of ticks to suit your needs.
  • Fill Patterns - Apply patterns by picking from a wide range of options or add your own.
  • Labels - Add data labels that help improve readability and goal tracking.
  • Small Multiples - Split your visual into multiple, smaller visuals based on your selected fields.
  • Ranking - Filter out Top/Bottom N by values within data. Show remaining values as "Others".
  • Annotation - Add notes to tell better stories with the same visual, making it easier for people to collaborate and understand every detail.
  • Grid View - Transforms the visual into an interactive table. filter, search, and sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show condition - Show/hide the visual based on a condition.
  • Native Features - Supports native features including cross-filtering, interaction, selection, tooltip, and bookmark.

Business Use Cases:

  • Sales Performance Tracking - Monitor individual or team sales performance against targets using linear gauges. Visualize sales quotas, conversion rates, or revenue goals, enabling quick assessment and comparison of achievements.
  • Project Milestone Monitoring - Track project progress by displaying key milestones or task completion rates. Linear gauges can visually represent completion percentages, ensuring project managers stay informed about progress.
  • Financial KPI Analysis - Visualize financial metrics like budget utilization, expenditure, or profit margins. Linear gauges provide a clear view of financial health, assisting in the immediate identification of areas needing attention or improvement.
  • Manufacturing Quality Control - Monitor defect rates, production efficiency, or equipment performance, aiding in the swift identification and resolution of issues.
  • Customer Satisfaction Metrics - Gauge customer satisfaction levels through metrics like Net Promoter Score (NPS) or customer feedback ratings.

Name: SPC Chart
Description: Analyse process data over time
Long Summary: Analyse process data over time
Description Full: An SPC chart is a plot of data over time. It allows you to distinguish between common and special cause variations. It includes a mean and two process limits which are both used in the statistical interpretation of data. The rules: 1) Any single point outside the process limits. 2) A run of 7 points above or below the mean (a  shift), or a run of 7 points all consecutively ascending or descending (a trend).    3) 2 out of 3 points within 1 sigma of the upper or lower control limit. All these rules aid interpretation but still require intelligent examination of the data. This visual highlights when a rule has been broken and highlights whether this is an improvement or deterioration

Name: orcaviz-pro
Description: Bring location intelligence to PowerBI with Orcaviz.com custom visuals
Long Summary: Bring location intelligence to PowerBI with Orcaviz.com custom visuals
Description Full:
Why use Maps in Power BI?
“Where” things happen is often a neglected dimension of Business Intelligence. Usually we work in two dimensions, numbers and place names. However, it is not easy to understand the relative proximity of points in data using just the place name, address or zip code. It is much easier when visualised and analysed spatially – the third dimension.

Who might benefit?
Most data has some form of location component and so viewing that data on a map will give much better insights.  For instance, you will be able to see where the data is and whether it is uniformly distributed, or clustered in smaller groups.  Using an interactive map will enable you to explore the data by zooming in/out and looking at different areas of data to identify patterns or reasons for the distribution.

What can OrcaViz-Pro do?
OrcaViz-Pro brings location intelligence into your Power BI reports and dashboards.  It enables you to:
•	Visualise and explore the data points on a map.
•	Scale the datapoints in relation to a numeric value to see where things are distributed.
•	Visualise heatmaps of the data, highlighting the clustering of data.
•	Overlay geographic borders (states, territories, countries etc)
•	To extract data within a geographic border or a hand drawn shape and create a new dataset.
•	To count or sum data within geographic boundaries or hand drawn shapes.

In addition, sometimes, it is important to see two or more datasets layered on the same map.  For instance, you might want to view the location of your businesses and how that relates to the distribution of your customers.  To do this in Power BI, you would be required to combine the data into one dataset or use two maps side by side.  However, OrcaViz enables you to load additional datasets from your local machine onto the same map.  (NB: Additional datasets loaded onto the map cannot be stored with the map in the pbix file).

OrcaViz-Pro is a fully functional custom visual but limited to the display of 10,000 data points.  If you require more than this, please contact us.

You will require latitude and longitude coordinates to visualise your data.  If you do not have them, OrcaViz-Pro can add those coordinates, but you will require an API key for Bing Maps.

Name: Ridgeline Plot by Powerviz
Description: Visualize the trends and distribution across multiple categories as density plots
Long Summary: Visualize the trends and distribution across multiple categories as density plots
Description Full:
An advanced visual that shows the distribution of numeric values for several groups.

Create an in-depth visualization with ridge styling, line curves, scaling, vibrant colors, conditional formatting, and more. Allow quick comparisons by effectively utilizing space in your Power BI report.

A ridgeline plot, also known as a joy plot, is a data visualization used to display the distribution of numeric variables for multiple categories along a common continuous axis. It displays the distribution by stacking them vertically in such a manner that the overlapping lines create the impression of a mountain range. Ridgeline plots are particularly useful for showcasing how the patterns of distributions change across different categories, time periods, or scenarios, providing insights into the variability and trends within the data.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all the advanced settings features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner.

Key Feature Highlights:
  • Multiple Distribution: Plot distribution across several groups. It also allows more than one value comparison.
  • Ridge Style: For visually appealing display, smooth line styling and stroke and marker options are available.
  • Scaling: Spot patterns easily by controlling the Y-axis scaling and density/area overlaps.
  • Colors: Apply color by axis, category. There is 30+ palettes, 7 color scheme and FX rules available.
  • Legend: Legend is available in case of multiple values to plot data accurately.
  • Ranking: Filter out Top/Bottom N by value or peaks within data. Show remaining values as "Others".
  • Reference Line: Add line on the Y and X-axis to highlight a range or important data points.
  • Mode Line: Highlight peak points and display labels on them.
  • Custom Tooltip: Add highest, lowest, mean & median point in tooltip without any additional DAX/measure.
  • Themes: Easily save your designs using the JSON export/import feature, enabling seamless sharing and use across multiple Power BI reports.
  • Annotation: Add additional information and interpretations on specific data points.
  • Grid View: Transforms the visual into an interactive table. Use pivot mode, filter, search, and sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show condition: Show/hide the visual based on a condition.
  • Native Features: Supports native features including cross-filtering, interaction, selection, tooltip, bookmark, and context menu.
Business Use Cases:
  1. Time Series Data: When you have data that changes over time, like stock prices, weather patterns, or sales figures, you can use ridgeline plots to see how the distributions of these values evolve over different time periods.
  2. Statistical Analysis: To understand frequency datasets like population study, country comparison, or time points, you can use ridgeline plots to visualize how these values are distributed across those groups.

Name: Waffle Chart Maker
Description: Waffle Chart for Power BI by VisioChart enhances data visualization, sorting, color customization
Long Summary: Waffle Chart for Power BI by VisioChart enhances data visualization, sorting, color customization
Description Full:
Waffle Chart Maker for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart

In the realm of data visualization, presenting information in a clear, compelling, and easily interpretable manner is paramount. Microsoft Power BI, a leading business analytics tool, offers an array of visualization options. Among these, the Waffle Chart by VisioChart stands out as a unique and highly effective method for representing data. This article delves into the features of the Waffle Chart for Power BI by VisioChart, highlighting its capabilities and advantages.

1. Draw Waffle Charts Based on Numbers and Percentages

The Waffle Chart is a versatile tool designed to display data in a grid format, resembling a waffle, where each cell represents a unit of measurement. One of its core features is the ability to draw charts based on both numbers and percentages. This flexibility allows users to present data in a way that best suits their analysis needs. For instance, when showing sales performance, you can illustrate the total number of units sold or the percentage of a sales target achieved. This dual capability ensures that the Waffle Chart can cater to a wide range of data visualization requirements.

2. Sort Chart Asc/Desc Based on Category, Measure, and Sort Index Column

Organizing data in a meaningful order is crucial for effective analysis. The Waffle Chart by VisioChart offers robust sorting functionalities, allowing users to sort data in ascending or descending order based on different criteria. You can sort by category, which is useful for comparing different groups or segments. Additionally, sorting by measure helps highlight the magnitude of data points, making it easier to identify top or bottom performers. The sort index column provides an additional layer of customization, enabling users to define a specific order based on custom indices. This comprehensive sorting capability enhances the clarity and relevance of the data presented.

3. Customize the Color of Each Category

Color customization is a powerful feature of the Waffle Chart, providing users with the ability to assign distinct colors to different categories. This visual differentiation helps in quickly distinguishing between various segments and enhances the overall aesthetic appeal of the chart. For example, in a market share analysis, each competitor can be assigned a unique color, making it easier to compare their respective shares at a glance. The ability to customize colors also aligns the chart with corporate branding guidelines or personal preferences, ensuring consistency across reports and presentations.

4. Customizable Display Units for Values

Presenting data in appropriate units is essential for clarity and comprehension. The Waffle Chart by VisioChart allows users to customize the display units for values, accommodating different scales and contexts. Whether dealing with thousands, millions, or percentages, this feature ensures that data is presented in the most relevant and understandable format. Customizable display units enhance the readability of the chart, making it easier for stakeholders to grasp the key insights without getting bogged down by unnecessary detail or confusing units.

5. Cross-Filtering

Interactivity is a cornerstone of modern data visualization, and the Waffle Chart excels in this regard with its cross-filtering capability. This feature allows users to interact with the chart, dynamically filtering data across multiple visualizations within the same report. For instance, selecting a category in the Waffle Chart can filter related data in other charts, such as bar charts or line graphs, providing a coherent and integrated analytical experience. Cross-filtering fosters deeper insights and enables users to explore data from various perspectives, facilitating more informed decision-making.

The Waffle Chart for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart is a powerful and flexible tool that enhances data visualization capabilities. Its ability to draw charts based on numbers and percentages provides versatility in data representation. The sorting features ensure that data is organized in the most meaningful way, while color customization adds a layer of visual differentiation. Customizable display units make the chart adaptable to different scales and contexts, and cross-filtering enables interactive and comprehensive analysis.

Incorporating the Waffle Chart into your Power BI reports can significantly improve the way data is communicated, making it easier for stakeholders to understand and act upon the insights derived. Whether you are analyzing sales performance, market share, or any other metric, the Waffle Chart by VisioChart offers a compelling and effective visualization option that can elevate your data analysis to new heights.
Keywords: waffle chart,waffle chart power bi,waffle graph,Waffle Chart Maker

Name: Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram
Description: Enhance data analysis with Non Ribbon Chord Diagram in Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart
Long Summary: Enhance data analysis with Non Ribbon Chord Diagram in Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart
Description Full:
Non-Ribbob Chord Diagram for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart

In the world of data visualization, representing complex relationships in an intuitive and visually appealing manner is crucial. Microsoft Power BI, a leading business analytics service, offers a wide range of visualization tools to meet this need. Among these, the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram by VisioChart stands out as a powerful tool for illustrating interconnections within a dataset.

Circular Layout

The Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram generator employs a circular layout, which is instrumental in visualizing relationships between different data points. This circular arrangement allows for a clear and organized presentation of data, making it easier to understand complex interconnections at a glance. Each data point, or node, is positioned around the circle, and relationships between these nodes are depicted as links, that span across the circle. This layout is particularly effective for displaying networks, links, and any scenario where relationships between multiple entities need to be showcased.

Chords/Links

One of the defining features of the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram is its ability to represent connections between nodes using chords or links. VisioChart offers four types of chord representations:
Solid Color: Chord are displayed in a single, solid color, providing a clean and straightforward visualization.
Source Nodes Color: Chords take on the color of the source node, making it easy to trace connections back to their origin.
Target Color: Chords are colored based on the target node, highlighting the destination of each connection.
Auto Color (Gradient): Chords display a gradient that transitions between the source and target colors, offering a visually appealing way to represent the flow between nodes.

These options give users the flexibility to choose the best visual representation for their data, enhancing the clarity and impact of the diagram.

Color Coding

Color coding is a powerful tool in data visualization, and the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram by VisioChart leverages this feature to its full potential. Users can assign different colors to nodes to represent various categories, groups, or values. This differentiation not only makes the diagram more visually appealing, but also aids in distinguishing between different types of data, enhancing the overall readability and effectiveness of the visualization.

Symmetry

Symmetry in the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram ensures that the visual representation of data is balanced and aesthetically pleasing. By arranging nodes symmetrically around the circle, the diagram avoids clutter and confusion, making it easier to follow the connections between nodes. This symmetrical layout contributes to a cleaner and more professional appearance, which is particularly important for presentations and reports.

Tooltips

Tooltips are an interactive feature that adds a layer of depth to the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram. When users hover over a node or chord, additional information about that element is displayed in a tooltip. This feature provides context and details that might not be immediately apparent from the visual alone, such as specific values, categories, or descriptions. Tooltips enhance the interactivity of the diagram, allowing users to explore the data in more detail without overwhelming the visual space.

Labels and Annotations

Labels and annotations are essential for clarifying the information presented in the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram. Labels can be used to identify nodes, providing immediate recognition of what each node represents. Annotations can offer further explanations or highlight key points within the diagram. Together, these features ensure that the diagram is not only visually appealing but also informative and accessible.

Chords/Links Direction

Chords/links in the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram can significantly impact the visualization of charts. VisioChart provides two options for link representation:
Linear: Connections are represented by straight lines that can go in both directions, symbolizing reciprocal relationships.
Curved: Connections are represented by curved lines that can go in both directions, symbolizing reciprocal relationships.

the Non-Ribbon Chord Diagram by VisioChart for Power BI is a versatile and powerful tool for visualizing complex relationships within a dataset. Its range of customizable features, including chord thickness, color coding, and interactive tooltips, make it an invaluable asset for any data analyst looking to present their data in a clear and impactful way.

Name: LLM Chatbot
Description: LLM-powered Chatbot integrated into your report, maximizing productivity and efficiency.
Long Summary: LLM-powered Chatbot integrated into your report, maximizing productivity and efficiency.
Description Full:
Overview
The LLM Chatbot seamlessly incorporates a LLM-powered and personalized Chatbot into your Power BI reports, allowing users to effortlessly input prompts and receive responses directly within the report. This functionality is especially valuable when you aim to offer your business users a secure and cost-effective way of interacting with LLMs such as ChatGPT, eliminating the requirement for additional frontend hosting. The LLM Chatbot custom visual utilizes the REST API of the respective LLM host provider and the REST API of the Power BI dataset.

Modes
The visual provides three distinct modes: "General," "File," and "Dataset," where "General" just communicates with the LLM endpoint without adding further context. You can either enable mode-switching for users or set a default mode and hide the selection options for streamlined interactions.

Licensing & Pricing
Licenses can be conveniently purchased from the AppSource, with license management and automatic invoicing handled in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center.

Support
The visual is designed to be very simple and intuitive, typically not raising many questions. However, we are happy to support you along the way and answer any additional questions.

Check our product page LLM Chatbot to see the supported features and functionalities. Please remember that LLM models and applications can make mistakes. Check important info. If you have any further questions or feature requests, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@creativedata.io.

Bubble Diagram for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart

Data visualization plays a crucial role in interpreting complex datasets, making it easier for stakeholders to grasp insights and make informed decisions. Among the myriad of visualization tools available, the Bubble Diagram for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart stands out for its unique ability to display quantitative data in an engaging and intuitive manner. This article delves into the features of the Bubble Diagram by VisioChart, exploring how it enhances data analysis and visualization.

Displays Quantitative Data as Bubble Sizes

The Bubble Diagram is a powerful tool for representing quantitative data through bubble sizes. Each bubble’s size is proportional to the value it represents, providing a visual cue that makes it easy to compare different data points at a glance. This feature is particularly useful for highlighting the magnitude of data points, such as sales volumes, population sizes, or revenue figures. By encoding data in bubble sizes, the Bubble Diagram allows for an immediate visual impact, helping users quickly identify significant trends and outliers.

Allows for Direct Comparison Across Different Categories and Sub-Categories

One of the standout features of the Bubble Diagram is its ability to facilitate direct comparisons across different categories and sub-categories. By plotting bubbles on a shared axis, users can easily compare the relative sizes of bubbles within and across categories. This comparative analysis is invaluable in scenarios such as market share analysis, where it's essential to see how different companies or products stack up against each other. The visual nature of the Bubble Diagram simplifies complex comparisons, making it easier to derive meaningful insights from the data.

Supports Numerical Measures for Accurate Representation

Accuracy in data representation is a cornerstone of effective data visualization. The Bubble Diagram by VisioChart supports numerical measures, ensuring that the size of each bubble accurately reflects the underlying data. This precision is critical for maintaining the integrity of the analysis, especially when dealing with financial data, scientific measurements, or any other context where exact values matter. The support for numerical measures guarantees that users can trust the visualizations to provide an honest and accurate depiction of the data.

Customizable Display Units for Values

Different datasets require different units of measurement, and the Bubble Diagram accommodates this need through customizable display units. Whether dealing with thousands, millions, percentages, or any other unit, users can adjust the display to match the context of their data. This customization enhances the clarity of the visualization, ensuring that viewers can easily understand the scale of the data without needing to mentally convert units. Customizable display units make the Bubble Diagram versatile, capable of adapting to a wide range of data presentation requirements.

Cross-Filtering

Interactivity is a key feature of modern data visualization, and the Bubble Diagram excels in this regard with its cross-filtering capabilities. Cross-filtering allows users to interact with the diagram, dynamically filtering data across multiple visualizations within the same report. For example, selecting a specific bubble can filter related data in other charts, such as bar graphs or line charts, providing a cohesive and integrated analytical experience. This feature enables users to explore data from various angles, fostering deeper insights and more comprehensive analysis.

Adjustable Bubble Colors for Different Categories

Color plays a vital role in data visualization, helping to differentiate between categories and highlight key information. The Bubble Diagram by VisioChart offers adjustable bubble colors, allowing users to assign distinct colors to different categories. This customization not only enhances the visual appeal of the diagram but also improves its functionality. By color-coding bubbles based on categories, users can quickly identify and compare different groups within the data. Whether following corporate branding guidelines or simply making the diagram more accessible, adjustable colors provide an additional layer of flexibility and effectiveness.

The Bubble Diagram for Microsoft Power BI by VisioChart is a versatile and powerful tool for data visualization. Its ability to display quantitative data through bubble sizes makes it easy to understand and compare different data points. The support for direct comparison across categories and sub-categories, coupled with numerical measure accuracy, ensures that the data is both meaningful and precise. Customizable display units enhance clarity, while cross-filtering fosters interactive and integrated analysis.
Keywords: Bubble Chart,Bubble Comparison Chart,Bubble Chart Maker,Bubble Diagram

Name: Clustering using OPTICS by MAQ Software
Description: Use the density-based clustering algorithm OPTICS to analyze groups within a dataset.
Long Summary: Use the density-based clustering algorithm OPTICS to analyze groups within a dataset.
Description Full:
Clustering using OPTICS by MAQ Software analyzes and identifies data clusters. The algorithm relies on density-based clustering, allowing users to identify outlier points and closely-knit groups within larger groups. This visual includes adjustable clustering parameters to control hierarchy depth and cluster sizes. R package dependencies (auto-installed): Dbscan, plotly, ggplot2.

Key features:

  • Data is scaled and pre-processed automatically, eliminating the need to do so externally.
  • Hover tooltips and zoom effects.
  • Capability to manually adjust the parameters of the clustering model.

For any feature requests or questions about this visual, please send an e-mail to our team at support@maqsoftware.com.

Name: Waterfall-Visual-Extended
Description: Waterfall for simple visualisation of deviations between bars and final values
Long Summary: Waterfall for simple visualisation of deviations between bars and final values
Description Full:
This waterfall model supports comprehensive functions for representing bridges and waterfall models with delta elements. In addition, all elements can be customised individually. This provides full flexibility. Supported functionalities: 

1. creation of bars that are displayed next to each other
2. creation of adding bars
3. creating deltas between two bars
4. creation of summing bars from adding bars
5. creating deltas to the next and next but one bar
6. creating end values. (Bars are displayed one above the other. Helpful when displaying year-end values)
7. configuration of all labels possible 
8. configuration of lines and axes possible
9. configuration of all bars in colour, border and arrangement
10. specification of bar colours depending on their value
11. hide ans show individual Bars

More Informations: https://github.com/AuxilManagementGmbH/WasserfallExtended/blob/main/README_EN.md

Name: Untap Text Box
Description: Input and justify text in reports with Untap Text Box for enhanced, aesthetically pleasing data narr
Long Summary: Input and justify text in reports with Untap Text Box for enhanced, aesthetically pleasing data narr
Description Full:
Untap Text Box is an innovative and interactive Power BI visual tool developed by Untap, designed to transform how users interact with and interpret data within Power BI reports. It introduces an interactive input field for textual data, enhancing the analytical and reporting capabilities of Power BI users.

Value Proposition:
1. Enhanced Interactivity: Untap Text Box allows users to directly input text into Power BI reports, making the reports more dynamic and interactive. This feature is invaluable for adding context, explanations, or annotations directly alongside data visualizations.
2. Advanced Text Formatting:  Moving beyond the standard alignment options of left, center, and right, it introduces full paragraph justification. This advanced feature transforms text within Power BI into elegantly formatted blocks, akin to professional publishing. The text in Untap Text Box flows evenly and aligns perfectly on both sides, creating a polished, print-like appearance that is both visually appealing and enhances readability.
3. Improved Data Narration: By enabling users to add descriptive text directly into reports, Untap Text Box facilitates better data storytelling. This makes complex data more accessible and understandable to a wider audience.

Business Audience:
1. Data Analysts and Report Builders: For professionals who regularly create and present data reports, Untap Text Box adds a layer of depth and personalization, enhancing the clarity and effectiveness of their data storytelling.
2. Business Executives and Decision-Makers: Executives who rely on data-driven insights for decision-making can benefit from reports that are enriched with direct annotations and explanations, making the data more actionable.

Target Industry:
1. Finance and Banking: For financial reporting, where detailed explanations are crucial, Untap Text Box provides a means to directly annotate financial models and data.

Name: Sunburst by Powerviz
Description: Visualize hierarchical data through a series of concentric arcs, shows the part-to-whole proportion
Long Summary: Visualize hierarchical data through a series of concentric arcs, shows the part-to-whole proportion
Description Full:
Unlock Hidden Insights, Explore Outliers, And Visualize Multiple Categories with Feature-Rich Sunburst Chart by Powerviz

The Sunburst Chart by Powerviz is a fully dynamic and interactive visualization tool, designed to display hierarchical data in an intuitive format. With this chart, you can easily visualize multiple columns in a hierarchy and uncover valuable insights. The concentric circle design helps in displaying part-to-whole relationships.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all pro features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner of the visual.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Arc Customization – Enables customization of arc shape, patterns, and formatting to create unique designs.
  • Color scheme – Offers 30+ color palettes including color-blind safe mode for better accessibility.
  • Centre circle – Design the inner circle with multiple layer options. Add text, icons, measure, and images.
  • Ranking – Filter out Top/Bottom N by each level. Either hide or show remaining categories as "Others".
  • Conditional formatting – Easily identify outliers based on measure or category rules.
  • Labels – Add smart data labels that improve readability, and can be placed inside or outside the shape.
  • Annotations – Creates multiple stories out of same visual. Add comments to allow users to collaborate and easily understand each node in depth.
  • Interactivity – Fully interactive with features like zoom, drill down, cross-filtering, and tooltip are available to get more details.
  • Grid view – Transforms the visual into an interactive table. Use pivot mode, filter, search, and sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show condition – Show/hide the visual based on a condition.
  • Native Features - Supports all native features including cross-filtering, interaction, selection, tooltip, bookmark, and context menu.

Business Use Cases:

  1. Sales and Marketing : Analyze market share or customer segmentation, to better understand the relationships between different categories and subcategories.
  2. Finance : Used to analyze organizational structures, such as departmental budgets or expenditures, to identify trends, outliers, and potential areas for cost-saving.
  3. Operations : Use for manufacturing processes or supply chain management, to identify areas of inefficiency or bottlenecks in the process.
  4. Education : Display course structures and curriculums, allowing students and teachers to better understand the hierarchy and relationships between different subjects.
  5. Human Resources : Analyze employee demographics, organizational structures, and performance data, allowing companies to better understand workforce trends and identify areas for improvement.

Name: HCLTech 4-Dimensional Bubble Chart
Description: Four dimensional bubble chart
Long Summary: Four dimensional bubble chart
Description Full:
A bubble chart, also known as a bubble visual, is a type of multivariable graph that uses bubbles or circles to represent data points in three dimensions. It is a variation of scatter plots, but instead of using dots, it uses bubbles to display the values of three quantitative variables.
To create a bubble chart in Power BI, you need to arrange your data in a specific format. The x-values should be placed in the first row or column, followed by the corresponding y-values, and the z-values (which determine the size of the bubbles) should be placed at the end.
The bubble visual in Power BI allows you to simultaneously visualize three variables. The x-axis and y-axis represent two different dimensions, and the position of the bubbles on the chart corresponds to the values on these axes. The size of each bubble represents the magnitude or weight of the third variable being analyzed.
This visualization technique is particularly useful when working with datasets that have multiple categories or dimensions. Bubble charts can help identify relationships between variables, detect clusters of data points, and pinpoint outliers. By customizing the color or transparency of the bubbles, you can add additional categorical or qualitative information to the visualization.
Power BI provides various customization options for bubble visuals. You can control the size of the bubbles, adjust their color and transparency, and add labels for better clarity. The tool also supports interactive features like tooltips and cross-filtering, allowing users to explore and interact with the data in more detail.
In summary, bubble visuals in Power BI offer a powerful and engaging way to visualize complex data sets. By representing three variables simultaneously, they enable users to identify patterns, trends, and relationships within the data. With its customization options and interactive features, Power BI empowers users to gain valuable insights and make data-driven decisions based on the information presented in bubble charts.
Keywords: Bubble Chart,Three dimensional,Four dimensional,HCLTech 4-Dimensional Bubble Chart

Name: Wordcloud by Powerviz
Description: Create a powerful and feature-rich Word Cloud with shapes, colors and advanced customizations
Long Summary: Create a powerful and feature-rich Word Cloud with shapes, colors and advanced customizations
Description Full:
Transform Data into insights. Create an impactful and eye-catching Word Cloud visual with Powerviz. It offers full customization options like Shapes, Colors, Directions and Text Style. To ensure quality of content, it has options to Exclude, Spilt Words By, Ranking and Conditional Formatting options.

A word cloud is a visual representation of text, where the size of word corresponds to its frequency or importance in the given content. It provides a quick and easy way to understand the key themes or topics present in a text. Word clouds are often used in presentations, reports, and data analysis to visually communicate patterns and emphasize important terms.

Check out the live demo here.

To access all advanced settings features, click the gear "⚙️" icon in the top-right corner.

Key Feature Highlights:

  • Word Options – Make your word clouds pop with personalized text styles. Change the appearance of the word cloud by adjusting the font style, size, number of characters, and spacing. Additionally split text column by special characters.
  • Direction – Control the orientation of words with 8 different styles.
  • Colors – 6 color schemes and 30+ color palettes including color-blindness safe options.
  • Shapes – Want to make a statement? Our Shapes feature allows you to create captivating word clouds. Choose from icons and images, or upload your own image or image URL.
  • Ranking – Filter out Top/Bottom N Word. Enable "Show words with same value" for inclusive ranking.
  • Exclude – Remove unwanted elements such as bad words, symbols, numbers and emojis from the text to create a clean and focused word cloud.
  • Conditional Formatting – Easily identify outliers based on measure or category rules.
  • Lasso/Reverse Lasso – Use them to select and deselected multiple words together.
  • Grid view – Transforms the visual into an interactive table. Use pivot mode, filter, search, and sort capabilities for quick data scanning.
  • Show condition – Show/hide the visual based on a condition.

Business Use Cases:

  1. Marketing: Word clouds can be used to analyze customer feedback, keywords for SEO, social media sentiment, or survey responses to identify key themes and understand customer preferences.
  2. Education: Word clouds can be used by teachers to help students identify and improve their writing skills. They can also be used to engage students in brainstorming sessions.
  3. Market Research: Word clouds enable market researchers to quickly analyze open-ended survey responses, customer opinions, sentimental analysis and identify recurring keywords or themes.
  4. Presentations and Reports: Word clouds serve as visually appealing elements in presentations and reports, capturing audience attention and summarizing information in an engaging manner.
  5. Data Analysis: Word clouds can be used to visually explore textual data. By identifying frequently mentioned words, patterns, or trends, analysts can uncover valuable insights and discover areas of improvement.
